F4j-J3Kn20-vkw_QFeKVlg.text: My coworker brought in bagels and cream cheese from this place today. Oh My Goodness! The bagels were so fresh! They were still warm from being made and the bagel itself was a big portion. Everyone in the office was in awe with these bagels. There were two types of cream cheese: Veggie and lox. I had never tried lox before today and am now in love. It does not have a super strong smoked taste which is good. The veggie is also delicious and actually has veggie chunks including carrots and cucumbers. The egg bagel was fabulous. I can't wait to go to the location and check out more menu items.

pMMnbDnM6xMAL7BuhAa8Ug.text: Best bagel place! It can get packed so expect a line and try to get there early in the day so you're not stuck with the leftover bagels that, although delicious, might not be exactly what you planned on ordering.

9ecNamWnTzVAjgkiLABFeQ.text: East coasters, cease your search to fill the bagel shaped hole in your belly, because this is it. Fresh, crisp, delicious. Mmmmm. The owner is very helpful and just generally seems to be a great guy. However, the place seems disorganized. I waited for the longest time to place my order and they are often out of most of their food hours before it closes.   Nevertheless, I would never recommend any other bagel spot to someone. Good. Food.

S9Jp1UxAAg_onMi2YLSWSg.text: Best bagels in town - hands down!! Friendly owner is very welcoming and accommodating. Atmosphere is NOT why you go here so don't be turned off by the aesthetics; you're there for the food, which is top notch.

1i7uCeaHaWXbmBC3dxioGg.text: Best thing I've eaten in Phoenix!  The lox are extraordinary, fresh amazing bagels!!!!  Great service as well!  Wish I could give it more stars.

9-Ph-MFYWUPrpU1-pRbWtQ.text: Easy 5 stars! We showed up for a couple bagels to find out that they were sold out but had a fresh batch baking that would be done in 15 minutes. We ran to the store and returned to fresh baked bagels unlike any other bagel we've ever had..literally melt in your mouth.   I will never be able to have a store bought bagel again thanks to the bagel man.   On another note the fresh made cream cheese is the perfect accompaniment. Do yourself a favor and get the everything bagel with scallion cream cheese, you're welcome.   Owner (I think) helped us and was great.  Already thinking about my next bagel experience at the bagel man.

pn5Fs2RCS8fZhUWHBCjMqw.text: Lived in the NYC area for 15 years, got used to a certain standard of bagels. The best I'd found in PHX since moving here in 2012 was Scott's Generations on 7th St. They were decent bagels, but not memorable. Just bought my first dozen at Bagel Man. Excellent, excellent. As good as my favorite place back east. They were still warm, as they should be. The scallion cream cheese I bought was also wonderful. So glad to have found this place. I'll be back, even though it's a 20 minute drive for me.

0oApucDCb8K7LAgYTLsGgQ.text: Amazing New York style bagels. Crispy thin crust, soft chewy dough. The breakfast bagel on an everything bagel is the way to go. Friendly service. I'll definitely be back.

XhBqXDYtVxayC61tbNXOVw.text: Love the Bagel Man - although some of the kids he has making the sandwiches can be slooooooooooooow, the food is tasty and the bagels are the perfect amount of crusty outside and tender inside that makes me miss NYC some kinda bad.  My husband and the owner chat about New York every time he goes in there, reminding us that there's more to life than grab your food and go - this is a neighborhood joint and repeat visitors are remembered and appreciated.  Although we typically go there for bagels and bialys (they run out QUICK!), the sandwiches are killer as well, particularly the Reuben.  The place is pretty small and in a nondescript shopping center on Elliott, so you'll probably want to grab your food and go.  Perfect for mornings when you want breakfast in a hurry and fast food joints aren't on the menu.

QcPaCXZH4PAB2cqOe1XyWA.text: Just off the boat from NYC looking for a good bagel saw reviews thought I would give it a try they are ok nothing special about it maybe its the best in the area like I said just off the boat but not worth my 40 min round trip drive will keep looking

YqMBXkitrT5ZtIE4ZrQQUQ.text: This place is amazing. Owner is friendly, food is amazing...nothing to complain about. I love this place. Want it everyday!!!

YXdDyCs_hWoknr0yHb_d7g.text: These are legit, old-school quality New York style bagels. The bacon egg and cheese bagel sandwich and The Sexy are my favorites. The bagels are all awesome and fresh and is just a matter of preference what you choose. Great,  prompt service,  delicious menu, friendly staff, good prices, what more can you want? This is my go-to bagel place, every time. I am never disappointed. Solid 5 stars.

dPrfYICpb4P3LM8B8NqiNQ.text: Hallelujah. Finally a decent bagel in this culinary wasteland that is Ahwatukee. No longer will I suffer the insult that is Einstein's or make my colleagues suffer along with me. It's Bagel Man for the office from now on.

Bw0NhQ_2g-J4QzyhIsi1zA.text: This place is great.  I am not sure if this place reads Yelp reviews or what... but anything negative that was said about this place is not the case today.  The place was spotless.  very very clean.  The people behind the counter were incredibly friendly and attentive of the customers that came through the door.  I was immediately greeted upon entering (even when he was helping another customer) and after ordering, my food was promptly made.    The bagels were great.  Nice size.  Crispy on the outside, doughy in the middle.  Significantly larger than other bagel stores.  The lox were fresh.  The cream cheese you can tell is homemade.   Overall, this will be the place I get bagels from now on.  This east coast Jew has found a winner.  Thank you bagel man.

tY_ouXy4Og6sTauSc6a5BA.text: Visiting out here in Phoenix and came to Bagel Man two days in a row. Had the sausage, egg, and cheese on plain bagel while hubby had lox over onion bagel. Super delish. Now that I'm back in Cali, my mouth is watering just thinking about this place. Good deal on bagels alone too!

KHYFOcwfo-aNia2uKEwfLA.text: Absolutely the best Bagels I have EVER had!  LOVE-LOVE-LOVE this  place, only wish they were closer to my house!

2SYi2tC9Fw3EmIkoRgmjkw.text: The best bagels and chive smear! The owner makes you feel like family and all other associates are always so friendly and helpful. I always recommend this place and literally the best everything begal you will ever find!

j2MWZVFpEmz-YrjuPvQTvg.text: Freshest bagels in the valley. Worth the drive to south Phoenix! Reminds me of a New York deli, it's busy, and delicious.

R41R3fhztsQYHqgDsTVFMA.text: I'm no bagel expert or connoisseur by any means; all I know is that the lox and cream cheese bagel is delicious every time I have it here. Price is fair, line is quick, and I always leave satisfied. There's nothing overly fancy or amazing that warrants five stars but I can't find any reason not to give it five stars either at this point.

giMcsXUBGFGF7JI8og5mJA.text: This place is amazing. I don't know that I have ever had a truly authentic bagel until visiting The Bagel Man. The owner, Kal, is so nice and friendly. He introduced himself to me and my husband and when I went back the next day with a friend, he remembered my name. Great service, food and the coffee is great too. I usually don't expect great coffee from the carafes but their coffee went great with my bagel breakfast sandwich. My only complaint was that it was a little hot in there, but combined with the fact that we live in Arizona and the big ovens, I'm going to have to cut them some slack. Great place and new favorite bagel spot!

1qgZQdeLrp7mfbnPx-qCfQ.text: Delicious. Best bagel place around the sandwiches are perfectly put together. The show off is my go to

ipxFItclcDQw-JQdHZ2t9Q.text: This place was amazing. Long line but worth the wait. Ordered their breakfast bagel with sausage and jalapeno spread. It was out of this world good. Felt like I flew to NYC for breakfast. Definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States

4rAZDkYhoK_r6gPyKDhgBA.text: Great food here, but my only complaint is that they don't write things down. I'm sure this would enhance the over customer experience because it seems like there is always confusion between the back and front. A simple marker would solve everything at this place. It would move the line faster and make it easier for literally everyone. Coming from Long Island I am a very harsh critic of egg sandwiches and bagels and can tell you that the food is great here.   This place would be the best in the state if it wrote down orders for everyone.

0dcZLHDQUpHGefcQsyPUPg.text: Delicious freshly baked bagels! The most friendly staff around. Best bagels in the Ahwatukee area and very fair prices.

pWRopC6-P4F9FMwwidc12g.text: My being a native New Yorker means I'm qualified to make this statement. This is the best bagel spot that I've found in the valley. I may or may not be proud of it, but with every visit here I'm eating at least two bagels. Keep it up Bagel Man. You put the TEN in Gluten.

KR7jbZARy-XNXWXZTLcOSg.text: Best bagels I've had in Phoenix!   I'm from the East Coast and LOVE bagels, but I was pretty disappointed with other places in the area until I tried The Bagel Man.  These are truly authentic tasting, felt like straight out of a deli from NY or NJ.    I had the everything bagel with cream cheese, lox, tomato, and onion.  The bagel was absolutely delish - crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside without being super thick.  This was exponentially better than Chompies and extremely well-priced.  The service was great!  I was in and out on a busy Sunday morning within a few minutes.  Also, I think it may have been the owner who waited on me, but he was so friendly and nice.  There were 2 other guys who took orders and they were also very friendly.  Great customer service.  Will definitely be back.  If you live anywhere near Ahwatukee definitely support a local business like this one.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Everything w/ lox, cream cheese, tomato, and onion.  DELICIOUS!!

HmdsqbJt0LK0B_qmZPsOVg.text: I've been here multiple times and never had one bad experience with this place. The owners and staff here are super friendly, pleasant, and welcoming.   The shop decor isn't anything fancy. Just a typical authentic NYC bagel shop with fresh bagels made daily, a variety of awesome cream cheeses and toppings, pleasant Jewish owners, diverse staffing and random black and white photos of NYC landmarks. Every time I step into this shop, it feels like I just teleported myself to NYC.   Great food, awesome people, perfect NYC ambient. The best part is the price you pay is so not NYC! Looking forward to trying out more items on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon and egg on everything bagel. Perfect to start your day right!

5zM0VJX-kDQr9s8oaKsFsA.text: This place isn't anything fancy, it's small but their food is ABSOLUTELY amazing, and, I will not lie, it's warm inside which I don't mind because, well fresh bagels, enough said. Favorite visit was a couple days, I had started work at 5a, so taking my lunch at 9a is annoying because not everywhere is serving lunch at that time of day. I walked in and nervously asked the lady, should've gotten her name, if they served lunch. She smiled at me and said, "I can do anything." I got so happy and ordered "The Sexy" but with no herb mayo because I can't stand mayo, AT ALL. So she asked, "Would you like to substitute the herb CREAM CHEESE instead?" I got even more happy and asked, "You can do that?" She smiled and repeated herself, "I can do anything." Needless to say, I was super happy about it and let me just say, that SANDWICH was f*cking phenomenal. I hate 5am shifts but I would do it again because now I know where to go for a 9a lunch, permanently.

CuoLh-E7GEbIZnlNiCZN1g.text: Best bagels I've had outside of New Jersey hands down. Took me a few years to discover this place and I'm glad I did. They know how to do it right. They also are the only ones I've seen with taylor ham (aka pork roll) out side of Jersery.

MwXS8OfGGav2P2A_K4hVrQ.text: Came to the Bagel Man looking for a new breakfast spot and was anything but disappointed.   The freshness of the bagels along with the varieties was both impressive and delicious.  I ordered an egg, cheese, bacon bagel sandwich for $4 and i love the option of adding tomatoes/onions at no cost.  An ice coffee is $1.99.  Overall, you'll be left satisfied with an excellent meal for $6.  I will be a frequent customer from now on.

hdH329tYltD6HX-WSogHZA.text: 5 stars for the delicious bagels: my fave: Lox sandwich 5 stars for the very affordable prices 5 stars for the supberb service!

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lox Sandwich and cinnamon walnut bagel= both sooo delicious!

aiTH6Fs_JJtWND3xEyP1DQ.text: Really good bagels! First time here and staff was really nice. Ended up leaving with a dozen of bagels!

ixSgLn8wyB5l3BZpN_e1RA.text: The only thing better than the food is the outstanding customer service. The people behind the counter are so friendly and helpful.

Ivm3S2zytBzMoqNeNSwn4Q.text: Everyday I wake up dreaming about these bagels! This is the place to be!  The bagel man is such a hard working guy and is always welcoming to every customer that comes in. He is there pretty much everyday and has a hard working crew too.  The bagels here are seriously the best bagels I have ever had. I have even visited New York and these are on par if not better. Top cream cheese spread would have to be the scallion but the Lox comes in a close second for me. As for bagels, the salt bagel is the best I have ever had.   The prices are great and it's a great pick me up early in the morning. I'm already looking forward to tomorrow morning just so I can have a bagel.

n8oAcIJ-_uW9U0LATqSnKw.text: Friendly atmosphere and staff.  I got a bagel sandwich and it tasted good, but wasn't my favorite.  This spot does seem pretty popular, though!

t6q6To7a1ju-PBmu7tgFJg.text: I can't believe I've never rated this place. I've been coming here for years. These are the BEST bagels in Phoenix. The outsides are tough but the insides are soft and chewy. The service is amazing. They remember regulars and what they order. You can get a breakfast sandwich and a coffee for $6.  Can't beat that.

zI_VjC6oHxdSOUg_15SPcA.text: This is seriously the worst bagels I've ever had. I honestly didn't think you could possibly mess up a bagel but I was wrong. The bagels were so stale and we even had mold on some. Honestly don't even waste your money here you are better off going somewhere else.

VQrjRcEQz4ag-Lgxsedj1g.text: I'm from NY and this place is right up there with a good old NYC bagel with a schmear!  It's a taste of home, quick & easy, super friendly, and not expensive at all. Thank you Bagel Man for knowing what life is

4gv1mTaByztgsZMSwS8jEw.text: The Bagel man.... Our group was visiting AZ and I decided that I would use Yelp to find an awesome breakfast place. Well, the Bagel man came up and ... because we don't have many great bagel places in Hawaii, we jumped at the chance! After riding our luxurious bus to the strip mall, we see "The Bagel Man" right in front of us! It's PACKED!!!!!!!!!  A GOOD SIGN! We go in and stand in line chatting excitedly and this guy bumps into me and says "sorry" - it's the THE Bagelman!!!!! I told everyone "hey the Bagel man bumped into me"!!!!!! OK, not many bagels left - because it's close to 12 and they close at 12. Still, several options to choose from. How did it taste? Well, it was great! Different from some other bagels I usually eat on the mainland - a little lighter with a good bite. Perhaps not as chewy, but still great! Someone else ordered a walnut bagel and it was incredible. I had the breakfast bagel and it was very good - excellent. The coffee was standard diner fare but got the job done.  The workers are FUNNY! I can't repeat what they said, but hang around and you hear funny stuff over and over!  Next time I go back, the Bagel Man will be on my list again!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This was really really really good!!!!!
Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good breakfast!

lAPfO3Cbe56KlAUeqP4nmg.text: Finally checked this place out and glad we did! Yummie fresh bagels and homemade cream cheese! We both got breakfast sandwiches one with sausage and one with bacon, everything was quick and super tasty. The owner and the staff were all very friendly and worked quickly to get our order in. The line was sort of long, but the wait went by extremely quick. If you want a fresh yummie bagel I would highly recommend checking this place out plus I feel it's hard to find places these days with great customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. He ate his first 1/2 quicker than I could take the picture haha. Plain bagel and jalapeño cream cheese + egg and sausage.
Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh and delicious! Everything bagel with jalapeño cream cheese + eggs and bacon.

pPaNSxGf25G3MWHvv-jdpw.text: A great bagel is hard to find west of the Northeast. The Bagel Man produces bagels the follow the traditional method of boiling the dough before finishing it off in the oven. It's what provides the shiny and crispy exterior that covers the soft and chewy moist dough on the inside. A bagel that is simply baked is nothing more than baked bread..........and should never be referred to as a bagel. This was a great Yelp find and I'm sure to return whenever we are in the area.

VqO1Fg2Pkmok7Tak7XTGJw.text: Real bagels. Not rolls shaped like bagels you usually get in Arizona. I grew up in Detroit. I missed bagels from back East . . . Until the arrival of The Bagel Man. The owner has an original shop back in Jersey. That should say it all about authenticity.   If you want a real bagel, check this place out. Never understood why people from the East love bagels?  One visit here will explain it.

2V3g5b8wIgSyF7PCXuchhQ.text: If you're looking for an authentic, east coast style bagel, go to East Coast Bagels on Southern at McClintock (near the Goodwill). They close early in the afternoon, but they're so much better.

C5O6Pi4YsLfQcSAv4HTshg.text: I have never been a fan of Bagel until I met the Bagel Man. Yum, Yum, Yum! These are extremely dangerous due to their addicting nature. I've limited my visits to once a week and spend the other six thinking about my next visit. See you in a few days!

L6UYWSI7XEkWZtsk7FnNCQ.text: Excellent bagels that tasted very much like the NY bagels we enjoy back home !  The owner is very friendly and the service is efficient .  I would definitely recommend this place :)

BVs0NkCtp4FO22STJtMsXA.text: BEST BAGELS I have had in Phoenix.  Ok, I don't know much about bagels but my roommate does.  This place not only has excellent bagels they have exceptional service.  He said the only way to tell if a bagel is good is to get the bagel of your choice with plain cream cheese.  He picked everything and since I don't much care for bread I ordered nothing.  While he waited for his bagel he asked for water the owner told him take any cup and help yourself to ice Tewa if you like.  Excellent business practice!  The bagel arrived and looked perfect, nicely toasted with a healthy helping of smear.  I took my fourth of his bagel and enjoyed every bite.  As we sat in the parking lot we decided what the heck it's practically lunch, and headed right back in for a bagel sandwich.  As we were trying to decide what to order the clerk said there was no reason to split the sandwich his half meat my half veggie because he would give me a free sandwich!  So I had the everything bagel all veggies and fresh mozzarella cheese....delish!!  He has a grilled chicken with roasted peppers, bacon and herb aoli.  Also a total win!  Now, I don't like to eat bread because it leaves me feeling sluggish but not these bagels.  I felt great and full of energy all day.  Now do I expect a free bagel every time? Nope.  But the Bagel Man has 2 new customers.  4 stars for yummy chewy, crispy outside, flavorful bagels and the extra star for over-the-top exceptional customer service.  Making plans to go back tomorrow......yum!

QGJg0pu144Hn3_zkVJJ3Yg.text: Two days in Phoenix so far, two days at The Bagel Man.  Outstanding bagels and crumb cake!  Friendly and efficient service, and incredible value.  For $5 and change, I had a gargantuan Egg Bagel with scrambled eggs, cheese and ham, and equally massive crumb cake!  Who needs lunch?!  This will easily last me until dinner.  See you tomorrow - going to give the Onion Bagel a try.  There was a wait for it yesterday!

3C7DPWYMQABq7fxOCZgnJA.text: The Bagel Man has THE BEST lox bagel in Arizona. You are missing out if you haven't stopped in.

1GtzyejkBCDcLZN1d0Z1Ow.text: Just like Jersey bagels! Love that I can get my old favorite, Salt Bagel with Veggie Cream cheese. I took a star off for not having Light CC and the drink selections are pretty lame.

MZ3VBJmru2fQikAkDDZBLg.text: Went here for Sunday breakfast around 11am. The wait was not long and the bagels we ordered were fantastic; fresh and authentic. Prices are reasonable-paid ~$16 for 3 breakfast sandwiches, a bagel w/ cream cheese, and 2 drinks. Highly recommend as an area source of nourishment!!

1m6Na4soKGrNQHa-Ieotjg.text: Bagel with Lox I had here was the BIGGEST one I have ever had in my life in Midwest life, East Coast life, and West Coast life all combined. It was HUGE with the most generous amount of lox and other stuff in it - like a lox explosion! I couldn't believe it.  And it was tasty.

368B8kquXmlhJaFozmH32Q.text: We've been here a handful of times now, and continue to fall in love every time.  The bagels are the best we've ever had, and are paired with amazing meats and cheeses.  I've never had a bagel in New York, but I'm hopeful that this is what everybody is talking about. It's certainly what we're talking about!

p4l9ikHmTb-LKrQq1fFvEg.text: These are the best bagels I've ever had, including bagels from NYC and Montreal! The shop is kind of hidden away, but it's worth the search. Very quick, very tasty.

wmqN3zkqaKF4Jr4mKpTBHw.text: Freshly made bagels every day with a New York flair definitely a great spot for breakfast or lunch! Personal favorite is the "show off"

qF8e66R3ns_5uavA4y82bQ.text: Good bagels for Phoenix. Much better than Einstein's or Chompies.

0WVwDe5481eVVD0TrQV0NQ.text: I've always loved bagel sandwiches for breakfast and am so glad I found this place on Yelp! I've been to The Bagel Man twice now for a bacon, egg, and cheese on everything and both times it was excellent! I just moved to Tempe a month ago, but don't think I'll even bother trying other bagel shops. This one already has my heart with its bagel perfection and timely / friendly service.

azYEhpONIesgbyzUozkijw.text: I often travel and there it is such a treat when I find a hidden gem.  The Bagel Man has forever changed my expectations of the Bagel.  Best I've ever had.   And the service proves they love what they do.

uX-PRykAH_1RJPNCkt9aJQ.text: Heaven in my mouth. Best bagels in AZ, always fresh. I know bagels pretty well being from NJ. They actually have Taylor Ham... Mind blown. Now that I know this place exists I will be editing some reviews I left for other bagel shops because they have alot to live up to now.

qnuPzfqMWyUeSqgUJAX_DQ.text: When a New York City native tells you this is a AUTHENTIC bagel shop, you have done many things right! Love this place.

g9jtMhCXLWSncIxQTWIdSw.text: I can't add anything different from other reviews. These are THE best bagels in Arizona. They are made on-site and are served straight off the rack.   Smiling faces and top notch service. They treat everyone like a friend, offering the best service and food that they can.

cXUAg3QsFOY7WIjKdKg57g.text: Best East Coast bagel in Arizona (and I'm from Jersey). Not sure if there's something in the water, but the bagels are PERFECT - light and fluffy on the inside but with the perfect crisp on the outside. Top favorites: lox bagel, chive cream cheese, everything bagel, but really everything is delicious.  To top it off, The Bagel Man himself is the sweetest guy. Make sure to grab a slice of coffee cake on your way out!

26MnY-P3P0jUMQltSzJe1A.text: Ride the pillowing waves of dough into the ether with Bagel Man. This delicately crunchy bagel is a direct gift from the gods. Bless up

NiFh9wJgEGFSIjn5qKULKw.text: The best bagels this side of New York! That comes from a New Yorker who has not enjoyed a bagel since moving to Phoenix. This place is the real deal!

DFrmEhaaXyLZYqB9HP4xYQ.text: Place is a whole in the wall but those are always the best places. Bagels area great and the breakfast sandwiches are the best. Cool to see them making the bagels in the back and just dumping them into baskets out front.

XGe7Hmz0gEdiaF-pr3Iu6A.text: The ONLY real bagel in Phoenix as far as we're concerned. Authentic Penn Station/NYC/Jersey style bagel with a smear. All other bagels in Phoenix are just a warm bread substitute.

XAos8mzDquIB_Ii5YVtqDA.text: Great bagels and friendly service! Even though there can be a wait sometimes it is worth it.

eO0mheqC64N3UEqOwF0hyw.text: Oh my goodness!  I stopped in for an "Everything" bagel. I saw them and decided on two. One for that day and one for the next. Boy am I glad I did!  These are THE MOST DELICIOUS bagels I have ever had!  Fresh, warm and simply amazing.

zsOYRCeh9U4eWPGmKzR7aQ.text: Love this local shop. They've let me mix and match my cream cheeses on my toasted bagel so I can try two flavors each time. They cut in half and have one flavor on each side. I especially like salt bagel (hard to find done this well outside of nyc) with the jalapeno cream cheese.

j4vpfCiCP_WQnbUJ-7IrwQ.text: The Bagels taste so good they make you wanna slap your momma!! Long line, no worries very fast service.

RVi7hckw39PGlHw3gpf1mg.text: One of my co workers brought in bagels from this place today and I have never had such a good bagel.  I thought a bagel was a bagel. But no way this was delish.

cpphfI7sX-huS1XxVVfYhQ.text: Overall: good bagels, great customer service, and fair prices.  When we arrived there was a bit of a line but it moves quickly. We went maybe about 45 minutes before close and they still had plenty of bagel options to choose from.  My husband got the lox bagel and it was extremely delicious... you will end up craving this constantly.  I got the egg breakfast bagel and it wasn't as great.    We will definitely return.

A-EhO3BoLc4-JGAqbZxAWw.text: I have been to numerous bagel places in Arizona and this place tops them all. You wanna NJ Bagel living in AZ you ain't getting it anywhere else but here. Runs a great operation

4o-6NE0ykzzIAzHxf4I8zw.text: My favorite thing about this place is the people who work here. They are so friendly and kind, above what you find at most restaurants. They even check to make sure you're enjoying your food if you eat there. The bagels are fresh and delicious and I recommended this place for breakfast or a quick lunch.

tzD5RX4RKJbFYRcbfnse5A.text: I wake up early and drive out of my way in the morning just to get myself a Taylor ham egg and cheese on an everything from this place. I visit NJ and NY often and I believe this shop is comparable to shops there. When I read bad reviews for this place I wonder what happened because I always have a great experience

bQwiM9kfuAbH0uxy2oidIw.text: The bagel man is the best place to go if you have refined bagel taste buds! My friends bring me bagels from this spot all the time but I decided to finally go for myself after the gym (it's literally right next to EOS). The owner is a hilarious guy from the east coast, I told him it was my first time in person and he said it definitely won't be my last! And he was right! These bagels are delicious! Everything bagel with ham and egg is bomb but anything you get their will blow your bagel loving mind!

aQ4-f4mkRfWkUNnvpzUD-w.text: Second time here and it didn't disappoint. This time I ordered the jalapeno bagel with veggie cream cheese. The veggie cream cheese had pieces of cucumber and carrots and it was so delicious!  My coworkers got the everything bagel with jalapeno cream cheese and devoured it all. Like the veggie cream cheese, the jalapeno cream cheese all has pieces of jalapenos in it.. get ready for a kick!  It's a small shop with a couple tables outside, absolutely hot in there if you go when it's already 90 degrees outside at 730am, but definitely worth it.   I'd come back again the next time I visit Arizona.

n6GxzwyHU0AW_PkU4L-xyg.text: These bagels are straight up delicious and on par with the bagels I used to eat when I lived in New York and New Jersey. There's nothing spectacular about their set up, but this is the place where you go for an awesome bagel, nothing more and nothing less.

LIXF3BTr1iV6gXWyiDdjQw.text: I cant believe this place has been open since 2000! The best giant bagels in Az! The last time I had a Real Bagel was in NYC and this place is better! THEY HAVE THE BEST SALT BAGLE AND FRESH CREAM CHEESE!!  It was my first visit, but no way I'm going anywhere else!!!

WgyZpwRHW6-KGKDAPtWrmw.text: What Diet? I threw my low carb lifestyle out the window and had absolutely no regrets.  It was so good I am going back again tomorrow, get yourself a bagel or two and don't forget coffee to go with it.  Super fast efficient service too.

Www63UGyEgxaNrBhBthp3w.text: Love this spot! It gets quite busy so time is needed to stand in line but the bagels are worth it. There aren't any fancy gourmet options like Einstein's but that's what I like abt this place. The bagels are traditional, fresh and fluffy good! Desserts are from the east coast and that coffee cake!   The staff is quite friendly and prices are def reasonable ;)

2UmFT-eac5nXGzADGBfNyA.text: Absolutely love The Bagel Man. The owner learned my name after the third visit ha, nicest guy in the world. My girlfriend is from New Jersey and she was dying for a good bagel place. We tried many here in the valley and bagel man is definitely the best. Gotta love that pork roll!

rbZr7fIB17CdLmK7E18PWw.text: Adventures in Bagels. As often as they may be good, they are not good. Inconsistency is not a good thing in business, especially for a restaurant. In any event, I do not believe they are first boiled like a real N.Y. bagel should be. If they are, something else is wrong. At the busiest times they may be out of the most popular styles. Not good when you are anticipating your meal. On one occasion, Owner was out of change and actually told me he would "Catch me Next Time:. Really?  If anything, he should have offered to undercharge me by the difference, and not the opposite. Also, if you need a receipt be ready to give out your email address, cause that is the ONLY way to get one. Not even sure this is Legal! Should be given the option of a hard copy at time of service, OR, emailed at your choice. Bagels may be good at times, but, too many other important things are off putting.

a63JGvURZRefp4ayIuzJTg.text: A drive from chandler to the "bagel man" well worth the time.   I actually met Cal this morning, and he showed me his bagel making operation. Can't get any fresher than this.

pHMK9ZDAjQehlrWrGL6Tng.text: Due to the many positive ratings here we did expect the best ! And we were not disappointed. Delicious bagels ! Friendly service. Keep it up !

BtmRKT4ddhFLGKhW7Jmdgg.text: It's been a little while since I've been here, but I seriously love the bagels they serve. I normally just get un-toasted bagels to go. Definitely try their Lox Spread! Got it on a toasted everything bagel last time - awesome! The coffee cake is also super moist and perfect.   I see that some people have critiqued the service. I agree that it can be a little awkward, but I've always gotten what I wanted and been served well. One time a girl working there messed my order up, but the Bagel Man stepped in, fixed my order, and let me keep the stuff she messed up. The awkward part was that he yelled at her about it in front of me. Either way, the bagels are bomb!

pOi36EpuDI4s2vxx2ejWFw.text: All I can say is that my experience with bagels up to this point has been just absolutely sad. Now that I know how delicious a freshly made bagel can be I am forever changed. My husband and I recently moved from California to Texas and we have had to make two road trips in the span of 2 months to get all of our crap moved. We made a point to stop at this place both times instead of taking the Phoenix Bypass that would save us time on our trip. The food is THAT good here. I love their cheese bagel with the scallion cream cheese spread. My husband has gotten two different bagel sandwiches. Both were delicious. The service is really great here too. The owner is a really friendly dude that seems to genuinely care about his customers. I am really sad that we don't live closer to this place, but you best believe we will stop by on any future road trips. It's probably also a good thing that I don't live too close to this place because I would probably eat their bagels uncontrollably every day if I did!

VPsdO2dV4fTWwIS0xgnuiw.text: There is nothing that compares anywhere else in AZ! One bite and you are instantly in NYC. Also the only place you can get an egg bagel!! BEC on an egg bagel is pure heaven! Worth the drive from anywhere!!! (Caution: closed on Mondays!)

lwPk219dY9-jwtvZXJMN5g.text: The best bagels in Ahwatukee.  The staff is always friendly and helpful even when they are busy.

y3A6YXvYBcEyh05A9mRl_w.text: I love this place,  I feel like I'm back east walking into a bagel shop... This is the real deal. For all the people that think Einsteins Bagels are good... Come experience what a real bagel and bagel shop is... and you NEVER toast a bagel!

qws9K9aFbkVrG4-zJi61gg.text: Got bagels to go to eat back at our hotel. Only one order out of the four ordered were correct. Immediate fail in our book.

QbgWxOJu5k1E2i7C9WlF4w.text: Delish!!  The best bagel I've ever had.  We tried, cheese, plain, jalepeno and everything.   All have great flavor and texture.  The egg sandwiches are great too.  Friendly service and reasonable price for a big bagel.  We'll be back!

v9pjMEVcWtJSlpzsJoBzTA.text: Went all out with sliced lox, tomato, onion, and capers. Reminded me of Sabels in NYC. Great service too!

22ZdEbz5E9BWJGD7S2MG0g.text: Great bagels, and being from NYC's Upper West Side I should know.

FZaVk1BqX84Vzzs7NI8gtw.text: Make sure you get here early! They sell out of bagels throughout the morning, and the best ones always go first. They make their own cream cheese in house and they are all amazing. Their breakfast bagel sandwiches are also very good, and a great price for the quality that you are getting. Their staff is super personable, and helped recommend items on the menu for us to get and cream cheese/bagel pairings. Can't wait to go back!

HRwZAOA1FeYSoOK294CE3A.text: Firstly, you know you're doing things right if your friends live across the street from the Bagel Man and they take you every time you come to town! Second you know you're going to have a good day once you are eating the delicious bagels and food there! And lastly you know the world is right when a kind gentleman comes up and buys you your entire lunch!  All fun aside, the Bagel Man has some of the best bagels I've ever had in my life. And coming from a Jew I think that means a lot! I always have the egg bagels if they have them in stock but I dare you to try anything there and tell me it's not good. The quality of the food is perfect. The staff and owner are incredibly lovely, friendly and personable. Makes me wish I lived just across the street!   Thanks Bagel Man! (And the guy who bought me my lunch!)

CmhDBAfkTMkQNX_E4ASjiQ.text: Still love this place just as much. It's convenient and locally owned, affordable, variety, and consistent! Thanks to Kal and his quality (and quality staff), you always know you're gonna get a great breakfast or lunch!

5BCI-jL2ZvakIAbI0jkEBg.text: Hearty bagels NY/NJ style. Tried the cinnamon raisin which was toasted and loaded with honey walnut cream cheese . Tasted divine but was too much for one person. The place could get a little clean up but it attracts more of a fast moving regular crowd who come in for their morning breakfast bagel and don't care about the ambience or place! It's a good stop to get a quick bite.

M_wsyrszxojeD3i_KafpfA.text: This I probably one of my favorite egg sandwich shops we stop here a lot to pick up something and they are so quick

AdZT713H0VAOjl_CEIw4bg.text: The owner is great. He made the experience really enjoyable. The bagels are sooo yummy. The macaroni salad I wouldn't recommend but the crumb cake is so amazing!

5FfbRxwjEQdLTPMu2Psb9g.text: I saw this place on yelp and had very high expectations for a quality bagel place that beats out Einstein Bagels.. This place definitively exceeded expectations!  The bagels were so soft and moist and flavorful and on top of that the customer service was excellent. The cook gave us a mini tour in the back where they boil the bagels in house fresh before baking them!   I ordered an everything bagel with cream cheese and a small coffee and my boyfriend got a cheese bagel with butter. Both of us ate for under 7 bucks and we left with full happy tummys :)

XxomslEKpdQrwZEfficTVQ.text: Like whoa.  Best bagels in Arizona.  No question.  Bagels are probably my favorite food.  I take them very seriously.  But I don't eat them very often because most bagels in the Phoenix area are so mediocre it's just not worth it.  Bagel Man bagels are incredible.  We went there on Saturday to pick up a dozen and the everything bagels had just come out of the oven.  OMG.  Fresh, piping hot, soft, flavorful - PERFECT.  And the veggie cream cheese is also amazing.  I wish we lived closer but then I might eat 5 bagels a day.  Maybe it's good we're a few miles away.    Can't wait to go back.  Oh and I love The Bagel Man himself - he's legit.

FI9BwztjB5SiTci12nO5hg.text: Best bagels in town! Baked fresh everyday. Lots of variety, and several flavors of cream cheese. The breakfast and lunch sandwiches are unique and taste great. Excellent friendly customer service and fun atmosphere. The owner is awesome and so is the staff.

sKrYT-lLUMOXsQDBmgVNTA.text: Always a great place to start your day! Bagels are fresh and made the New York way!! Once you try these bagels, you'll keep coming back!!  I always get the sausage, egg and cheese breakfast sandwich on an everything bagel.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bagels are always fresh and tasty. If you want an authentic New York bagel, this is the only place to come to (other that NYC).

gleSqkUmbF_1KInsH9z3ZQ.text: The food deserves 5 stars, but the layout of the shop and lack of information for first-time visitors on how to order took 1 star away. The bagels are delicious and pretty large. I had lox and eggs on a plain bagel and my son had a chocolate chip bagel with plain cream cheese. I will definitely come back next time I'm in the area.

l_9uUwqUHT3qBWk5B3mD6Q.text: Definitely delicious. I hear it's an authentic New York bagel, but it doesn't seem that different from most other bagels, aside from Einsteins but that's the wonder bread of bagels. I love their everything bagel with lox cream cheese. Yummy!

bKAbYoND1Jd4N3YDbl4XPQ.text: Nice folks working the lunch shift and keeping on top of everything, including keeping the place clean.   The bagels had a nice crust and flavor, but it feels like they might not have adjusted the recipe for warmer summer temps yet. The bagels we got were on the pillowy side, maybe having had too much rise. I'd like more chew and density from a place with NYC pedigree.

FRH_B7_pynVu_LFlmfFmXw.text: Forget Einstein's! These are real bagels that hold True to their promise that they're like the bagels back east. The owner is so welcoming, and will help you with the many many options! I'll be back for sure

nN7J4elOFWw7K5J8VCQ7KA.text: Amazing. I had lox on an everything bagel with the works. The bagel was fresh out of the oven and still warm. The amount of lox was very generous. Best bagel I've had in Arizona. Highly recommend. Also, I loved how they cut it in half :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Everything bagel with cream cheese, lox, capers, red onions and tomatoes

wKWH2ILN7RKwR86Ct7ILRg.text: Much to my surprise, this was one of the two best bagels I have ever eaten, out of probably thousands all over the U.S.  Perfect combination of crunchy crust and chewy interior.   Obviously impeccably boiled.  (The other one was at the Bagel Snack in Pompano Beach, FL)

z0dsaEU_Gm4IxEx3b6ZMgQ.text: I've never had a bagel as good as the everything bagel here! This is such a nice place, kinda hidden away in the corner of a strip mall in an old Baskin-Robbins.

HL5E-505V3PijLBOA2c_0g.text: Fantastic bagels!  I want to give this place 5 stars, based on the bagels, but my experience there was a little off, so I'm reserving it at 4 for now.  I had a strong craving for a bagel sandwich one day at work, so I decided to check out this place. I walked in and wasn't overly impressed with the place. It's a little run down and not the cleanest place. It's a small place, with only a couple of tables (but there aren't many people sitting down to eat here, I suppose). I came around 12:30 or 1:00 in the afternoon, and I immediately noticed there were not many bagels left in the racks. The group before me got the last of a couple different varieties of bagels, so I was pretty limited with my options.  I was thinking breakfast bagel sandwich, but I ended up going with one of the lunch sandwiches instead. Cinnamon raisin was the best of the remaining options, in my opinion, so I went with it. It was perhaps an odd combination with the red peppers and turkey on my sandwich, but oh well. When I got my sandwich, the bagel had been perfectly toasted. The texture was great! A little crunch on the outside, and nice and tender on the inside. This bagel truly was great. The sandwich toppings were decent, but as it should be at a bagel shop, the bagel was by far the star of the show. I'm definitely going to come back for more, and I may just do that cinnamon raisin bagel again for a sandwich, because it really was good.  I definitely will be back for a breakfast sandwich. There is little better for breakfast than a nice bagel sandwich. And with these bagels, I can only imagine...  The service was friendly, but spotty. When I ordered from the cashier, he kept gazing off in different directions and seemingly forgetting what he was doing. He definitely seemed distracted. I had to remind another of the guys of what I had ordered a couple of times. But in the end, I got what I ordered, and it was great.  Had I had more bagel options and the service been better, this place is a 5. I'll give it another chance in the future.  Thanks, Bagel Man!

YfcJo2THt1m5G-QNm1tRXw.text: Outstanding bagels, great service.  A bagel joint in Phoenix deserves credit just for making actual bagels. Some of the popular spots in Phoenix -- e.g. Chompie's -- don't make real bagels. They're just "rolls with holes", just common bread. A bagel is distinctive in its chewy texture and unique flavor.  For reference, Einsteins and Back East Bagels will give you real bagels, far better than Chompie's. Bagel Man is better still. They don't just make real bagels -- they make good bagels. Best I've had anywhere in the Tempe, Ahwatukee, Mesa, Chandler area.

st9Y-K7Gb-JQpG_38T8gpw.text: A coworker made a stop on his way to work and brought in a dozen for the office. I must say I haven't had this much amazing goodness of a bagel in a long time. Even a plain bagel is so light fluffy and the outside has crustiness that is perfect. They are also not your average size bagels, they are huge. The shmear omg I cannot even describe it, so good I can even just eat it all by itself. I haven't had this good of a bagel since I lived in NY. Gonna have to walk in and check this out myself. I heard there was a bit of a line in the morning, but all worth it.

hhs5BcNpmZLpLQL5JswSbQ.text: Bagels are delicious. The bread is thick and chewy, and I am definitely a fan. The owner is very friendly and staff is extremely helpful. Location is tucked away in a shopping center on the south side of Elliot Road just west of the I-10.

vKhi8gaf7TLs0p95FqTP3A.text: First let me tell you my theory about NY bagels.  I left NYC in 1958 so my recall is of that era.  The last True bagel bakers were unable to interest their grandchildren to become bakers and the "art" slowly morphed from the '40s - '50s style to the 21st century, baked by non-Jewish bakers of other origins. Yes they still boiled and then baked but were different.  Not not good or great but a new style for a new people.  We love things based on good memories and the current younger population likes their newer style of bagel, hence the great reviews that I can't agree with as I am (a long retired New Yorker longing for the bagels of yore:)  To me a bagel always has a distinct hole in it's center, a shiny, tough, and lightly crunchy rich brown crust and a chewy dense interior.  I thought that Bruegger's Bagels came close.  They are gone from our area but still in Tucson. Bagelman's bagels taste good, they are however not what I expected and hence not a NY bagel to ME! Their Bialy however is too dense, as their bagel is not dense enough.   To all the young folk out there (born less than 50 years ago), you will love Bagelman's baking!!! Mr. Bagelman, keep it up, you are indeed pleasing those you need to please!

yZGL2I6fgJnfV5EIkbXhvw.text: This is BY FAR my favorite place for breakfast. I wish I was exaggerating. My boyfriend and I go here several times a week. Great bagels. Quick service. Wonderful people. They are always so friendly and it is just a great way to start the day.

s7FeOk-TfxEDON8cfMAs_A.text: Note to self:  Don't look at Bagel Man on Yelp when you're hungry.  First tried the Bagel Man after a coworker brought in bagels one morning and I demanded to know where these heavenly bagels were prepared.  He pointed me to The Bagel Man, which happens to be close to my house.  I drug my husband here one Saturday morning for bagel sandwiches.  We walked out with a ham, egg and cheese everything bagel and a sausage egg and cheese everything bagel.  We ordered a couple of extra bagels to go as well and enjoyed them at home.  The restaurant itself is tiny, packed, and hot on a Saturday morning, but the service was quick and the bagels are worth it!

sZ1hV1GskEcQs0LfDtodBg.text: I'm not sure what all the hype is about this place. I was looking forward to a good New York style bagel after reading all the good reviews. However I was a bit disappointed by the bagel itself, it was a little doughy. I got a ham egg and cheese bagel sandwich and they kinda of skimp on the ham and eggs. Their cream cheese was good though and you can tell they make it in house. Overall it was good for the price but I probably wouldn't come back.

f3UANvip2Io7rFPWYkzXkw.text: This is the best bagel place I've ever been to. The owner is super nice and the bagels and cheese are both fresh. Nothing else compares to this.

aHnNmiuHBul8leCPipEl0A.text: The bagels are great. Small place, Boars Head meats and plenty of it on my sandwich

Ww769JuRpk8hpFab_TyutQ.text: Decided to grab a quick breakfast here, tried to call in but they don't do phone orders which is a bummer but still decided to give em a shot.    Ordered a sausage, egg, & cheese on a honey wheat bagel.   Employees are friendly, was a good breakfast sandwich. Don't think you could go wrong with a breakfast sandwich though. But fast service was a plus esp since you can't order ahead.   Good choice for a quick on the go breakfast
