Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Store hours as of summer 2017
Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States

3-Pckp-iVQ4nIc0nR0_noQ.text: Bagels were hot and fresh. The service was unbelievably fast and prices were good! Will be back when I'm on this side of town again.

UguOwmCKgH_-ik27cTwpFA.text: This place is legit New York Bagels complete with the friendly New Yorker attitude. Great guy working the register and the rest of the staff were friendly as well. Had the Egg Bacon and Cheese on Everything Bagel. Whole lot of food and the value is much better than the Bagel Chain places around.

QGqhwU3iKPs5jNPQTQg2ig.text: I was craving bagels that are like in New York, soft and fluffy on the inside but nice golden on top! And I found this place on yelp and it had great reviews so I had to check it out!  The bagels are amazing here! These are the top bagels that I've had in AZ and they are quite similar to bagels that are in New York! The inside of the bagels were soft and fluffy but had a nice crunch on the outside! There weren't many bagels left for us to get so we got the plain, onion, and the everything bagel with the scallion cream cheese!  It was so delicious and would have to try their bagel breakfast sandwiches next time!

_49IJn03agaSTg2TXpHDZA.text: This was my go to for bagels in the valley even though it was a shlep. However, he seems to have lost his way. Looks more like The Bread Man now. The bagels have gotten too big and have lost their shape and consistency.   I'll give it another go in about a month and see if things improve.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #notabagel
Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #notabagel
Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. #notabagel

31dN-vicS3WUXdOdnsMRgA.text: Little hidden gem! I have had this spot booked mark for sometime now and finally made it to try out!  Very small bagel spot in a large strip mall.  I would say mostly take out in terms of eating, with a few tables outside. Let me preface this by saying I'm from Long Island where we take bagels very seriously!! So I was stoked when I saw the good reviews about this place.    I ordered cinnamon raisin bagel with veggie cream cheese ( don't knock it till you try it). I was pleasantly surprised, the cinnamon raisin had lots of flavor and the veggie cream cheese had crisp veggie chunks in it which it great!!   I ordered 6 bagels to go of other flavors and those didn't  disappoint and they held up in softness and weren't rock hard the next day , always a plus! Overall defiantly worth checking out if you looking for a cute little bagel place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cinnamon raisin  bagel + veggie cream cheese =
Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bagels to go the next day!

90VB3lEUzIzoLrTs7rdfCg.text: Forget what you know about bagels and take the advice of the experts on how to enjoy their product. I love this place. The bagels are amazing. Have the sandwiches for lunch, you will never go anywhere else. The staff is very friendly and personable. Highly recommend them.

Kov1OPmajJn7sMmTVJQiMw.text: Yes, they are open.   Major holidays, minor holidays and even Monday.   Aside from being open they have great hand rolled bagels that are hot and fresh.  Most of the varieties are the usual suspects, but their cheese bagel has a wonderful surprise in the center as the cheese melts into the hole, and caramelizes on the bottom, it is the real treasure. They also have in house made specialty cream cheeses and a variety of sandwiches. On weekends the line can be long and slowish but it is worth the wait.

bXOIysy3JYXQyxyrklnD0Q.text: Just left the bagel man and I must say customer is not at it's finest in the middle of the cashier taking my order she stopped and replaced the coffee mind you I was still talking the place is very small and the bagel sandwich I had was very dry

OBBPoqL1eYcSNeGbtXqxUQ.text: Bagel Man was open on a Monday, which they just started doing, but also the Monday during Christmas. This is very kind to do for those that don't want to cook for the holidays! It also saves everyone from the usually chain restaurants. We are frequent customer to this business, but being open on Christmas is truly wonderful. Thank you to all the staff at Bagel Man giving up time with your families to be here for others. Much appreciated.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States

55kKQFqNbqYtgBrV2gDZyw.text: I visited the Bagel man in the afternoon because I was craving a really good REAL bagel. Being from the East coast, ever since moving to AZ the bagels and bread and pizza crusts don't taste the same. I know it's got to do with the water somehow but let's just say THANK YOU BAGEL MAN! I do not live close by, but I will be coming back for sure. I tried their sesame bagel, pumpernickel, cinnamon raisin bagel,YES I took a few home and they were all delicious! Exactly the REAL bagel I've been looking for. Also, the veggie cream cheese was so good, I regret not buying more of it because it didn't last in my house. Highly recommend the bagel man for anyone who loves a good bagel. PS, the next day my bagels were still great and delicious. Many places the bagels are ok the first day and the next day hard as a rock, but not these. Perfect once lightly toasted :)

97Ld918nmJfYnd6y7HCDOQ.text: I'm from NJ and I'm proud about it. I'm even more proud that this man setup shop in Phoenix. These are the real deal bagels. They are large and fresh. Be prepared for a wait, but it's worth it.

lO6lVi0TY6HWQQ14YeJcUA.text: Love this place! Bialys are great as well as the fresh bagels! I go 19 miles to come here and it's so worth it!  My son loved his Fifth Ave sandwich on his bagel. Everyone is very helpful too. And by the way try the crumb cake!

awEe99ZkXgBELX23-fE0qA.text: 1st time here and I'm very impressed! Authentic NY style bagels that are moist and delicious! I was born on the east coast and my family lives there, so I'm very particular about foods like bagels, pizza, soft pretzels, and seafood. Not just any will do! This east coast girl (at heart) approves. I got a traditional bagel and lox and it was so good! And HUGE! I had to take half home.  And the customer service is great as well. I was greeted promptly and warmly. They made me feel as if I had been coming in for years. They also seemed to know all their customers that came in. I love to see that.   My only negative comment is that it was so hot in there!  I will definitely be back!

CpXjyklKZ1EQ0VcJI1s-2w.text: Sooooooooo good! Best bagels I've had in Arizona. The owner is delightful, the staff is friendly and man are the efficient! Their everything bagel is delicious. They have a great lox and bagel, they don't skimp on anything.

SmAnUxQtPClsO9YcgP0EHA.text: Best bagel I've ever had. Amazing how the dough is so springy, yet no sign of that glue texture one can end up with in a bagel. Made to perfection. I was too busy eating mine to snap a photo, but that hole in the middle? It doesn't exist because they don't skimp.

Nx3Qu64DRGa29Bvzdt9FkA.text: For under $11, I got a huge lox & fried egg sandwich and a large coffee(free refills).  It is served in halves, and each giant fresh bagel half is piled with so much salmon, egg and cream cheese, as to be equivalent to a whole bagel most any other place.  The owner is a pleasure and genuinely loves providing his customers with delicious offerings. At least 2/3 of the people that came in while I was there were very much regulars, one could tell from their conversations with the owner.  The inside is tiny and not much to look at, but I'll take real-deal food over atmosphere every time

bLXB-CK7s829TUZtLeOLFQ.text: Bagel man rocks with the best bagels in the valley. His Bagels are cooked just right, the only thing missing is the NY water.

G6lV8WMPUEcfgg64wl160g.text: Pretty yummy little bagel shop. You get in, you get out. No reason to make a fuss about it.

ZBp_5MXQ5woVULOWXCjkcg.text: The bagels are yummy and service is quick but when you are at check-out DO NOT forget to buy the coffee cake. It is the best coffee cake I have ever tasted.

C3gd8vHvVftk97hF5Olwwg.text: The Bagel are very good.the line out the door told me all I needed to know, as this was my first time. My wife and I stumbled upon this Bagel shop.

tbPwfpkZiJnGVoOSvULd2Q.text: I guess it is only fitting that I write a review for The Bagel Man as my husband just left to grab our breakfast there.  As others have said, these bagels are superb and the service is stellar.  The prices are very reasonable and the food is fresh.  No fru-fru coffee drinks here (just the basic cup, which is fine with me), the focus is on the bagels, and that is obvious.    Small little place and it can get busy, but it seems to go fast.  Get in line, order your food, maybe grab some coffee while you wait.  Pay when it is ready and either sit at one of the few tables inside or sit outside to enjoy the nice AZ weather.  Breakfast sandwiches, fresh made flavored cream cheese (I asked for jalapeno cream cheese and he made some for me on the spot, cream cheese + jalapenos), Boar's Head meat for the lunch sandwiches, and some home baked pastries (from someone else's home).    With all of the good stuff on the menu, my absolute favorite is the lox and cream cheese on an everything bagel with all the fixin's (tomato, onion, capers). YUM!  I could go on, but my breakfast has arrived and it is time to eat!  Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lox &amp; cream cheese
Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sausage, egg, and cheese on an everything bagel
Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lox &amp; cream cheese on an everything bagel

UUX8Ht1L-A7ug-AN5R7hZA.text: A little light on bagels at noon.  Stopped in randomly without looking at yelp so based on the mom and pop shop appearance I didn't know what I was going to get.  Mom and pop shops are either mediocre or awesome.  I'm happy to say bagel man is AWESOME!  I took my first bite and immediately picked up my phone to write a review.    Then I found out yelp loves this place too.  Damn I was late to the party!  :)  Unfortunately I felt the need to dock a star as they only had 3 bagel choices at lunch time.  Maybe someone cleared them out.  I'll try again soon :)

HIJomU51Q3tk62q4EMO0Og.text: Water boiled bagels are the only way to go and these bagels hit the mark. I would definitely go more often if there was more of a selection at a bit more competitive price.   We're from Santa Cruz and Scott actually used to be the baker at the Bagelry so I've had some pretty epic bagels.  In addition at the Begalry they had so many different kinds of schmeers, my favorites being hummus and egg salad on garlic.  It would also be cool if there was a nice rich sun-dried tomato schmeer.

34Xe3cv45plIw8SU33hcZg.text: I drove really far to try these because of the reviews hoping for a bagel like back home. Sorry. Not even close. They are more like real bagels than supermarkets or Einstein, but alas, not as good as the worst NY or NJ bagel place. Chompies is better but only slightly.

I720g9ksA8zMlm9fO5K6BQ.text: So delicious. The bakers come out from the back and interact with patrons. The owner was so friendly. It was easy to tell that everyone who is part of the business of proud to be there!

ssAGwQCr_9d6er6tagSicw.text: I love this place. I come here 3 times a week. The bagels are always fresh the pastrami egg and cheese you need to try one.                       Thank you

gGWZdL2GLG2Ij0LNkiPCwg.text: About as close to Jersey bagels as we've had since we've been here and taylor ham too!  Only downside was they were out of some of the varieties of bagels we wanted. Can you open a place in the West Valley?! We'll be back!

A7U2-EJhwjHEqzax3ZKTLA.text: There is no better bagel place! Kal knows what he is doing and there is no comparison with the other places around. The only time I go to another bagel place is on Monday when they are closed!

Eq14CLITNTHzmiPj_VoJiA.text: OMG!  where to start... This place has amazing from scratch homemade bagels and cream cheeses and is a local mom-and-pop business.  You must try their breakfast bagel sandwiches, they are to live for!  My favorite is the toasted cinnamon raisin bagel with egg bacon cheddar cheese and honey maple raisin nut cream cheese on the side.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast bagel sandwich includes cinnamon raisin bagel, egg, bacon, cheddar cheese and honey maple raisin nut cream cheese

oUt13Qi3iklmxudJDWAT0g.text: Used to live in NYC and I miss the bagels more than anything! This shop definitely has that Brooklyn feel to it, the bagels were flavorful and the cream cheese was the perfect consistency. We've tried a few other places and this one seems to hit the Saturday morning bagel craving the best :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New York style!

CNyKdu8sK7nosaH-s86VnA.text: Every time I visit Phoenix (hometown NYC) I gotta grab some bagels from this guy. His bagels taste like they came straight from New York's best bagel joint. They are fresh, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and huge. He is always there greeting customers (super friendly guy) and ensuring consistency and quality. If you like bagels, this is a must visit place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Simple, plain, and delicious.

OPtUC2tmhJQSLAJl6eSldw.text: The Bagel Man has by far, THE best NY style bagels in AZ. I'm from Connecticut and lived in NYC so I know what a great bagel tastes like and he's done it here. Like another reviewer said, it's not quite H&H but the closest you'll get in the desert.   Staff is friendly, the owner is there all time and super friendly as well. I love the everything bagel with cream cheese, simple but delish!  Only caution is that it's small inside and can get crowded in the mornings. Enjoy!

RzAd4fUIjKf8TYL3Ksy0MA.text: Large selection of bagels early in the am.  We went here on a Saturday am because it is the earliest opening bagel shop in the Tuke.  Friendly customer service too along with prices that are a good value.  If you are an early riser, this is the place to go.

ujq0S95r_omh12bh588_cg.text: Friendly staff, that know and love their food. Lox bagel was delicious and they hooked it up with all the fixings!

Td_camS-Eq82PvO5WgvvSw.text: I love the bagel man, my family comes from the east coast and we always love the breakfast sandwiches there. This is the best bagel shop in Arizona. I've lived here for 25 years and I love eating, trust me.

IpmSU5k9GRh6cqwIZEE0dQ.text: I swoon for bagels, I adore them. When the sweet scent of an everything bagel is in the air, my knees buckle. I came to The Bagel Man for the first time I could barely hold my excitement as soon as I saw that rack of bagels. I had to order an everything bagel with lox and cream cheese. I knew I had to, like it was predestined. The rest of that experience was like some sort of heroine high daze that left me craving more. A life long addiction that I'm sure I'll never shake.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bagel with lox and cream cheese.

UhoPx3adqX05DLRh49FaHg.text: The breakfast sandwiches are always to die for. There will always be a steady flow of people because everyone loves this place, but you get your meal in a timely manner so don't let the lime length detour you. Amazing staff. Plus I love their coffee.

qwA16yvggEtXBYNjKu20PA.text: Best bagels and bagel sandwiches I've had since moving from NJ.  Rock on, Bagel Man!

CKJogwLVxoCdZUi3gZLJRw.text: I do love coming here. It has a city feel right here in my suburb. I like that it is a small owner run Business. The service is always very friendly. Delicious food. The lox breakfast sandwich is one that I often crave.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Some New York heaven right here in Arizona.

ZbmQOpZuSGaxE6CCXYLcZg.text: I'm from NJ and lived in Manhattan for a while. One of the things I really wanted to find was a great bagel place that scratched that East coast itch. This place definitely has the nice outer crust gloss with a great soft chew in the middle like the bagels in NJ and NY. Get there earlier because some of the flavors run out on the weekend. We got a bacon, egg, and cheese on an everything along with cream cheese and a dozen. The egg was fried, not scrambled and everything tasted as it should! Love this place!

x2_FdlDAqNeDjMP5arZ8DQ.text: I love this place!!!! The owner is the nicest guy and greets me like I'm family every time I go. The bagels are to die for! I drive 20 mins each way for them!

PhXEcRuhuUbCdW3rmrt5ew.text: I will preface this review by saying that I have spent most of my life living in New York and I am absolutely critical of all bagels that I eat.  Now, let me say that Bagel Man carries by far the best bagel I have ever tasted outside of New York State. The owner has a location back east as well, so it is no surprise that he knows what he's doing. You can try anywhere else you want in the Phoenix metro region, but you will never find a bagel that comes even close to the flavor and taste of these authentic bagels. Every single one of my family and friends that have come to visit me agree. In addition, anytime I introduce these bagels to any of my local friends they are blown away and from then on will not buy a bagel anywhere else.   Plain and simple, Bagel Man has the absolute best bagels you will have outside of New York and I have even found in many occasions that his bagels are better than some of the places back east.

ew3vWDE15b9u6NeW4jKHrw.text: This place is awesome. Lots of options and always fresh bagels. Even great cream cheese choices. Also do sandwiches which I've had breakfast and lunch and can attest that they both are great!

S7xIv9Sk8ebAOFG1_ubNlg.text: I wanted to love these bagels, and give this place 5 stars, but I simply can't. Here's why: both bagels I tasted were seriously under-baked. Not a little under-baked, but squeeze-the-bread-just-little-and-it-turns-back-into-dough, under-baked. I can't give any higher than 3 stars for that baking faux pas. I get that they are turning out bagels quickly, but they needed to give them another good 10-12 minutes in the oven, minimum. Make the customers wait for quality.   The flavor, however, was excellent. The salt bagel had the perfect amount of salt without making me feel like a blowfish, and the jalapeno bagel was jam-packed full of jalapeno flavor. You can also tell they use the boiling technique which makes them a chewy texture. If only they had been baked well!   I did not get a sandwich, or even cream cheese, since I wanted to see if these are truly NY-style. They are...except for that one thing I mentioned 120 times.   Maybe a bad day for the Bagel Man. I probably won't be back to find out.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. East to tell when a bagel needs more time: it doesn&#39;t spring back.

4eDcmUaYvs7RTq9lGLSnig.text: For all of you New York and jersey folks looking for a taste of home, this is the place. Bagels are excellent. Ordered a sausage and cheese on everything. Was pretty solid... Then I talked to the owner who is from New Jersey and incredibly friendly, mentioned I was from jersey and he dropped the hammer "we have Taylor ham". He offered to replace my sandwich... But I said nope, let's double down and get another one.   For you jersey expats who think you can only get a TEC on an everything within the confines of the garden state, give this place a shot.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States

_SnX3T0md-uSPvngx3XzkQ.text: Just with once eating here, I'm a big fan! The bagels taste incredibly fresh and have that perfect crust and chewy inside that Einstein or any other supposed "bagel" place can't match.   I ordered a crazy combo because im a pregnant, hungry mom! It was lox, bacon, and eggs with scallion cream cheese on a warm, freshly baked Everything Bagel. ....ahhhh,it was outstanding.   The guys working that fine early Sun morning were upbeat, fun and helpful. ..i think they must enjoy their job, which says a lot about the owners.   I'll def be back again when I'm on this side of the I10.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This was on the mark!  Fresh everything bagel with scallion spread, lox, egg and bacon. ..epic combo!

0TBvsPVB0EURuO8MS8yUSQ.text: We get bagels here every week and they never disappoint! They're always fresh, large, and so delicious you barely want to put cream cheese on them (you should though-theirs is perfect!) The coffee cake is to die for and the people who run the shop are all so friendly and kind. If you're looking for a great breakfast experience or really miss authentic bagels, definitely give this place a try!

Kr9VwCOyxLVhzVsPTT84nQ.text: The best thing about this place is not just the amazing bagels and everything else that goes on the bagels, but the people who give you your food look so happy doing it. The first time i was there, a girl helped me find what i wanted (bagel and lox) and i got excited when she said it had chickapeas. she ended up giving me a little extra and that's what got me to come back.

3z3d2_abLk4G0_omQ1O81Q.text: First time here and was very impressed! When we got in there a line was forming , the service was quick and very friendly. Fresh bagels were coming out very frequently and from the window by the kitchen you could see the staff rolling the bagels in the back, I got an every bagel with egg and ham , it was very good. Highly recommend this place

GsporVLKIIztjPblcr-2BA.text: This is by far my favorite place to get a delicious breakfast sandwich!!! I drive from east Mesa to come here. The friendly atmosphere and the wonderful customer service just makes they're delicious food that much better! Simply the best.

oW5isAlyoGrITT2TgzCrbw.text: More of a to go type place.  Limited seating inside and out. Staff was friendly and helpful.  I got a bagel chicken sandwich.  Think I might have been happier with just bagel with cream cheese but still good!

Db15i51WyZ0FoJTQ_EWlQA.text: The most amazing bagels I've had since New York. The staff and owner are very friendly, and always spend time to visit with the customers while they're waiting for their orders. The line moves very fast, and totally worth the brief wait.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ham egg and cheese on everything bagel.
Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lox bagel with the works, on an everything bagel.

0DZfwhMXzIFoLQcJaB593A.text: I'm from the motherland of Bagels...Brooklyn.  We take our bagels seriously.  I think all Einstein locations should be burned down.    By far, Bagelman's are the best bagels I've had in AZ!  I used to live across the street and went often.  The owner is very nice.  My only word of caution is that they can take a really long time to fill your order.  One time I went looking for an onion bagel and was told that they would be 'right out'...20-25 minutes later I finally got my bagel.  After that I would just take whatever they had ready.

UHKpzdtq0yEjsb9Jnq64aQ.text: For all you NYC bagel brats out there, this is your new favorite place! I never thought that I would be able to find bagels that even compare to those in NY, but The Bagel Man delivers. They often have a line out the door but are so quick. Coffee and breakfast for two is about $10. Crisp on the outside and soft on the inside, schmear oozing out the sides, and sliced down the middle. Reminds me of my favorite city!

rFPb9fb1HmC_1nH3EOG5ng.text: Between Odelay and Bagel Man, these are the top locally owned bagel places in the area. Enjoy both of them and usually alternate between them. Each is a notch above the chain places with Bagel Man's offerings bigger than Odelay. While BM offers the standard fare, Odelay serves some innovative items such as parmesan and black pepper. Really hard to choose between the two so I  just go to both.

V3TlU8eybOT255QQb7aS6Q.text: What a delightful visit today to the Bagelman. You can tell how much this guy loves to be in business! It's not often you can tell the passion for food and appreciation one has for their customers, but here at bagelman, the owner beams with pride and gratitude.   As a customer raved about her lox, I sampled the tuna, relieved that it did not contain chunks of celery. I hate that! Ordered a Ruben on a bagel for my husband, but  ate half before I even got out of my parking spot!.  So much value for what I paid for a ruben, and 1/2 lb tuna. I'll never go anywhere else! Feels like home for this New Yorker! 5 stars!

Q173zggl0G8Thu_cErb1pQ.text: Wow, just wow. The best bagel I have had since working for Baffos deli in Dallas back in 1990.

Q3BeQtdARaRJImHcnGL5FQ.text: I just moved here from New York two months ago, so I was extremely skeptical when hearing Bagel Man bagels tasted like back home. I'm happy to report they are easily the closest thing you can get to an authentic New York bagel here in Arizona. Only wish they had egg everything bagels! That's a New York staple, not to mention my favorite.  From the tastes of it, anything you order is going to be delicious. They also "shmear" the bagels in a True New York fashion- aka cream cheese dripping out of every edge.  While I'll still be smuggling egg everything and rainbow bagels from back home in my suitcase when I visit, I'll be a regular here at bagel man. I couldn't be happier to have found this place!

WC055Sjkl33Eud5NerJF_Q.text: The place smelled great and the sandwiches we bought and ate there were very good (I love the rye)!  The bagels, however, tasted too bready for me.  I spent the last 45 years in the Atlanta area, where there are several excellent bagel delis.  The bagels here made me wish for Atlanta, not Phoenix.

13AY7aNcgkCocsIPmPV8UA.text: Already a line at 6:20 in the morning but definitely worth the wait! The bagels have a soft, fluffy texture (even a day after). Schmear was the perfect topping for the warm, fresh breakfast snack. I got a baker's dozen for my co-workers and they loved every bite! The Bagel Man was a hit. I will keep coming back.

gkdAVcmKCYB9ZODpOh_uSA.text: Delicious! Friendly owner and staff, great breakfast sandwich on a great bagel. I'll be back, as the owner promised I would.

y6Rv2FXHWdxQeXXjgHshGg.text: This place is fast and fairly priced. The garlic bagel I had was so fresh! I'm not going to anymore chains!

qt3FLzHRSSxK7l2pDFG7Iw.text: This place is authentic as a NY Bagel place can be. They're also willing to let you try things and make sure you're experience is one you'll talk about. Glad local businesses like this one are here!

HWiR9VV5kxRSe6pzOAm2mg.text: This is my go to place when I have time to breakfast in the mornings.  I think the word "authentic" is thrown around way too often in Yelp reviews and I am guilty of using too often too . . . so please forgive me for using one more time; The Bagel Man has authentic NYC bagels and frankly, if they weren't they are still amazing.  Meal:  Just pick anything off of the menu.  Don't think . . .just choose.  It will be well worth it.  I recommend that you don't taste the bagel because it ruins the taste, but that is just my preference.   Taste:  These bagels are the cat's pajamas.  While the sandwiches are terrific, I recommend keeping it simple and just stick with the bagels.  10 out of 10.  Value: You can maybe go somewhere else and find cheaper bagels, but they are exactly just that, cheaper bagels.  The quality of these bagels could demand almost any price but they are reasonably priced. 4 out of 5.  Service/Cleanliness:  The Bagel Man has to be the nicest man in the food business in the East Valley.  He always greets you with a smile.  He loves to interact with the customers . . .but his supporting staff lately has dropped the ball.  The last time I was there, one of his employees begun to take my order and walked away mid-way.  She went to the back and after waiting for a few minutes, I just left. 6 out of 10.  Atmosphere:  It was it is - its a bagel place and I don't thing there really needs to be anything else, right?  3 out of 5.  Overall:  I feel there service has really gone down lately.  If every employee there was just like he Bagel Man himself, this place would be an easy 5 star place!  23 out of 30 points, 3 out of 5 stars.

8eGqzhUs1yldMl-ecqbbHQ.text: Outstanding! Reminds me of walking right into a deli in Manhattan. The staff is always friendly and of course the bagels are amazing. Try the bacon egg and cheese on a toasted wheat bagel!

oFcPTXpRu3gzn-w-2ew1iA.text: I have lived on the east coast my entire life until I relocated here 2 years ago. I had given up on finding the bagels I craved so much out here in the desert...until now! This is the real east coast deal my friends...all is good in my world now.  Just like home w/out the snow & cold. :)

boT7zrVaskglETPg_9B9ng.text: Wow, So nice to get authentic bagels in Phoenix! Service was friendly and food was delish.  It's definitely a to go spot; I sat here eating for 20 mins and saw 30 people come in and out with dozens of bagels in hand and no one else sat down. I can't believe I've been in ahwatukee more than 7 years and just found this place!

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bagel and lox

1WCgrRG6a8Y0Bf6sc7_9XQ.text: Somebody on this site recommended the toasted everything bagel with lox, tomato, and chive cream cheese, so I got that, and yup, you were right -- IT WAS GOOD!!!  To your recommendation, I say also get the capers and onions on that.  Mmm mmm. Four and a half stars.

vR1e7MAk-CHXiVExGUcWWg.text: Unbelievable!!! Cal (owner) is an amazingly gracious and friendly guy!! He will know and remember you after your first visit. These are far and away the BEST bagels I've ever eaten, ever! Made completely from scratch ON SITE!!  You can see them being mixed, proofed, boiled and baked!!  Taste them fresh and hot straight from the kitchen!! This place, the staff, the food feel like home!! THE BEST!!!!

ZSc6PyuZV9f7AFATOf68Hw.text: The best bagel we've had in the Phoenix area. Bagels are large yet airy and flavorful. Being an ice tea lover, I'm thrilled that they have a fresh fruity tea. They have stevia too which is a plus. We haven't had their sandwiches but have heard they're delish.

wC3l35G1CFP5kYkihe8irQ.text: Amazing Mom and Pops bagel shop. The bagels are so fresh and the customer service is great!

deVBR5lweAwnHniHoqGXZg.text: Bagel man makes the best bagels in the Valley.  Hands down.  Crispy, chewy circular delights that make you question the existence of places like Einsteins.  His lox and egg breakfast sandwich is about the best meal 6$ can buy in the region.  If you know better, hit me up because I want to go to there.

R_EcmxelpwjlUQZveuzKcg.text: I tried this place out yesterday for the first time. Let me start by saying that my review is probably worth nothing, because there are some 160 reviews and the average rating for this place is four and a half stars. That speaks volumes to me. So here is what I have to say: I have never had a bagel or even known that a bagel could be as perfect in every way imaginable until yesterday. I kid you not, everything from the texture to the taste is astonishing. I stayed in Time Square for quite a while and have had my fair share of bagels from places all over the country and NONE of them compare to here.

ZwdbLlI8-wSQErncdi2E8w.text: By far the best bagel I have ever had! This man is the real deal! Genuinely cares about his business and his product. You will not find a better bagel in the state of Arizona! In most cases, the bagels do not even need to be toasted because they are so warm and fresh! My favorite is the jalapeno bagel with garden veggie cream cheese! Thank you bagel man!

FH_XKyZcXZnd1K0H-zz5-A.text: I got an egg and cheese breakfast sandwich on an everything bagel.  The bagel was a bit to garlic salty for me but I'm sure most other Americans would love it.  the bagel was like a fresh baguette; crispy on the outside and light and fluffy on the inside.  The simple sandwich was good but I will get a different type of bagel next time.

OMRtDwXl7GDDGoXFpEgjfQ.text: This place gets you in and out quick.  The bagels are very soft and they had many choices to choose from. The prices were pretty good for what you get.  They wrap it in tin foil which is nice when getting to-go. I ate my bagel sandwich 30 minutes later and it was still hot.  The Bagel Man is friendly. I don't understand why are there so many haters. Maybe people need to be more friendly and he will reciprocate.  The cook was very nice and accommodating. I have to give this place a 5 star review based on my experience which was perfect.  I suggest giving it a try once at least. Hopefully you catch the Bagel Man on a good day like I did apparently.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sausage. Egg. Cheese. Onion Bagel

top3V3clcf5GeXeEXYp0aQ.text: Fast friendly service! I have been here a few times and each time I am equally impressed! Not only do the have the BEST lox bagel with capers, tomato, and onions, the service is so friendly! As a plus, they text your receipt to you, so I don't have to hold onto messy receipt with BPA chemicals!

WwPzvFeMkFoUh0q3l8FWhw.text: The Best Bagels HANDS DOWN!!! My sister drives all the way from North Phoenix to get this guys Bagels!!! ;-)

ysSTmXFUmmuNdkK4b0drzA.text: I stopped by the shopping center the other day and I almost didn't go in because the business is somewhat nondescript.  I'm so glad that I did, I couldn't believe what I was eating.  I've just come back from NYC and I thought I wouldn't find that taste again until my next trip back.  I absolutely love his bagels.  Crusty on the outside and so soft and perfect on the inside.    I've been back three times in the last week and I am in love!  Kal is such a friendly guy and he is unguarded and warm, a real pleasure to talk with.  I've just moved to the valley and I am so glad there is an amazing bagel shop here.  Phoenix just got great!

qlP0L_XPUSVRGZ0h60KXJw.text: I wasn't sure what to expect when walking in, I didn't check reviews first because I always give bagel places a chance. I'm from Ohio and miss the great Jewish NY-style deli's I had all around me, because there is a serious lack of them in Arizona. However, Bagel Man has the best bagels in the valley. They have great varieties and are incredibly delicious and last for longer than most you would get at Chompie's or some other fake deli. The owner was awesome, he introduced himself and was doing everything well. They serve Boar's Head meat which is the best if you ask me and they have some variety for being a small place. I recommend this place to all for a nice little lunch or bringing bagels home or to the office.

iDbyAjwkXLeTaNHL7aSwFw.text: Bagel Man, you rock! I've visited this place two times now, and I have been very pleased each time. The bagels are super authentic, the real deal. Chewy, flavorful and totally fresh. The Bagel Man himself has been behind the counter on both of my visits, and he's super friendly. He bakes and boils the bagels himself and the quality shows. On my first visit a few months ago, I ordered the Sexy sandwich on a pumpernickel bagel (my favorite!), which if I recall, was a sandwich wiith turkey, havarti and roasted red peppers among other things. I got a combo which included a drink and a side, I chose the plain Wise potato chips. It was all tasty and fresh. On my second visit, I just went with a toasted pumpernickel with cream cheese and an untoasted everything bagel to go. I also noticed the big black and white cookies in the pastry case, so I had to throw one of those in as well. The bagels were top notch as usual, and the black and white cookie was good too. I'd never had one before but immediately thought of Seinfeld when I saw it. These cookies are more akin to half of a whoopie pie (very cake-like) iced in simple vanilla and chocolate frostings. I didn't ask if they were made in-house, but they may be. My one and only gripe about the place is the ambiance. It's in a strip mall so my expectations weren't that high but it would go a long way in increasing the inviting nature of the place if they had some music playing. All in all, if you're looking for authentic, chewy bagels, look no further than the Bagel Man!

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Black and white cookie! &#34;Look to the cookie, Elaine! Look to the cookie.&#34;

JViJXs3XMMojUnQ4QVMlqA.text: The Bagel Man has the best everything bagels I have ever eaten.  I go there for lunch a couple times a week.  I enjoy the Boar's Head deli meats as well.  Cal is there every day and always greets me with a smile and knows exactly what I like.  Glad to see that since it has only been open a few months that he always has customers in there.  I love to see the community supporting the small businesses in the area.

fls6wqvuwhGMKGYWE3n0_w.text: So delicious fresh bagels makes food right on the spot

aLFEdSaWIffy2saShy20ug.text: worth a visit for housemade cream cheese alone. best and cheapest lox n bagel sandwich I've had.

20yZ2XgAfRc8T0vwIAIfnA.text: Friendly staff & service (Jersey represent!). I ordered the scrambled egg, smoked salmon, cream cheese, capers, red onions on a whole wheat toast. My fiance ordered the chicken cutlet, mozzarella, roasted red peppers on a bagel. Both were delicious and reasonably priced. Can't wait to come back when I'm back in AZ!

Zy70VhqfkCBqA-LVxDNDrQ.text: Try "The Boss" it is so nice on a warm summer day. Fresh mozzarella with Roasted red pepper and olive oil. Excellent sandwich! Finally a great family owned bagel shop in the southeast valley!

wp_dDWgLJcnhVj0cDHsdQw.text: This place rocks!!  ...especially if you're used to east coast bagels!   Where else can you get 2 bacon egg and cheese breakfast bagel sandwiches plus a large drink big enough for two and all for $9!!  Plus they use Boar's Head bacon there...so it's not that thin nasty bacon you find elsewhere. Their everything bagels are the best in town. I highly recommend this place and it's worth waiting if there's a line. The owner and workers are all friendly, which makes for a good atmosphere.  My only complaint is that they need more tables ...maybe they should buy the sub shop next to them and expand.

aN2DQQw8OfZryF939naJ7g.text: LOVE the "Sexy" sandwich. Always nice people! REally good bialy!

MoQUaPmeEMUwML747aVkKA.text: Absolutely delicious! This is how a bagel should taste. The bagel man boils the bagels! We ate a sesame bagel with egg and cheese. Our son ate a croissant. Coffee was fine. Definitely will return again for one more breakfast sandwich while in AZ.

PIp5oEFcHJ9kYImhPkOwEw.text: Excellent fresh bagels!!  These bagels are just as good as bagels from NYC!  Great service too.  Whenever I am in the area, I will stop by for breakfast.  Loved the bacon, egg and cheese.

bgL1pOUDq7zYIT1SK6ZP6w.text: I live right down the street and my girls and I often ride our bikes down to the shop on Sunday mornings. The bagels are made fresh everyday, I often would see the windows all fogged with steam as I made my way to work at 5 Am in the winter. The kids love it. I usually get an everything bagel with the veggie cream cheese that they make. I actually have not branched out yet, but I will next time! It is really great when the bagels have just came out hot and you don't even need to toast them.

wdMduCj7EcQCfPLcQYkhbA.text: Best bagels I've ever had!  Made the right way with a huge selection of cream cheeses and sandwiches!  Loved it!!  My husband had the bagel and lox and it was perfectly prepared with red onion and capers.

a7E-f-fBXsHUL_HNiuf-fQ.text: Stopped by here on a whim. Bagels and cream cheese are fantastic, staff are pleasant, will be coming here again.

vQZk1xQkE-44xMq1ttL9OQ.text: Best Bagels in the Valley!!!  Very authentic and delicious.  The owner, Cal, is so very kind, friendly and always happy.

ktr3jsxBoS9_ptoWkV3nDg.text: Best Bagels in town hands down!! The cream cheese melts in your mouth, the bagels are just phenomenal! We ordered a blueberry, and a jalapeno bagel...they were not overpowering at all. Very fresh ingredients. Try it at least once and you will not regret it!

k_dluswhNtTdG5cyS3CtSQ.text: The health department need to pay this place a visit.  It was so grouse in my opinion. The guy was sweating and dripping all over the place.  He had a glove on, but was touching everything with his glove plus using his glove hand to take and count back cash.  Then he uses that gloved hand that whipped his brow, touched my money and grabs a handful of bagels.  I took my bagel and dropped it in the trash on the way out.

2F820vJsp0qclqNH-5sttA.text: Best  bagels I've found in Arizona. I'm from the east coast and these are as good as bagels back there

WfGDm4-DS-jJR6y-nDn9-w.text: This is my favorite bagel place! The bagels are soooooo damn delicious. They are crispy on the outside and so chewy on the inside. They are by far much larger than other bagels from anywhere else, like Einstein Bagels. I usually need to eat 3 or 4 of Einstein Bagels to get full (and I'm a little 5'4 120lb girl), and just 1 or 2 of the Bagel Man's bagels are more than enough to fill me up. The owner is so sweet and remembers you after you show up once. He always asks how I've been and remembers details from last time, he is so friendly. The second you walk in the door he will greet you. As for what was said by that negative review below, that isn't True at all. The place is clean and smells wonderfully of freshly baked bagels. There are other workers who have rang me up before, and were very friendly with it. The only thing I could find negative at all about this place was that its slightly warm inside, but that's just because they are baking bagels all day! Every time I am in Phoenix I stop by and get some of their bagels! They are great to eat after a morning workout. Sometimes when I stop by at the end of the day, I get a couple free bagels with my order. I would definitely recommend stopping by, and trying the egg bagel especially!

w_qukgKqH6Fumq7uxJaUAA.text: Delicious bagels, I got two of the sliced lox ones and I was talking to the owner. He said I will love it and that I will come back again, he's right I will 100% be back . It's hard to find bagel places that have lox in Arizona and I'm glad I found this place

kglvGWZO8lYMgU_il70Ckg.text: Seen this place driving through Eliot many times to go pick up at Einstein's... finally stopped here today instead.    This place is legit!  The bagels are massive, fresh/soft, and nicely seasoned.   Can't ask for a more ideal bagel.   The in-house cream cheese is several levels better than your typical pre-packaged stuff.  The veggie spread has these refreshing chunks of cucumber all mixed in.   Definitely my new go-to place for bagels now!!!

lZW4A3juZrALPzlOdAf4Yw.text: The BEST BAGELS IN ARIZONA!!!   We come here ALL the time, and have been coming here for the last three years.   We discovered The Bagel Man when we first moved out here and stayed a night in the hotel next door.   We have since lived in Scottsdale and Peoria and will absolutely make that 40 minute drive (each way) just to get a REAL bagel sandwhich! We have tried other places but nothing can ever truly compare to how amazing these bagels are!   We stopped trying other bagel places and just make the drive whenever we are craving a bagel sandwhich for breakfast or lunch!

Pk6_fpBx6j7Y_VgQGpNxTA.text: Reviews of folks saying this place has the best bagel they've ever had is an exaggeration. They are good ... but certainly not the best. I stopped in for breakfast with intentions on getting a bacon, egg and cheese bagel on honey wheat but I didn't like the way the eggs looked. They looked as if they were liquid eggs ... I'm not sure. I decided to keep it simple and ordered a toasted cinnamon raisin bagel with the honey, walnut and raisin cream cheese. It was good but to me the bagel didn't' taste any better than a grocery store bakery. Just as an FYI, Basha's bakery is the bomb.com! I'm not huge on bagels but had the craving so I decided to try it. It the bagel spirit hits me again I'll be going to a grocery store.

2dPIhqv_agok06v7w9wevg.text: Best New York salt bagel in the desert. Hands down. Sometime the customers are impatient but it is totally worth it.

zCCDJPcVHYJ5pJZ4-BM9Ng.text: Easy, fast, affordable breakfast.  I ordered an iced coffee for $1.99 and a breakfast bagel with scrambled eggs, bacon and cheese. (The eggs are actually real everyone!)  They have a selection of fresh bagels to choose from. I tried the cheesy one. It was soft with just the right amount of crispyness from roasting it.

or0fHNQmQLsfljEUM-4aOA.text: This probably isn't a fair review because I live in New York and nothing compares to a New York bagel, in my opinion.  The owner was nice but the bagels were okay. My dad's bagel and lox looked thrown together and the produce wasn't fresh.  If you want a bagel with cream cheese, or something simple like that, this place is fine.   My breakfast sandwich was okay. I wouldn't make the trip again for it.   Coffee is below average.   Overall, good for basics, wouldn't recommend the sandwiches- especially if you're from the east coast and are used to NY bagels.

WaOic-Ac245zNk0z3saMkQ.text: Make sure you are there early if you want one.  I got there at 9 am and I had two bagel options   The staff was also a little slow.  When you have a line that often there has to be a better way.

SIqPsmr2vOF_CNKmBSJzyQ.text: This place is DELICIOUS! There is always a line, and for good reason (not to worry, the line moves quick). Not only does this place pack in the cream cheese, but they also bring delicious flavor with great value!  You can't go wrong with anything that you get here, I am partial to the garlic bagels- hope you have some extra gum or mints laying around because they don't play games when it comes to bringing the garlic flavor! Averaging about $3/bagel by the time you add your cream cheese, the pricing is very reasonable.   If you go early enough, you can meet the owner! He's a friendly man, and you can tell he's passionate about what he does.   The only negative to this place is outside of the outdoor seating, it's not really a 'sit down and enjoy your meal' kind of place. I would describe it more as a grab and go. The interior is small, but I'd much rather go to a small tasty shop than stand in line for a restaurant chain where the bagels are so-so.

ua-ca1r_A4GaxLQNLWfBNA.text: What a girl from New England misses most about New York style Bagels. Actually boiled and baked crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside and legit in size.

p90GGK36k2Ij6uvJQ9UpBg.text: Favorite bagel in Phoenix and honestly, favorite bagel spot in the country. I go to school near NYC and have tried all the highly rated bagel shops in Manhattan and The Bagel Man still impressed me more. Only downside to the shop is it is very warm inside because everything is freshly made throughout the day

98bGWa_H2y6u07SqAUJs8Q.text: These are my kinda bagels, man! A no funny bussiness kinda establishment. Just great food and sweet staff. My experience here brought me back to a trip to New York.  I grabbed a lox with chive cream cheese on a toasted everything bagel to go. The sandwhich was huge and smelled fantastic! They make their own spreads and the flavor proves it. The bagel itself was fluffy and had that nice subtle salty flavor a good bagel should have.  Service was quick and the staff were friendly. Will be back to try more!

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lox on a everything bagel
Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lox all the way on an everything bagel

kiFmibTB-QH7woo4AQ-Rjw.text: I am originally from NY and I have lived here in AZ for just over two years. So far this is the first place that I have found that has met my expectations (They actually surpassed them). Up until now I have been very underwhelmed by the bagels in the Phoenix Metro area. I recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a exceptional bagel joint.

veNVU4CP89P_6OdjFFsZJA.text: Staff knows their bagels! We have visited many bagel shops around the valley and call this our favorite. We have many friends who now say the same!

kCYdP615qZ6ssncCkMb_sA.text: Good bagels and sandwiches. They put alot of cream cheese on their bagels. Can get crowded sometimes.

KwX5lrej63nUGTH4HT140g.text: GREAT bagels!!  They are huge and have loads of toppings.  Absolutely the BEST bagels in the area.

EbilebZgmoo8NiYxr9WLrA.text: Flew into Phoenix early and was looking for someplace to eat. We found this little bagel shop and are so glad we did. The bagels were amazing and they had lots of cream cheese options. Got an everything bagel with green onion cream cheese. It was amazing.

8pR4aGtp-dSZO19pwKXipA.text: I went to this little shop about a month ago; stumbled upon it using this app when I was on my way to a meeting in Tempe.  I ordered the jalapeno and cheese bagel w bacon, egg, and cheese (so a sort of bagel sandwich).  It was really good...you go stand in line and order your food, then wait for it to be made fresh to order.  And the bagel sandwich was HUGE!  Definitely shareable for the smaller appetites.  They have a self serve soda machine and the building is pretty small...I don't recall seeing places to sit inside (I could be wrong, it was really crowded when I was there) but there is patio space outside.  Overall it was a good bagel sandwich...I would go back and try something else from the menu!  (Again, Sorry no pics...I was driving while eating!)

LO4d5SU3Zi1KVOMI35xKPw.text: This is about our second time buying bagels from The Bagel Man. Great quality bagels at a great price, moist and flavorful . Friendly and patient staff, Thursday morning crowd, waiting while I decide. The different cheese spreads are delicious. Next time we'll consider a fifth star once I tried a sandwich because we got the bakers dozen.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wABR_g6LlY5-xHP9x6aCTA.text: I know that good food, alas, is a matter of taste.  That being said, I challenge anyone to find a better bagel on this side of town.  Bagel man makes some authentic bagels folks!  Give them a try!

d2grdj1t5Qyuu8T5KoX_wg.text: Excellent bagels (especially the salt ones) and great service! Went for my first time the other day and can't wait to get back and get more bagels.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salt bagel with scallion cream cheese!
Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salt bagel with scallion cream cheese!

-MW-XXeZWnt7j_-EFPVK-w.text: I got the egg and lox sandwich on an everything bagel with plain cream cheese. The bagel was so fresh out of the oven that they didn't even need to heat the bagel for my warm sandwich. The bagel was absolutely delicious and there was a good amount of lox and toppings for the price. The prices are a lot more reasonable compared to the other bagel places in the area. My boyfriend got the sausage and egg sandwich on a plain bagel (he's a plain eater) and said it's the best bagel sandwich he's ever had from a place in Arizona.   The staff was so incredibly friendly. Even though it was my first time there and I was so overwhelmed with the amount of yummy things to choose from, the employees helped me decide what to get and I'm so glad they did.   There isn't much space to eat so my boyfriend and I got it to go and had a picnic at a near by park. I wish there was more seating because all the tables were full. The food was so good though that I didn't mind at all and I will definitely be back very soon. I'm happy to give all my bagel business to The Bagel Man from now on!

763_XVEenvuskmGjBpWZKg.text: Best beagles ever fresh made daily & great costumer service. Super  delicious , we are definitely coming back for more !!!!

ANcOrX7WHwQdBYf7WucF7A.text: I have been coming to the Bagel Man since he first opened and they are the Bagels I ever ate. The bagels are boiled and then baked to perfect soft chewy inside and crunchy on the outside. I love the everything bagel  as it has the perfect balance  of salt, garlic onion, poppy and sesame seed.   The lines can get long at times and confusion happens with the orders at times  and I overlook it as it's part of the Bagel Man experience.

wycDCPe54Vu7EE_dJHQTcg.text: You move from NY and miss the bagels..of all things.  Best bagels in Arizona. Equally as good as, if not better than, a lot of NY bagel places. Sometimes there are no bagels left by 11 am, but it seems like lately they have been stocked if I get there around that time. Everything is good; nothing is bad. I usually get tuna. Really good cream cheese, too. Everything I have ever gotten there has been good. Bagels freeze well, too. Owner is nice and will always say hi and ask about family. Some of the newer guys working there are...new....let's say. Go early and often!

EVNcHceW7n5IwGqP4WX8Gg.text: Oh man am I coming here for breakfast again! I workout right across the 10 on Elliot, and today I was feeling completely famished afterwards. Yelped some nearby breakfast locations and this seemed to have great reviews. I'm not from New York, but I do have decent bagel standards. My so, who IS from New York, was with me, and he has high bagel standards.   The place still had customers hanging around even though it was only an hour until they supposedly close at noon. We were greeted by two people, one of which  guessing was the owner (by other review descriptions). Our orders were taken immediately and rung up. The owner was cheerful and jokingly said that 'I would never go to Starbucks again after I tasted their coffee'. I'm not hard to please and ordered a breakfast sandwich with bacon on a sesame bagel, and a small coffee. My so ordered the same thing on a cinnamon raisin bagel.   Bagels were tasty! And the eggs looked real. Not that liquid egg stuff. The coffee was yummy and I was happy! My so said that this looked like a typical bagel joint back in NY, with baskets of bagels, a small crew and quick service. I would definitely come here again after workouts for a quick breakfast stop. Bagels are way better here than from any major chain. It looks like they also have lunch sandwiches and a few other things to try.

gNEvczppWXEazOPU66cCug.text: Even a 10 year old can knead some dough and form it in a circle and call it a bagel... I wasn't impressed. Most tasteless piece of bread I've had. You are better off going to Fry's or Safeway and picking up a french baguette and slapping some cream cheese on it. Much cheaper that way and hey, probably tastes better too.

Yz-8s69-mKzrrk_W-nIoiA.text: Solid bagel spot. The bagels are really yummy and fresh. I got the sausage, egg, and cheese bagel sandwich. It was really good and super cheesy! The guy recommended not to toast the bagel since they were already freshly made and hot out of the oven! Really glad he did because it made the sandwich that much better.  I didn't give the place five stars because it was so small and got really busy. There isn't really any place to wait for your to go order. It took awhile for my sandwiches and then when I said the order was mine the guys tried giving it to someone else. Maybe they can take down names when calling out the orders instead or give out numbers.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sausage, egg, and cheese on a cheese bagel

aS9y8aEf6Nq-06VVTpMG5A.text: We ordered a breakfast sandwich (egg and cheese), The Sexy, and one with plain cream cheese. We only tried the jalapeno bagel for all three. Very impressed. The bagels were soft and warm and the perfect density.   There was a line almost out the door around 11am on a Saturday morning. The line went very fast and we were eating in no time.   Bagel was still good the next day after being refrigerated.   Highly recommend if you love mom and pop shops.

YDWsWdZfqKmP1hvTem_CLQ.text: This now is my main bagel stop. Forget that high price frozen dough and microwaved egg places. The bagel man hand makes freshly dough bagels with stovetop fresh eggs. I get the bacon or ham, egg, and cheese on an everything bagel-YUM! Only problem is space; it's crowded and small.

8vkfgcxRMuZ5290lDtQb2A.text: These bagels are the best bagels in town. The owner and everyone who works there is incredibly friendly.

XeLWSsEgrS-wY55FhVrxaQ.text: Best tasting bagels in Arizona and of anywhere that I have tried in the world.  The owner makes you feel like family.  My son loves to go too.   My staple - bagel breakfast sandwich with lox.

wfnb0nAeLK0G7YrX2Ez2MQ.text: This place is fantastic, mom and pop shop feel, super friendly with customers and always efficient and tasty with their food.   Come here about 1 to 2 times a week and grab large orders for me and my co-workers never a complaint from anybody.   All varieties of bagels and bagel sandwiches are available and everything is always fresh, this place is a must.

JF9bGJvKLijE87qXQ28aNQ.text: I love this man.  The bagel man.  He is incredibly friendly, efficient and makes a HELLUVA bagel.  I've tried almost everything here, since it's in my hood, and the only complaint I have is that they're too busy in the mornings to take phone orders!    The first time I stopped in, I paid for my meal and he looked at me and said "you'll be back"... he was right, but I didn't think it would be the next morning!    It's nice when small businesses like this GET IT - and are able to consistently crank out a quality product within their niche.  Clearly his recipes are spot on, for the bagels and the schmear which are made fresh daily.  If you like bagels, or breakfast, or really personable small business owners, come here - you won't regret it!!

GKysSfE_VKb1CTKH434GNw.text: First time here while I'm in the area pet sitting. The owner and staff are super friendly and our breakfast bagel sandwiches were fresh, hot and delicious. Good coffee too. I will be visiting here from the North valley for sure. My husband and I are the only ones eating in as everyone else has been to go. Tomorrow I'm looking forward to the honey walnut raisin cream cheese on a cinnamon raisin bagel.  I really enjoy the simple decor and old school vibe.

Qrxyqel8xiF8ht-j9mnB9Q.text: Little hole in the wall. Wonderful fresh New York style breakfast bagels. If it were closer I would probably go every single morning

FjG3zksTEUfj_KvGbNa9lg.text: Cozy soup Nazi vibe in effect, no frills but best bagels in town. Ordered coffee to go w/ honey wheat Bfast bagel eggs,cheese,sausage. Best 5$ investment.   I was curious & asked the guy @the counter "what type of sausage" was included in the bagel & received very informative "sausage" answer...  Classic.

UONwunVpg6pICMFJnJ7G9g.text: I picked up 5 dozen bagels from the bagel man for work.  Everyone in the office loved them and could not stop asking where they were from.  The customer service while ordering was unbelievable.  He took very good care of the order and was very personable.  Great prices too.  I highly recommend this place.

zAOCLIr9hnkOpiQ8bU7a-Q.text: Love this place..I think it's the best bagel place in AZ. I lived in nyc for 13 years and loved bagels and those are the closest to nyc style I had in AZ...everything bagels with bacon and eggs is delicious

oMLJKjdrgCpXVJPYlIUx2g.text: First time here and I was greeted with smiles and warm fresh bagels.  Hole in the wall place, very small and cozy. Bagels were delicious and soft! You have to try the homemade cream cheese spread. It was amazing. I found my new bagel joint!

53voF2lBUn-X2TNPH0neQw.text: The bagels are always fresh, I didn't even know bagels could taste so good. Often times they are so warm I don't even get my blueberry bagel toasted.  The sandwiches are soooo good...

Mkjuf6ipVq3eJPCJ_uQ4Jg.text: He makes the bagles fresh daily in the True New York style. I never thought I would find this when I returned to Phx from NYC. The owner was friendly and committed to the quality of his product. I shall return, again and again...

TObMYDsC9f8Oq7a8UP_oXA.text: I've never been to this shop, but someone at my work brings these bagels in every Friday.. to Dunlap and Peoria. They are awesome bagels!!!! .. Very fresh, the absolutely best I've ever tasted anywhere.

Hda_ZrCEDuRBSIOefXtY0w.text: There is no better place for a bagel in this dry desert town than The Bagel Man.  You can close your eyes and smell the traffic out on the NYC street.  It's a little musty and stuffy from the bagel steam (or the swamp cooler).  You hear the friendliness of the Bagel Man himself, welcoming you in and wishing you well on your way.  And then you taste the warm, crust and soft insider of a fantastic bagel and cream cheese.   Perfection.

DxvsSbHYiqs_58dA4SF_Lg.text: Stuck in a nondescript strip mall in Ahwatukee is one of the biggest surprises you will find. Are you from back East or the Midwest? Do you miss real bagels so much that when you visit home and the first thing you do is run out and buy a real bagel?  Well, the wait is over. Real bagels straight from the East are here!    No more bread rolls shaped like bagels. Try any of these and you will know that you are dealing with a pro. Kal, the owner, owns a bagel shop back in New Jersey. This place is worth the drive. The owner is awesome. Visit this place and you cannot go wrong.   And if you think that Einstein's brothers offers a real bagel come and check this place out and find out what you've been missing for all these years!

fH8xJ05vw5ic_MjQQzuzVw.text: Frankly I thought they were awful, and I'm a bread eater. I could barely eat half. Now, I haven't completely given it the thumbs down because I only tried the bagel and the other stuff on the menu looks kind of good. I will update if and IF I ever come back. Now, as for the numerous people mentioning New Jersey. These are supposed to be NY bagels. Why is anyone mentioning Jersey. Once and for all! Jersey is not and never will be NYC. And I don't know where the rest of you are from in NY. Long Island perhaps? Buffalo maybe? Those are NOT NY bagels. Again, as in the pizza. Maybe its the water.

PicAAFSxiObUY_dFfkTnPw.text: The best in town! Nice big serving of tasty lox, capers, tomato, cream cheese.....wonderful! The only place I will go for my bagels. Super friendly people w great food and great service!

tl9UkTvTfjUsS0j7quSHow.text: They were out of lox so I quickly decided on a bacon, egg, and cheese on onion. I was not disappointed! That sandwich was made with love

Alk7cosTFVm15f95J-ssoA.text: Might need a 12 step program for this place!  Came for  lunch yesterday and brought the family back for breakfast,  everything was so good, took a few more and some cream cheese to go! Can't wait to come back for the Rueben!  Exit 143B on the Parkway (it's a Jersey thing!)

sC2_wtVduKyydyiDBXEyVA.text: Best bagel I've had in AZ! With fresh, yummy jalepeno cream cheese. Just what I was looking for!

Nv-jXqAz6WFQl9VMvCItAw.text: Awesome, awesome, awesome! Great bagels and really awesome customer service. Super friendly staff. The one complaint I have is that the place is an oven. Good god, I am surprised they haven't gotten heat stroke! Thankfully I get my order to go, mostly! Otherwise, you can't beat this place!

Bkl-DbwS3XbB2pp0mSjKtg.text: Delicious fresh bagels, and jalapeno cream cheese... Can't beat that! Oh and very nice staff!!

-vRWnueCc-DYlRccvat9aQ.text: Just stopped in for the first time. Got a simple bacon, egg and cheese on an everything bagel. Fantastic. I don't know how they make something so simple taste so good. Don't be thrown off by the small, slightly dated interior, this place is amazing!

uIqQdZRVeWjOBP2tnbQiDw.text: Absolutely perfect! Bagels are fluffy and delicious and right on target.  And the kicker... They have pork roll!  They make the best breakfast sandwiches and the prices will not drain your bank account.

xElT319xhEg6llHN8LoQ8g.text: This is the best place in AZ to get an authentic NYC bagel!  If you're looking for the bagel lox they know how to do it right.  Just like in NYC where they smother it in cream cheese and don't skimp on the lox.  You'll enjoy every bite.  They run out quickly so you have to show up early to get the bagel you want.  No other bagel shop I've been to compares to the size and taste of these amazing bagels from The Bagel Man.  The staff is always friendly and more than willing to help you decide on what to order.

H1jK9n4poMgmZ1_RGiC2vQ.text: Had to check out the place because of the reviews! It didn't WOW me like I was expecting, but they did gain a customer for sure!! The bagels were fresh and you had a multitude of choices.  A must try! Will be going back to try their lunch options! Side note... The Owner and Staff were very nice and attentive!

lcjJ_FZSp4Tt7tyiCM5kQQ.text: My husband and I were on the hunt for a good + local bagel place..and we found this little gem yesterday!! The owner is so personable, and so is everyone who works here. Something tells me we're going to be here every weekend!

pTTUsn3Njav_VPab8FHLHA.text: Great little place to get a coffee and bagel in the morning. Owner is super friendly and has great customer service. Will drive across town anytime to get one of his amazing bagels. Love love love this place!

vzWn-kc9x0LIiPNdTb9Y8Q.text: The owner is very passionate about his bagel's-- and cou van taste the difference.  My husband and I love getting everything bagels with bacon, egg, and cheese.  The restaurant is small and not very atmospheric, but the breakfast food is great & served quickly.

Kx6aZNQMomJKSBCyeZzbQQ.text: Gonna make this one short and sweet. . Really like this place . The bagels are awesome and always fresh .cant go wrong going to this place. The owner is really cool and always greet me respectfully .

7J3mSn2I-JrCuDssFHvmJA.text: I love small little local shops like this one!! All the staff was very friendly and asked us a couple times how everything was. They had great variety and the bagels were being baked fresh as we waiting for our food. I had the bagel with lox and cream cheese and it was amazing!

kxEBW81tEUzSOqU3YRQ6zw.text: I am from New York. I was born in Brooklyn. My first word was Bagel. This place is fantastic. The staff is super kind and attentive. It would stack up against several places I love back home.  If you are on a road trip and need breakfast, stop here.

yFLzJW-QD5aYim8-fe_ZXg.text: great bagels good crumb cake, but too much powdered sugar drowning out the crumbs friendly service the owner is from NJ Black and White cookies imported from Brooklyn

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States

m5THpRtKtz6z9FxrOtsXJQ.text: The bagels are great here. I usually end up getting a toasted wheat or sesame seed bagel with veggie cream cheese. The owner said he visited AZ six years ago and couldn't get a good bagel so he made it his mission to open another bagel shop (his family has one in NJ). I'm glad he did.   Good food, good prices, good place.

kUy5B4YIVNtCqksgk3A_Mw.text: I love the bagel man and the staff. Food is great I always get breakfast here when I'm on this side of town sometimes I even drive when I'm not just because I know the quality and service is excellent. I am an everything bagel type of girl with bacon egg and cheese.

xTFm3f0_qxmOvhTlM-vi0g.text: Best bagels in Phoenix! Delicious, fast and friendly service. I've had several different items from the menu but what prompted me to write this lovely review is the bagel I just had for breakfast which is a plain bagel toasted w/ veggie spread! I love this place.

1X57eC9m8Z4oypDMZH19fw.text: I've been search for five years now. The Bagel Man is the real deal. Finally, my fellow New Jersey-ite has brought the bagel to Phoenix. Gett'um hot on Sunday morning.

jrY7vvifRA4l8NhauTzdYg.text: I'm originally from jersey and the one thing I miss is a good jersey bagel no where has ever held up to the standards of what I grew up on thus far here in arizona. I stopped in today after hearing about this place and doing some research. The owner is the sweetest, nicest man ever as I told him how excited I was to try a bagel. To say the least he hit it out of the park. His bagels are exactly what a jersey bagel should be and I will definitely be going back and recommending it to anyone that asks for a good bagel. Keep up the great work and I'll be seeing you again soon!

pvd4WL8GU1SmjzU_kV-oEg.text: Cool place. It is rare to see the owner/operator still spending time at the counter, talking, greeting and even hugging some close customers. But their bagel is the best. I had a breakfast sandwich with lox and scrambled egg, onion, caper...that was delicious. Fresh and toasted everything bagel was absolutely the right base for all that on top. He even announced to incoming customers what kind of bagel just came off the baking oven...I have my eyes on either the Boss or the New York Ruben for the next return.

I7tXikbS7-JiWlRRq0I0xg.text: Great bagels, great prices and great service... that's all that needs to be said... and I'm from NY.

pjv99JKL3CkYaNuBw4x4QA.text: Highly recommend the Bagel Man! Prices are just right, the bagels are delicious. Owner is always friendly. Sometimes there's a line, it moves quick and the bagels are worth it. I've never been to NY but I hear from other customers that these bagels are spot on. Get there earlier in the morning though on the weekends--if you go later than 9 or 10 am they may be out of the bagel you want. (I always make sure to have a "backup" bagel plan.)

91nfxZVP-YEflkS1Q2KX_g.text: Nicest staff that I've encountered in a very long time. Reasonable prices. Speedy service & the food is amazing!! I love this place!!

1IsxpS59AayxHemvON0ezQ.text: Awesome bagels. If you have not had a bagel from the east coast this is the place to try. The cream cheese is very good as well. Service is what you would expect from a mom and pop shop...very personable service. Prices are very reasonable

uXRZ3kQWpMp2SVru5F_W4A.text: I am a regular costumer At the Bagel man! I love just a sesame began with cream cheese. So that they I forgot my $ at home. That did not stop me for getting my regular. When I told them that I did not have $ the Bengal man just said " don't worry you order whatever you want, you can pay later" . isn't that awesome, that we still have bruiseses like this that believe on the human kind and honesty. 5 stars for you Mr. bagel me, you made my dAy!

Fis9zVIJPjOYFEnMMA165w.text: I love this place! Cal is very sweet and so is his staff. They make a point to ask your name and seem genuinely happy to see you. The breakfast bagels are amazing (eggs, cheese, bacon mmmmm). Unlike other bagel places, they don't use a microwave to cook your breakfast. It does get packed on the weekends and others days, they may already be out of your favorite bagel type. That to me just means I've gotta get out of bed earlier. :) We'd be here at least weekly if I said "Yes." every time my 11 year old asks, "Can we get Bagel Man?". It takes a lot of self control to keep driving when I pass iron the way to work each day. :)

WPHDZTHDgGacP8kW9mwhFA.text: Now this is a real Bagel!  I love this spot...home grown NYC style, fresh, lots of cream cheese, no skimping here.   Owner is a cool guy and remembers you everytime.  Stop going to the chains and support the local man.  Regardless it's better then any other corporate joint...Trust me!

u53cR5P9fJxxlpkMBFr9XA.text: The best! Old style NY type bagels. The owners are great!  On weekends get here early am for bagels; they are gone early! Deli is all Boars Head. I suggest a hot pastrami on pumpernickel with swiss and mustard! Yum yum yum!

ZSJoYfdv5HumLXJhZ0ncNA.text: No need to bring bagels home from NY! These are chewy goodness. Try the toasted everything bagel with veggie cream cheese. Or the pumpernickel rye with a scallion schmear. Salt bagels sell out early!
