Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PwW_i-0voaupbZMii1B1VQ.text: Hands down the best bagel I have ever had! The owner is enthusiastic and energetic!   I highly recommend it.

Xhuf6ma873nCRfDtSFj49Q.text: The ONLY bagels I have found that are like those back East in NYC... And I've lived all over the country. Baked fresh daily and delicious.  PLUS... He has salt bagels!  If you love bagels and you're in the Ahwatukee/Chandler area. Then THIS is the place.

g2MciFc_HjarJK9jkrms6A.text: Place is legit. Great bagles. Very reasonably priced. Long lines of course, but that just shows how good they are. Don't pass this place up.

am7cXsMRfeXc8KjI6ljeHA.text: Best bagel I've had outside of Brooklyn. The owner is very nice and welcoming. The cream cheese is also fantastic and they make a great bagel breakfast sandwich.

SnevuRQG2BJNBplYGbe67A.text: This was the best bagel I've had all year.And for a plus the workers were so kind. That's the reason that it's the best ever bagel

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States

msZQAT9B2g0U4R8RL06N2g.text: It was super yummy!! Reminded us of when we were in Queens, NY. Great food, environment, friendly staff and bagels were as advertised, NY delicious.

A2VAV6ZfitcoUThVay_W_g.text: This place was awesome. Great food and great service. The owner Kal was there and hands-on working and making sure everyone is getting great service. After we order, he have us 3 extra bagel free..thank you! Fresh brew coffee was also so good.. definitely coming back.

gKU0VLBPVmLadhqH3DdCTw.text: I rarely give eateries 5 stars.  Many 4 stars (as I choose them diligently using Yelper's recommendations of course), but 5 stars is a rarity.  I gave The Bagel Man 5 stars for a couple fundamental reasons. 1) The food was delicious at a very reasonable price. 2) They were extremely friendly. Especially the person who I assumed was "the bagel man" himself.  That's it folks.  That's all it takes to earn a 5 star from this guy..... But it's a wonder I can't give out more of them....  I ate the Scrambled egg and lox on an everything bagel. Perfect!  My daughter had the scrambled egg and bacon on a plain bagel.  She said her's was very good also, but I'd have to say I won with my choice.   We will visit them again tomorrow before heading further north, and I plan on winning again!  Do yourself a flavor and check them out if you're in this hood.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scrambled eggs and lox on an everything bagel.  Scrambled egg and bacon on a plain bagel.  Delish!

PHDyPjKhDlfJcd4j8gj-PQ.text: Love this place! The bagels are homemade and the owner and staff are super friendly...been going for a few years now and no other bagel compares!

gk6kIZWCvBD4_mF0viQWgw.text: I was disappointed. I had a bagel with cream cheese.  I should have gotten the cream cheese on the side because it was way too much for me.  The bagel I had seemed a little overcooked.  Too brown.  Overall, I was not very impressed.  Maybe I hit them on an off day.

_480DXjwylMimxZGcFP9cA.text: I was looking for a breakfast sandwich like back home and this place has them!!! I loves my huge bacon,egg, and cheese on an everything bagel. Get past the decor to get a bagel,shear, or sandwich quickly!! I'll be back to try a reuben!!

YqSFbU-uH_dvwopuiDUHgw.text: I think this may be hands down, the best bagel I've had in AZ.  Originally from NY, I'm hard to please with this kind of stuff. The texture is like the bagels in L.I.  Crispy on the outside soft in the middle.  No one wants a dry bagel, at least I don't!    -Cheers,

9ycYhJBhoaaNB28PFN_x4w.text: My BF and I have been testing bagels throughout the Valley, trying to find our NY-style favorite. Coming from the East Coast we've been struggled to find good bagels and seafood. Well, The Bagel Man has both. The Lox was great and so was the wide variety of bagels.   Beyond the good food, this place also has a great atmosphere. Immediately upon entering the store, we were greeted by the owner and one of his staff members. We also got a few extra things thrown in our order, probably because we came in on a Sunday just before closing time.   Can't wait to be back.

tKmXDrPQhdvCUZl4zhm9kw.text: I guess I have to leave a long ass review? but why he's from New York City and he makes bagels end of story. This is the best damn bagels in the valley go get you some I just get everything bagel toasted with cream cheese and egg when I used to eat meat I use to get bacon or sausage used to go to everyday when I was pregnant. I don't see how people waste their money at Einsteins bagel. Man I would die for a bagel right now with some coffee, reminds me of when I was in New York City.

VnADCDj0qBMAeIDr6wSSyQ.text: Nothing, I mean nothing, will ever beat an H & H bagel if you are from the NYC area. But I have to say I was pleasantly surprised while in Phoenix last week to have a delish NY style bagel shop across the street from my hotel.  The Bagel Man makes a good bagel. And even better tuna salad and I am a tuna lover.  Better than my Jewish mom's tuna salad!  It even came with a pickle and some pretty decent potato salad. They even have some deli sandwiches. All at reasonable prices. How good is this place?  They close at 2pm and by 1:30 when we got there they only had 3 bagels left. Not 3 flavors, 3 bagels.  Got my pumpernickel, hubby got the last poppy. Now I have to fly back to Phoenix for the tuna on an everything bagel and get there before closing.

1N7ZDXdROAMEStyIZw0Mlw.text: Fresh made bagels restocked every few minutes. Owner is the cashier and obviously the Bagel Man. I've recently become a fan of Lox and theirs is awesome, also can't go wrong with any of the Breakfast sandwiches, I love that they have peanut butter and jelly. Service is awesome and super speedy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States

I7wML0Bljc0f77kbrZ3XDQ.text: Another Yelp breakfast search success! Bagel Man whips up one delicious breakfast sandwich that hollers New York authenticity. The eggs, meat, and cheese bust out from the fresh and spongy bagels. There's a reason they're called Bagel Man and not Bagel Boy - this is a grown up establishment.  I came through on a Saturday morning. Craving eggs and coffee, I had searched Yelp while driving through the area. The outstanding reviews convinced me so I pulled on over. The restaurant can be a little cramped with the counter taking up most of the space. My eyes darted around the large menu behind it, covered in tasty bagel options. They've got quite the spread, and I don't mean what goes on your bagel! The smear options go for days.   I ordered the scrambled eggs with sausage and cheese on a wheat bagel. It came out wrapped up in foil to go. The bagels are soo good. They consistency isn't bready, it's more pliable and buttery. The trick is in the boiling and baking. Very scientific.   The store is a little warm, but the real heat is coming from their kitchen. Check out this gem of a bagel shop off the I-10/Elliot.

10FdV4Au95nj6Lne174MvA.text: This place was awesome!!! It was recommended by a friend. It was my first time there, I ordered the breakfast bagel with lox and tomatoes!! Dayum dayum dayum!!!!!

pJumWN4KP_mWxdsfyhjrEg.text: Very good soft bagels!  Owner a little ill mannered though but still enjoyed the bagel schmear.

gxluat1ZVE7kcNRvp_imPQ.text: Update on my review, still 5 stars! Love this place and come several times a week.  I have no idea why you would go to any other bagel place in a 5 mile radius, well except on Mondays when they are closed.  My suggestion is a Bacon, Egg, and Cheese on a Cinnamon Raisin, it will change your life.  The Boy loves their Scrambled Eggs with Lox sandwich which is an amazing deal.  His sandwich is always loaded up and feels like it weights pounds.  The Boy and I always say we wish we would try their lunch sandwiches but I love their bagels by themselves so I stick with that.  They have had a minor change in prices so the older photos of the menu are out of date but don't let that stop you from visiting.  All the Points to Bagel Man!

0osPOEuuzXqzRoldfNiraw.text: If you're like me, a New Yorker, we all crave a taste of NYC..... you will simply not taste a better bagel in all of Phoenix. AND I assure you, I have tried everyone's bagels in this town.  For all of you that think it is only the water of NYC that makes a good bagel..... you're wrong. This bagel man makes a bagel to die for.  Just get there in the moring when the bagels are fresh. if you get there between 7 am and 9 am, you will be in for a real NYC treat. AND his veggie cream cheese is also magic.

aFOYUwfyHDhGFebiCRNsnQ.text: Simply the best bagel in the east valley and possibly the entire valley. Chewy, with a wonderful crunchy shell. The everything bagel toasted with scallion cream cheese is perfection.

avOv_TdBTaR2KKWbfXQwag.text: I tried this place for the 1st time last week. WHERE have they been my whole life. Best bagels ever, great customer service. I drive out of the way just to get ny fix!

G3uevi_bbP_E5PCTeXWMqw.text: Probably some of the best bagels you will find in AZ. This is a tiny little store located in the Ahwatukee area of Phoenix. Very minimal seating area so this will mainly be a spot for taking your bagel or bagels to go. My wife and I ordered their breakfast sandwich on a sesame bagel and dang was it delicious. Their bagels have great texture from a slightly crispy exterior to a chewy and delicious center. I would highly recommend checking this spot out especially if you are a bagel-lover like myself. Exceptional bagels.

Ho-KxFM_MT7xI89UR6AUgw.text: I read all these wonderful reviews about this place. My family was so excited to try this place. We arrived at 10am on a Saturday.  It opened at 6am and closed at 2pm. Apparently,  they can close earlier if they sell out. When we arrived, there was already a line out the door. It was a tiny little cafe. A lot of people were ordering their food to go. We stood in line for about 25 min before we could order. When we got up to order, half of their bagels were already sold out. The plain bagels were even gone. We ordered 5 bagels and 1 bagel sandwich. My husband ordered The Sexy sandwich. It had Turkey and roasted peppers in it. He said it was ok. The Turkey tasted fresh, but the sesame bagel had an overpowering taste though. They were all out of plain bagels. The other bagels were humongous. They were quite chewy and flavorful. The Raisin Walnut Cream cheese was delicious.  They had many topping options for bagels, such as various cream cheese and jelly.  So just make sure that you get there early to get first choice on foods.  The bathrooms were clean and well kept.

ocgKuheQvuorPTSWgu_SXA.text: This place is literally across the street from my apartment and I cant believe it took me almost a year to try this place. These bagels are bomb. Baked fresh every morning. They're huge too! My go to is their breakfast sandwiches. With egg chz & sausage on an everything bagel with a side of jalapeno cream chz! After the first time I stopped in, i was hooked.

JqZEmAXOu9CaYXUxBer1ZQ.text: Really good bagels. However the restaurant owner and employees need to do a deep cleaning of the store. There was literal dirt, dust and cobwebs all over the walls, also the floors didn't appear to be swept in awhile. Also, both times I've been there, the AC was out. Totally understandable during the summer months, but makes it unbearable to stand in line.  Overall the food is good. But it is unappetizing when you see the place not clean.

YbSUnJRt8HqpPsa-zhLZ1A.text: If you want a big delicious bagel then check this place out. Everything is made from scratch. The staff is fast and friendly.

2tFRDNN6e538BJyW4TDX6w.text: Came here after reading yelp reviews. I know a good NY bagels, this place did not disappoint! Inside, it was steaming hot. Much too hot to sit inside the small space with the few tables they had. I ordered an everything bagel with scallion cream cheese. My husband got a sesame bagel with jalapeno cream cheese and our son had a cinnamon raisin bagel with honey walnut spread. All delicious and obviously boiled bagels with the chewy texture and nice outside that crisps right up with toasting. I took off 1 star because the woman working the counter skipped us, then ignored us. They also stopped making egg bagels because they said Arizona is too dry. All True NY bagel places have an egg bagel which is what I wanted

In new York I prefer plain but this place I like the variety.   They are smaller than the New York ones. Try it it's great

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This is a great meal.  Big enough for 2. Smoked salmon to perfection

r4IeaGONac_ZEhNSxYsHmQ.text: I usually don't write reviews, but I thought I had to for this place. Just so no one else has their hopes up that they've actually found a proper bagel place in Phoenix.   This is one of the handful of places in Phoenix that I've tried to find a decent bagel at and is by far the worst.  I got somewhat excited when I read all the reviews saying this place is the best they've had outside of NY or that the owner apparently has a bagel shop back east. But, I've come to the realization that whenever someone says that on Yelp they're either lying or they must of been going to some horrible places back east to begin with.  The bagels look more like Kaiser rolls than bagels... Where is the hole in the middle? The texture is more like toasted bread rather than the soft chewy texture that a proper bagel should have.   Also, I don't know if this place makes its own cream cheese. But I got the plain cream cheese and it was completely sour. Not something you want to be eating.   So far the most 'authentic' bagel I've found is the Lenders frozen ones you can find at grocery stores.

AkbrMakEIp9MVQWsW9eJwg.text: So in love!!  Awesome bagels..can't wait to try the sandwiches!  Space was a little dark and strange, but customer service was great, as was the food.  We'll be back!

05LSuPQNUKqp7riIfbR_3A.text: KThis is a good store to go to for bagels. I had a Jalapeno bagel with cream cheese and it was delicious. It would have been nice if I could have stayed a little longer and read the paper but the seating was fairly Limited. There are three tables outside and for small tables inside. Putting a few additional tables outside certainly would not hurt this business.  There are plenty of options on the menu and you can see that they are making the bagels fresh in the back. There's also a good selection of deli meats displayed at the front counter. I would say this is a great place to pick up a dozen bagels for the office. Also, the people who work there were very friendly and I noticed that a few regulars made conversation with the owners. I'm happy to support a small business like this

GWFhnoQWBGswG-6vmklOvQ.text: WOW  I used to think there were 2 types of bagels: grocery store bagels and bagel shop bagels. BUT NO, theres GOOD bagel shop bagels and these are darn GOOD.   $12 for a bakers dozen is a deal hard to beat for fresh bagels. Crunch on the outside, fluffy on the inside. They are literally the size of my face. I eat half a bagel and I'm FULL for 8 hours.  They have a large variety of flavors and all of them that I've tried are AMAZING.   I haven't gotten the chance to try any bagel sandwiches here yet, but I'll be coming back to do so soon.  Recommendations:  - Veggie Cream Cheese   Environement: 4/5 Food: 5/5 Price: 5/5 Service: 5/5

dLh7p7_p6BBl_f6Hyjx1rA.text: Good bagels. Not NY bagels, but good; crunchy exterior, big and fluffy, and mine were still warm, straight from the oven. They have a variety of cream cheese schmeers, including olive! And of course lox spread too. But..... The have TAYLOR HAM!!! (Pork Roll for the uninitiated.) On a bagel. With egg and cheese. Heaven.

2hLimUXGsVBSmGJ_4I2jeA.text: I love this place, but this is twice now that the bagels came with a little amount of cream cheese on them which beats the purpose of getting a "bagel w/ cream cheese". Also, not a fan of the egg bagel at all.   Nonetheless, I will be back here time and time again because of how delicious the bagels normally are and service being great.

GLuewNDB8R6SdMcStmb6CA.text: I used to LOVE Bagel Man. When Cal first opened up, the place had a line out the door, and it was THE breakfast place. Yesterday was definitely my last time there, this place has gone way downhill. There's never any management there, so the staff is always just screwing around, joking and laughing. Then they get my order wrong every damn time. I literally order the same thing every time I go in there, and the girl even tells me my order before I say it... then they make it wrong, and it's not even on a bagel. Yesterday when I was waiting for my order, someone else came back cause his was wrong too. Wtf! Seriously done, I don't have time for that crap.

kcIsx_Q8reNrVqtG7E9OtA.text: Came here for the first time today and can't believe I didn't discover them sooner. I love bagels and this no-frills locally owned shop does them really well! Even when there's a line they work through the orders pretty fast and the wait is worth it. Their breakfast sandwiches are great and I really like how they make their eggs.   And just a warning, if you go there near closing (like I did) they may run out of certain bagels. Was sad I didn't get to try their Everything bagel, but will definitely be back another time!

lZ6WvAF6M9PLuBtzPHajAQ.text: Three stars because the bagels are delicious. The service isn't good because they move in slow motion. Not rude, just slow and uninterested. The real issue with this place is they seem to run out blueberry and cinnamon raisin. They always have bins full of onion bagels... but they  Can't seem to figure that out. I like blueberry bagels but I have struck out three times recently so I have to cross this shop off my list. Very sad, because the bagels are good but if they can't make them I can't waste my time trying to catch them with one on han.   Like an idiot I tried again today to get a blueberry bagel and they were out. Again. Waited 15 minutes to be told they were out. I'm done. These guys are just inept. Terrible way to run a business. I will NEVER go back. I wish there was a zero star option.

ix72GT4X0cdFLJG3utKiSA.text: In general, I make it a habit to visit any restaurant that has a line out the door.  In fact, the longer the line the better.  Which is just what happened one sunny Saturday recently in Phoenix, when I was visiting a bucket list fabric store and (coincidentally) felt my empty tummy rumbling.  As I pulled out of the parking lot I noticed several out-of-place people standing outside a nondescript strip mall establishment.   Who are these people?  I asked myself.  Why are they just standing...on the sidewalk...on a Saturday morning?  And then I spotted the sign above them: "The Bagel Man" it read in big red letters.  A quick peek at Yelp told me all I needed to know: it was here that I'd be stopping for breakfast.  So I parked the car and got in line.  I didn't even care what was on the other end of that line.  I just knew it would be good.   I waited patiently, and eagerly, with the smell of fresh-baked goodness wafting past me.  I ogled the deli case, full of delicious-sounding house-mixed cream cheeses.  I thumbed my debit card as the line inched painfully forward.  Finally, it was almost my turn.  And just then, as if by magic, I heard two amazing words:  FRESH SESAME!  They were yelled from the bagel chef (er, baker?) as he tossed about a dozen puffy sesames into one of the many bagel baskets behind the front counter.  But the guy in front of me had heard the announcement too.  His forehead was practically sweating as he uttered the words "I'll take a dozen sesame."  I wanted to beg him to take pity on me!  "Give me my favorite bagel!  Please!  I love sesame bagels.  For goodness sake, I ONLY WANT ONE!"  But I didn't.  As if by fate, though, his young daughter said "Daddy, can I have a plain bagel?"  So he swapped a sesame for a plain and you know how this story ends: the sesame bagel was mine.  ALL MINE!  I got it with a thick smear of lox cream cheese, quickly ran to my car, and devoured the whole thing in about 2 minutes.  Okay, 5 minutes.  And as I proceeded towards the airport and a flight home, I regretted I hadn't gotten one for the plane ride!

0crugNns2KeAFytEq0wQbw.text: This place has amazing bagels. I am a bagel snob, I usually ship in my bagels from NYC, but now that I have found The Bagel Man, I will be getting all my bagels from here. They are better than my usual bagels from NYC that I have been eating for years. The bagels are huge, very flavorful, and authentic.

lbimQhWKWxr_Fnx5zqa2eg.text: Sooo good! This is my first visit here. I went close to closing time so they were almost out of everything. I ordered the chicken melt and it was delicious! Order macaroni salad with it. I would defiantly come back I would just get there earlier!

5-eCG7v6BCtkxq3CxQyDSQ.text: The bagels were good, maybe a bit too salty that day.  The staff was nice but they all seemed to be new so the logistics were still being worked out.  Atmosphere is lacking inside or out.  Room for improvement.

rs3ts-fomjKLe7ywaRYoFw.text: I've had friends ship bagels to me from New York and they were always better than anything I can get here in Phoenix. The bagels here at Bagel Man are just as good as anything I've had from New York. The service is good and friendly. Prices are great. Sandwiches are awesome. My favorite is the Rich & Famous on a salt bagel. Definitely worth the trip.

1uKPMSEclC4ckl8FU4LOiQ.text: These bagels are AWESOME! This is the first time I have been to this place, and I live very close to it. I called about 5 minutes before they closed and ordered 3 dozen bagels for a meeting at work. The person I spoke with was bright, happy, and very helpful. I needed these bagels at about 6:45 the next morning. I went in to pick them up and the place smelled delicious and it was clean. They were ready to go for me when I walked in the door, all I had to do was pay. On top of that, they were actually baker's dozens. For this being my first time, I gotta say this place rocks. I will totally be back for more, and I will send any busines to this place that I can!

S7QRzaXmpsPTRRHPd-sTlg.text: Had my first sandwich from the bagel man today. It was really tasty. They make the bagels there at the shop. I will definitely be back.

PJ79fj1eM2k-zqer9YQTyg.text: Just stopped in for my first bagel from The Bagel Man...WOW! I'm confident in saying this was the best bagel I've ever had. I had the everything bagel, toasted, with their scallion cream cheese on the side. First of all, they put toppings on both sides of the bagel, which is awesome! No more debating which half of the bagel to eat first (I'm looking at you, Einsteins everything bagel!) Second, the bagel was perfectly baked, slightly crunchy outside, moist and chewy inside. And the scallion cream cheese was the icing in the delicious bagel cake. I also spoke to the extremely friendly owner, and I'm so glad to hear that business is going well for him. The only trouble with this place is it's very close to my office, and I'm afraid of all the money I'm going to be spending here!

NfPpnh9EcVDF_rJN2uoUww.text: Have fun selecting your favorite flavors knowing that The Bagel Man makes bagels that are better than you will find elsewhere around town.  This makes all the difference.  I have had more fancy styles on the east coast, but I haven't had better bagels.  Try the olive spread.

BoOeL0CBSghzEGy8XqsycA.text: The bagels are fantastic! I work near here and stop by for lunch from time to time. They use Boar's Head deli meat which is the only way to go in my opinion. They are also very quick to make my food, which I definitely appreciate. The restaurant is small and no frills, but the service and food are terrific!

z48noqvSs1_vzLe5gkGoZQ.text: It's True. These are the best bagels I've come across in Arizona. The bagels had a delicate and flaky exterior with a soft interior. I came across this gem when my friend, originally from Brooklyn, was adamantly searching for a bagel reminiscent of the ones he found in his hometown.  Cal, the owner, was genuine and remembered my friend and me just after one stop to his shop. If looking for a place to buy quality bagels, there will not be many other stores rivaling The Bagel Man.

6ws9BLVHLkkQ87AFXL7hKA.text: Driving from UofA in Tucson to California at 7am. So glad we yelped bagel places and found this place! Friendly staff, delicious bagels and a perfect amount of cream cheese. Yum! Thanks Bagel Man!

ibaRCyH1YjVT-Gc4-lLj5A.text: Blueberry Bagel is fresh yummy bagel heaven. Thanks Bagel man.

8kcTqFryBGMDUIOzUArS_Q.text: Probably one of the best experiences I have had in recent memory.  Not only were the bagels superb (I got the bacon, egg, & cheese on everything) but the service and friendliness of "Mr. Bagel" were top-notch.  If you like NY-style soft bagels, do yourself a favor and go here.  Wish this was in DC!!  I will DEFINITELY be back!!

JimZz1Tp5AqWT554Bbvzng.text: I love this place. It is the ONLY place I will buy bagels from. When I moved from NY to AZ over a decade ago, I failed to anticipate that the every day staples of food I grew up with exist in very limited supply out here. My every-Sunday-morning-breakfast consisted of a bagel w/ cream cheese and some smoked salmon. Throw in a cup of coffee, the morning paper, and you have my perfect Sunday morning. Fast forward to me residing in AZ; where are the bagels at?! No, I don't mean rolls that are shaped like donuts (most places that sell "bagels" like Chompies, Back East Bagels, and other chains that don't do this food justice). I mean big, crusty on the outside, and dense soft dough on the inside bagels. Here is where The Bagel Man comes in. The taste, the texture, and the quality is the closest to anything I grew up with. All of their variety tastes good and fresh. Their staff is very friendly. If you want the best, be there at opening; but if you get there before me, save me some 'Everything', 'Sesame', and 'Onion' bagels. BTW, their smoked salmon/lox with cream cheese actually has chunks of smoked salmon in it versus the other guys who whip their cream cheese to the point that all I see is some pink in my cream cheese. Thank you, The Bagel Man for restoring my Sunday mornings.

FSM0Zn6jljDIGQja8bJBig.text: This place is yummy! I had the everything bagel with jalepeno  cream cheese. It was delicious and the owner is really cool too. The only reason I gave this place 4 out of 5 stars is because it's my second favorite bagel shop in the valley. Definitely the best on that side of town. My favorite is all the way east kokobelli :)

ZalaGkf1VgEsTppJBLIprA.text: Great Bagels!   Owner is real deal.  13 bagels for $10 great deal.

OOSSmNCdHuVP9lgC7hZjaw.text: I've only been to New York once.  So if you're looking for comparisons to independent bagel shops back east, you're barking up the wrong review.   That said, it sure seems like plenty of Yelp reviewers (and even the Phoenix New Times) are willing to stick their necks out and declare this valley bagel shop worthy of New York style buzz.  I like bagels.  I'm not devoted to bagels, but I like them.  So on a Saturday morning around 8am, I figured I'd stop by and see what all the fuss was all about.  Owner Kal Salih's The Bagel Man can be found on the southwest corner of 51st Street and Elliot in Ahwatukee, just a stone's throw west of the I-10 freeway.  This is actually the second location for The Bagel Man (the original is run by Kal's brother just outside NYC).  So this place at least on paper brings the east coast bagel credentials to the table.  Arriving at 8am, the place was packed with 12 patrons in line in front of me.  The lines can certainly be attributed to their popularity, but also to its tiny size (with seating for 15 only), and to a bit of disorganization (more on that in a bit).  After waiting my turn for about 15 minutes, I stepped up to give my order.  There are at least a dozen different types of bagels to choose from at any one time, with Kal's crew visible in the back making new ones as fast as they can crank them out.  You've got your plain, sesame, poppy, onion, garlic, salt, egg, honey wheat, pumpernickel rye, blueberry, cheese, and even your "everything" bagel.  But for my first foray, I got one of their Cinnamon Raisin bagels.  I opted to go with a breakfast sandwich in fact.  Sausage, egg, and cheese on a toasted cinnamon bagel to be exact.  Total cost?  $5.  Now here's where they lose me a little bit, and perhaps where The Bagel Man might be a victim of its own success.  Before, during and after I ordered, the front crew were kind of a mess.  They mixed up a number of orders, they forgot mine for a brief period, and there wasn't a consistent flow of responsibilities.  At times the crew stopped everything, huddled in a group for something they were confused about and left us hanging.  In fact the gal at the front register walked away to fix a coffee issue right in the middle of me telling her my order.  I'm not sure if today's front crew was less experienced or just not on their A game, but a more efficient operation would've kept the line moving at a much faster clip.  There, now that we've gotten that out of the way, how's the bagel (and more specifically the bagel sandwich I got)?  Divine.  The bagel is a perfect mix of crispy and chewy.  The cinnamon and raisins don't overpower the dough flavor as other bagel shops often do and its the perfect vehicle for all those breakfast fixins.  Most of the patrons in line this morning were ordering bagels by the dozens (one guy ordered 4 dozen).  Given how my bagel tasted, I get why.  So to sum up the verdict, yes I do buy the hype around the bagels themselves.  Fresh made, done right, and priced right.  The service at the counter left something to be desired, though clearly the long line suggests they have regulars ready and willing to accept a little inconvenience.  Seating is limited (I found one, but I got lucky), so chances are you'll be coming here for take out only.  New Yorkers, feel free to judge for yourself.  But locals are clearly going nuts for these bagels, and rightfully so.

Typically, my go-to is some sort of sweet bagel like blueberry with a savory cream cheese and sausage with egg, topped with cheese. Or a savory bagel with a sweet cream cheese and same toppings. Or just have everything savory and switch it up with ham instead of sausage. Lol there are so many options and they are all THE BEST.

That and we were eating AYCE sushi nearby and I just so happened to remember this place. Wee!  These bagels are the size of my face. We came by to pick up six bagels and they gave us three for free! I want to say it's because he saw the absolute bagel-lust in my eyes and felt my love for carbs resonating out of me but in reality, it was nearing closing time and he knew it was my first visit. ijkIAMSdBh5z5j3LVilo-w.text: This place really surprised me! After listening to my mom rave on about the delicious bagel place by her house, she convinced me to stop in while I was visiting. The bagels from this place are huge! You could probably make two meals out of them if you really wanted. We got them for breakfast and I ate half and could have saved the rest for later if I wasn't headed out that day.   I went with the cinnamon raisin bagel. It had a good consistency and wasn't overly chewy. The bagel was pretty flavorful. I went the maple walnut raisin cream cheese on it and it didn't disappoint. The raisins in the cream cheese were fresh. The cream cheese was very thick on my bagel and maybe too much for people, but I'd rather scrape some off than have too little.   For what it's worth I live in Albany, NY and still think these bagels are amazing...and I've had a lot of east coast bagels in my day!

9CDOIpv0HMwRI53YGWFSlw.text: I hopped on my Yelp app looking for a place nearby my work where I could grab a quick sandwich and I found the Sub Factory.  As I pulled into the parking spot, I noticed the Bagel Man right next door with a Boars Head sign in the window.  No contest.  I love Boars Head so I decided to go there instead.  From the outside, it doesn't look like much, it doesn't look like much from the inside either - small and no attention to the decor at all.  An incredibly friendly gentleman greeted me and he could immediately tell it was my first time there.  I told him I wanted a turkey sandwich with mozzarella and while trying to decide on what type of bread I wanted, he suggested I eat it on a bagel, he said that I can't find bagels like that anywhere else and promised me that this wouldn't be my last visit to his bagel shop.  I found him irresistible, it may have been the accent combined with the fact that I had just returned home from NYC where these little bagel shops owned by foreigners are in abundance.  Since it was late in the day, already past 2:00 by the time I was able to break away from work, the bagel options were slim so I settled on a salt bagel which I had never had before.  When I got back to my office and started eating my sandwich I realized that he was right, the bagel was delicious and he made a patron out of me.  I've been back four times and I get the same amazing service each time and I haven't veered from the salt bagel yet, it's so delicious.  When my dad wanted to meet me for breakfast we met here and he thought it was a great little bagel shop, too.  Next time there is a morning meeting at work, we're ordering from this place, forget Einstein's!

ISFHZJBDlJXPer9pZW1MRg.text: Not impressed. This was my first and last visit here. From the moment I walked in was not good. Two separate entrance people unsure of where to form the lines or where to order. Ordered a lightly toasted chicken salad sandwich and got it home and found it burned (so much I couldn't eat it) with barely a bite of chicken in it.  Paid way to much.

N6gcpPhXfeN4Y4AfVoFsng.text: Seriously, if you're into bagels you MUST come here! Consider it a sacred pilgrimage for all bagel lovers.  The actual "Bagel Man" is always available to greet and assist his loyal flock. He makes bagels once each morning and when they are gone the shop closes, so get here early!  Just thinking about this place makes me want to camp outside until he opens again in the morning. The bagels have a wonderful crisp outside with a sensual chewy inside. I won't even compare them to other "wanna-be" bagel joints in the area because that would be downright disrespectful. He makes a mean bagel sandwich and potato salad too! I almost forgot to mention he makes his own cream cheese spreads too. The store itself isn't full of frills, nor will you find a fancy lounge area because it's not about the shop, it's about the BAGELS! Get them to-go!

-HVmSWGZVsoNUBOkTVUCUQ.text: If you haven't been here for a bagel, you're missing out. It a small shop with a big New York feel. Bagels and everything on their menu is top notch.

5wG_KV73CYrUKntiicXzyA.text: Fantastic bagels! They toast them just enough so the bagels are hot, but still chewy and soft when you get them. The bagels are fresh and fluffy, try one of the lunch bagel sandwiches. The place is small with a line but it moves quickly.

Y5orZDKKnlQt612u5LlNow.text: Staying by the airport and saw the great reviews for this place.    Took uber over and was not disappointed.    Great service and great bagels

5_IxEYA9nBjeNMNYBvMA8A.text: I saw the review for this place in my email and went right over. The bagels were just coming out of the oven....could smelll them the whole way home....got bagels with cream cheese...OMG! The bagels & the cream cheese were delicious!! Ive been looking for a place like this in AZ forever!!! YOU GOTTA TRY IT!

-qQPncrQTHy7WOcJfjVHDQ.text: Amazing bagels made for you by amazing employees. They are so quick and very friendly. Great customer service!! They even allow call ahead pick up. I gave 4 stars only because they are not open Monday's though and the place is a little small so when there is a line you feel crunched or in the way of everyone else. Did I mention the bagels are amazing?

d1wYN9pFKunMOs6XsLMJLQ.text: Pork roll, egg and cheese on everything?  Yes they got that. And probably the only place in AZ that has pork roll, or even knows what it is. I ordered it and the guy automatically knew I was from Jersey. These are real bagels. Not rolls with holes.  If there are two things that sum up a man from Jersey its bagels and pork roll. Damn close to the bagels I know and love from my hometown. Though I live in Gilbert I will be making the drive to Ahwatukee for my dozens.

uC8zM3fmcX1eEInwS7QLbA.text: Went to The Bagel Man for the fist time, very disappointed.  The bagel is just a glorified bread roll, not boiled and baked as advertised.  We ordered 2 bagel and lox sandwiches,  but they had no flavor, no capers, no onion and no lemon. Won't go back.

sYHXorBggdIi6Ekcedvb3Q.text: Very, very good.   This place could be a selling point when convincing New Yorkers to move to the Phoenix area.   This makes my top two bagel places, the other one being an older bagel shop in NYC. I got a [fresh] everything bagel with lox spread, and it was a highlight of my day.   The staff were very courteous and attentive, and provided excellent service.  In sum, you can keep reading Yelp reviews, or you can go and experience it for yourself. I suggest the latter.

yIduORqhJT8mZqKwDexW8Q.text: A friendly atmosphere with an amazing owner. He always lets me wait for the freshest bagel and is from the northeast and my hometown so he definitely understands what makes a good bagel. Don't waste your time at einsteins bagel. I've recommended his restaurant to many people, no one has been disappointed!

eVxA54Dp3wPr01FlbbJFxg.text: I was born and raised in New York. These are the best bagels I have ever had. It feels like New York inside The Bagel Man. I love it.

bbm159F1Vg4w9UYqbHycTA.text: Oh the humanity of it all, that your located in Awatukee. Let me start by saying that this bagel shop is clean; that being said there is no atmosphere but who is expecting atmosphere in a bagel shop. The bagels are some of the best I've had in Phoenix and definitely worth the drive. I found the owner (I'm guessing he was the bagel man) to be polite, client orientated, and knowledgeable. If I didn't know any better I would say that the bagel man is from a small town somewhere, because memories of my childhood in the Midwest were reminiscent as we experienced all that was the bagels from the bagel man.  Mr. Bagel man all you need to do now is deliver bagels to my office in downtown phoenix and the world would be tolerable.

DElVUdZfCePNgdDnO5D6GA.text: Hello. Need to educate. From Brooklyn Staten Island Catskills New York  and Nj. Loved the bagel mans style of bagel. Had the jalapeno plain with nothing on it and the everything plain nothing on it. Would come back and purchase bagels again. I have eaten from the best ny bagel bakeries in the ny area for 55 years. AUTHENTIC BAGELS ARE BOILED AND THEN BAKED. Like any baker it is an art. Fact, these bagels are excellent in their own right. They are not New York style bagels in the least bit. Anyone claiming they are is out of touch with reality. If you are from New York and are looking for authentic style jewish ny bagels then a trip to chompies bakery in Scottsdale is where they have the old style rye breads pumpernickel breads bagels and cakes that you grew up with back in the 1950's. Chompies also has a Sattelite store on w frye rd by the chandler mall. This being said I enjoy both styles very much. The classic ny chompies style bagel and the bagel mans recipe for his bagels which are excellent also. As for NEW JERSEY, there is no such thing as a nj style bagel. You can buy a bagel at 50 different stores in nj and get 50 different tastes and textures. There is only one way to make a classic by style Jewish bagel which is where they originated but there are thousands of variations. The bagel man makes one of the best variation of a NY STYLE BAGEL, but the taste and texture have nothing to do with the ny original. Call it an Arizona style bagel and it hands down wins the title best Arizona style bagel

X0HSc61drGO-lUKLOUxmTw.text: Best bagels outside new York or jersey. Great job bagel man!!!

O81RsImdFtT4lhQH4asjjw.text: Super fluffy bagel with house-made scallion cream cheese,, lox, tomato, onion, and capers! Yum!

bDFrR0luGH6W5npQu0itsQ.text: I come here every weekend and it never disappoints. The staff is so friendly and the food is great. I'm from the east coast and I've spent the last three years looking for a place with authentic bagels. I can never go back to Einsteins after eating here.

p9oVLotmnnBCSNDranokHQ.text: Best spot in AZ for real bagels. As a jersey girl, these guys are the real deal. Tastes just like back home. Amazing.

v2Mbf2Btpw_30F8tvJb87A.text: The best bagels in phoenix area... Been here couple of times never disappointed. Friendly staff great service .

fv7yMAS2cRszY05zd3Hcyg.text: This is my morning stop every weekday. Best bagels in town, staff is incredibly friendly and the owner loves his business. I am a regular and I can't imagine changing that habit anytime soon. My personal favorite is the salted bagel preferably right out of their ovens.

C6nvfokp4Lea2KeYAtWxBA.text: I had a breakfast sandwich with bagel and egg.  Wife had breakfast sandwich with bagel, egg and cheese.  Hers was much better.  Mine was okay, but the melted cheese really made the sandwich.  We also ordered a bagel to go.  Bagels were very tasty...  crispy on the outside and a little chewy on the inside.  Everything just tasted very fresh.  Would definitely eat here again, even though we live in Tucson.

AYub0y5pAEfsCtq2RjUtfg.text: I would give this place a 5 but every time I come in for breakfast 2 hours before they close... They always sell out before they close. This place makes there bagels fresh every day, but doesn't seem to make enough for the demand.. The owner is really sweet, and the staff is great.. But there sacking on making enough bagels... When I get my hands on 1 they are amazing! Should be voted best bagels in Arizona, hands down..

klFl3gHWyLKJCULH4zIuvw.text: Sweet sassy molassey! These are some gooooood bagels. In fact, I think these are the best bagels I've ever had. You have to try some. They will change the way you look at breakfast breads forever!

UYuRcqm9hgx2ssZRAnKIKQ.text: These bagels are great! Its been awhile since some thing tasted like NY,but this guy has got it going on.Breakfast sammie's are fantastic.Well worth the drive.

8hnSJGhqW6pZ4g16VAMpZA.text: If I were just talking bagels here we'd be at a 5 star. This place has some of the tastiest bagels I've come across here in the valley and they are all made fresh on premises using the old NY boil and bake. The Bagel Man himself seems to be working as a jack of all trades up front serving customer and working the bakery.   I was pretty impressed that the selection of bagels included some classics like salt (my favorite) and pumpernickel rye along with some unusual recipes including walnut multi grain (will be trying this) and chocolate chip.   My gourmet lunch sandwich ingredients couldn't really improve upon the perfectly cooked salt bagel they were placed upon. The sandwiches are piled with quality deli meats and cheeses and the 'gourmet list' included a choice of macaroni salad, chips or potato salad all for $5.50. I tried the macaroni salad, which was the  and it was very okay, also heavy on the mayo and light on flavor.  I am pretty happy to have another friendly option for breakfast around the office and will back for more salt bagels as well as to try the lox soon.

3lAjnGEjqDNg2AxV7mx6lA.text: "The  Bagel Man" opened his shop a little over a year ago and I have always wanted to stop in and see what it is all about.  I do a lot of traveling and I always look forward to enjoying a fresh bagel whenever I get to the east coast.  Authentic New York Bagels are very hard to find on the west coast.  This morning I was out and about and decided to stop in and pick up some bagels to share.  The Bagel Man greeted me as soon as I walked in the door and cheerfully asked if I had been in before.  I smiled and said no.  As I was giving him my order.  I asked him if he made the bagels on the premises; he cheerfully said yes and I told him I was excited to give them a try.  He said that I would be back!  He told me how he prepared them and I told him that I realy enjoyed the bagles in New York; he said I would be happy I found the shop!  He was right!  The bagels are perfectly crispy on the outside and tender on the inside with wonderful flavor.  When I bite into one I can see the Statue of Liberty through the misty haze...  ...anyway The Bagel Man is highly recommened and you won't be disappionted!

T2lW7Qu357_K8b6RkjUZ6w.text: I've been here multiple times and I have to admit a boiled bagel is so much better than a baked bagel. The owner convinced me to skip toasting the bagel. I was surprised at the outer crunch and inner chewiness. Delicious! My only complaint is sometimes they skimp on the cream cheese, which made me disappointed, because it is so amazing. Hands down, best bagel I've ever had! I'm so glad this little gem is close to my home!

iRXtacLdJIybcyzUlovpxA.text: Best breakfast bagel sandwich I ever had!

87P2IaAgjPqX80X6f-2SkA.text: The food here is amazing! Love how they use good ingredients and make their bread the old traditional way. Plus it's a private small business who I much rather support than some big corp.

jnWZArSAAueYmXuI6FxoMA.text: Awesome people, great variety will definitely return and recommend. We walked in were greeted by the owner very nice man.

8afSDlf_2k2Wx_KpJfnQJg.text: This place is spectacular. I had an everything bagel with egg, bacon and American cheese. Not too filling, reasonably priced. I'll definitely be back here soon.

Mijf4rzD6z_rxoX8VRcGmA.text: I have been eating here since this place has opened and it is DELISH. The Bagel Man makes the bagels fresh every morning. He uses Boar's Head meats mmmm. I love this place.

vprQkyR_uVKxLc0RPn8sxg.text: I stumbled upon this lil gem this morning via my homey Yelp, and once again it steered me right!  These bagels are delicious!  The perfect consistency, density, chewiness, and they boil em!  The way they are supposed to be made... Unlike that chain place out here in the desert :) it's a tiny lil shop in a strip mall and kind of hidden but seek it out and stop in!  Great prices and quality food.  Breakfast and lunch sandwiches as well as some pastries and fresh made cream cheese in house!  Only downfalls would be the size of the place and it was really hot in there.  Just get your food to go and the problem is solved :)

oCmHmayJiheI56GS8CVy3g.text: I've had bagels around Az for the past 10 years. This place is definitely the best, the owner has another location in New Jersey. Great service and food! Highly recommended.

KiPqlp0sjtikMvh4OOzwGw.text: Damn. Flew in from Detroit pretty much just for these bagels. They were unreal and I felt like I was in a Seinfeld episode.

dkzw0eEQyE2hIZuiBJcyZQ.text: What an amazing bagel! I had a ham, egg and cheese sandwich on a plain bagel and made "nom nom nom" sounds during every bite. I will be coming here every time I am in the neighborhood.

2Hww_QsJQeIr8gkscMaiuw.text: Love this place. I thought Long Island was the only place to get an amazing bacon egg and cheese. Bagels are fantastic!

eaMDVKbt9reyErIITaQDTQ.text: I love love love this place.  Cal and my fave sandwich maker, Patrice, are simply great people.  These are authentic bagels, definitely the best by far in Ahwatukee, and I would wager to guess in the Valley.  No sense trying others, when this place is in my neighborhood.  Stop by and give 'em a try!

B0pwcTSB52_1J3jYf7zrMw.text: Definitely the best bagels I have had in AZ!  Very fresh and soft, as well as a lot of options to choose from.

WHP8dEJgSHksAQ9A_vFC_w.text: I just found this place and it is very good.  The cream cheese is great and the bagels are delicious.

L2iapMdrctv8J4Epk4mLag.text: Great service, great taste and perfect product...try a Bialy they are the best!

zqZKoZ1OHDsZuWEuvQmdvg.text: Best bagel I have had in a very long time. Yum!

o1Puux46hiQAOo71bcvuJg.text: Love this place! My husband and I came here for the first time this morning. It was soooo good! The bagels were fresh and the cream cheese was very tasty! I got the sausage, egg, and cheese (with a side of jalapeno cream cheese) it was very good. I just wished they had a complete list of all the types of cream cheese they have, maybe they do and I missed it. The place is very small. We were going to eat there but there was no place to sit and it was very hot in there. But, I am not complaining. I am just saying it was a small place. They people there are very nice and friendly. We will be going back for sure...soon. :)

WXQfiJtDj3rCmGgaTRTbfw.text: I stopped here bc of the pretty good yelp ratting. Yelp reviews can be brutal. Brought these to the office everyone loved them one said the best she ever had. People that are complaining about the softness are correct. They have a crisp outside and very soft inside. I thought they were outstanding by far the best I had in the US for bagel or bread. I moved here from Europe and I have had a hard time finding great bread this is really good. Definitely worth giving a try.

UazyAs57rC8jiURNJtMIIw.text: I don't normally try little places like this, but I'm so glad I did (thanks to the other reviews on here)! It was a small little shop in a shopping plaza, with several two-person tables. As I was waiting, several other obviously regular customers came in, and the owner automatically knew what each of them wanted. Very friendly. I got a bacon, egg, and cheese everything bagel, and my two small kids shared a blueberry bagel with cream cheese. I tried a bite of theirs, and it was really good...the cream cheese was clearly handmade and delicious. My bagel was also absolutely amazing. They put plenty of each food on it, and good quality ingredients. The bagel itself was delicious and a perfect texture. Around $6 for the two bagels. Any time we are in Phoenix again, we will definitely be going here.

EqNTMphnjxGJ0RhpIxwOkQ.text: This is a very nice little bagel shop and Cal is a very sweet man who cares about his customers. The food is good, not great, but is a nice place to go and get a bagel in the AM.

k21IvIkDHNO7t28dvRimrA.text: Really good and fresh bagels.  Nice people too.  Plan to sit outside- the inside is tight and functional only.  You will appreciate the good food, not the atmosphere.

rP3MmMF6jpYxsSghKuMnHw.text: I sent my son there to get me a cream cheese everything bagel and a plain blueberry bagel. both were very yummy. love bagels. so many are not authentic. this place is...

z0aERm9qn8kXXvdbcPxrtw.text: best bagels in the valley, best in phoenix, best in AZ, best in the west, best outside NY and NJ! in other words, i loved it! came in yesterday just passing by (i was the brunette east coast girl). loved the doughy-ness, nice plump bagels. there seem to be a few different kinds of "real" NY bagels and these are one of them.  if you don't see me in here every day, it's only because i will get ADDICTED! coffee was not perfect. maybe i didn't get a fresh batch.

UPqnUJZDtJk-b34LR3po1w.text: Most scrumptious bagel I've ever had. I got a rich and famous sandwich on a salt bagel and it was excellent. The "bagel man" is so nice and welcoming. Macaroni salad is excellent. All around great experience getting lunch here.

txD_orrGg3sLLVTYmfGPVQ.text: This place's bagels are just incredible.  They are fresh, chewy, and made on-site.  I had "The Sexy" which was awesome.  The owner rang me up and was incredibly friendly.  If you love authentic, fresh bagels, this is your place.

3xLUzcO5L7tBgkNixAaXNQ.text: I am from back east, these are HANDS DOWN the best bagels I have tasted in AZ.

DgQJWSLOxhf4z9iGyb3UDA.text: Great bagels & bialys! Stop by for a cup of perfect coffee, you won't be disappointed!

TrfS1-R-Z2Y77jGUgmpd1w.text: These bagels are beyond fabulous!!!  The owner has a friendly smile and comment for everyone.  Hands down the best bagels I have ever had in AZ.  This place truly is a gem!

9o7YXVVaxGYy3tmCZU9UWQ.text: I was born and raised in NY and this place is the ONLY place in AZ that does it right. After searching for 8 years, I finally found this place.  I promise you us New Yorkers know what we're talking about when it comes to bagels..and this place is the real deal.  And to Kristen B-  When every other review is a great score and you write a bad review because an owner was talking to an employee and there were crumbs on the floor you sound like an ignorant idiot. There are only 2 people working usually and everytime I have been there it has been PACKED so you probably got there during or right after a rush. Also, the owner goes out of his way to interact with EVERY customer, and im there on a weekly basis so I know what im talking about;.

ArSIuX5S1OMRGscV81j1uA.text: This place is amazing! I get the everything bagel with bacon, egg and cheese. And it's always amazing! I go early in the morning so it's always a fast and easy trip for me. Everyone is always really nice and easy to please.

EVR06YH0i4ct6APNgRzR-Q.text: Good 'Bagels just not clean enough inside store location. A coworker was generous enough to bring 'Bagels into work from 'The Bagels Man, I decided the 'Bagels was so good! I'll stop by store location, surprise my daughter with 'Bagels in the morning, only to walk-in and see 'Bagels sitting out in the open, flys flying all around the 'Bagels on top of that store was NOT THE CLEANEST! If my coworker knew, this place wasn't the CLEANEST! WONDER HOW HER HOUSE LOOK IN THE INSIDE??? IS IT CLEAN! Sense you can bring 'Bagels into work, from The Bagels Man THAT HAS FLYS FLYING ALL AROUND THERE BAGELS!!!!!!

NeipYc7M0o6gqJbTSzTRgA.text: Great bagels in AZ! Jersey style will always have my heart, but this stop is my go to in Ahwatukee! Vegan options available always a plus for me / Hummus, potatoes, PB&J! Service always great - fast and friendly!

umQNYizrIWnOLiksSFvH2w.text: Yummy bagels and cream. My favorite is jalapeno bagel and veggie cream cheese toasted. Me and my boyfriend love going there.

WeVtvnXuGS7wQ-1_tVHUYg.text: Happy to have found a local, East-Coast feel for a bagel shop. Their sandwiches are great. I usually get egg, bacon, and cheese on a plain bagel...toasted. Mmmmmm.  The big guy who runs the place tends to stare down other big guys but maybe that's an East Coast thing too.   Small area, but fast service.

CGHMjc-f2EF2GqtnvrIkgA.text: Best bagels in town. The owner is an incredible guy and so nice. He is so well respected in the community. Never disappointed when I get a bagel. Quick service for always having a large line. Love this place.

oAFVFgzaEjudikwG2vwxFA.text: I have eaten bagels here for 8 years and have never had a bad bagel, they're always fresh. However today I was very disappointed. If you're paying $9 for a bagel with lox & the works, you expect it to be worth it but I was disappointed. I had to come home and add more cream cheese and capers, that was fine,...what was so upsetting is that the bagel was at least one day old so it was stale and not the usual quality. I was so surprised because I have had great bagels here for so long! The owner made the bagel too which was so upsetting. I will give The Bagel Man another try because as I stated they're usually fantastic but I hope today was just an " off " day. Cal is great but he's going to have to continue with his usual quality product for me to keep coming back.

ZYzmTXuOihV1uxHBGY4XKw.text: The bagels are good an i would go back but the best bagels in Phoenix is back east bagel are great southern an Mc Clintock  and better price as well for a baker dozen ..  Chompies are good too an little cheaper if you order butter  bagel an if you go Weds you get 18 bagels for the price of a baker dozen.But i still go to the bagel man because it's closed to where i live.

qd-UAPnMgai0PFlDcmGAWw.text: Great service. The food is fresh and good the only downside is that they always run out of bagels

NBjWcw628p3OtzXmMWvd1Q.text: Super nice, helpful owner who has been making bagels in New Jersey and AZ for 30+ years.  It shows!  Bagels are large and fluffy with a decent crust. Toppings on both sides and great homemade cream cheeses. Veggie is my favorite! Can't go wrong here and we've already been back a few times in just a few weeks!

96T0PXjGy13ZevWcO929Uw.text: Wow! The lox bagel sans tomato and the blueberry bagel with strawberry cream cheese...yeah you heard right. Who the heck eats two bagels for breakfast... the blueberry was originally supposed to be for breakfast tomorrow but i just couldn't help myself. True New York bagels that are incredibly soft on the inside. Mmm mmm mm!! I'll be here all week and will certainly be going back!!!

f1kaS44L6C2pzelExPTTww.text: Omg! Being an old school Jewish gal, Arizona has garbage for bagels. I've lived here since 79, and. I had never found an authentic bagel. Until Now! Found on complete accident, through Google, craving a bagel. Wow! I sat in my Jeep, like a pig in heaven! Yum! Drool! I had two! I want more! This is my forever bagel joint! It's an old school joint! Love!

_7LV1AK9NFIA1cRLq1rT1g.text: I cannot stress this enough. If you arrive here while the Bagels are coming fresh out of the oven DO NOT order them toasted. The fresh bagel is perfection. It will be crackly on the outside and chewy and tender on the inside. Toasting is for store bought bagels.  The service here is a little haphazard, many of the workers will try and take your order, just talk to one of them and your order will be fulfilled. I had an Everything Bagel with Sliced Lox Sandwich. 3 days in a row. And while the salty Lox maybe the big draw for some, the bagel was the star of the show. Long meetings and lactose intolerance prevented me from enjoying the simple delights of a Bagel and Cream Cheese (of which they have many flavors). But I can tell you these Bagels are good enough to eat dry.  Do not miss out on this place. If you are staying at the Sheraton, brave that 120 parking lot. It is worth even that.

KKD6ry3KjgbRyidXpwZElg.text: Honestly, you can taste that everything was fresh. It may take a little longer than chains - as everything is made fresh in the back by 1 person - but it's worth it! The everything bagel was fresh out of the oven, warm and was soft with a crunch exterior. SOOO GOOOD. And don't get me started on the veggie cream cheese. You could taste the veggies and could actually make out what was in it.   The owner was running the register and was super sweet telling everyone happy Friday.   I'm never going to another bagel place again.

t6RvNP5efIVsy8R16AyYIg.text: I, like many others, am from New York. So I have high expectations when it comes to bagels. I moved 6 years ago to CA and could not find a single bagel place that even touched what I was used to. So I'd have my mom just send me bagels! Although not as a fresh, it was a better alternative. So, when I moved to Tempe, I was VERY skeptical to find a place that I'd like.  I looked up bagel shops on Yelp and found The Bagel Man. Many other east coasters approved so I figured I'd give it a try. I went in on a Sunday morning around 7:30am and there were only a few people there. I think I was in and out in about 5 minutes! Their customer service was fantastic!  The bagels themselves were exactly what I was hoping for. They were crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. Tasted like NY heaven to me!   The only downfall I had was that my bagel was a bit too over cooked and a little burnt-ish on the outside. But I bought a half dozen and no others were like that. I'd give them a 4.5 stars if I could. I certainly will be going back!!

GwiL2CCiXZXO_xLYMZMHQQ.text: This place is a must at least every month. They have some unique offerings. The bagels can get pricey if you add lots on, but simple and plain is always best.

Mp_PMVX-zCqLR01NpUFNvw.text: I don't need to write a review because everyone knows that the bagel man is the best vegan in AZ. If you don't believe me just give it try

MbKmVG3toEphQzZk56EJnA.text: My absolute favorite! The staff is fast and awesome. The owner is great and super friendly. But the bagels. The bagels. They are to die for! Hands down the best I've EVER had! Great job Bagel Man, you've nailed it.   I always get a cheese bagel toasted with jalapeno cream cheese smear, so delicious. Their sandwiches are are great for breakfast and lunch.   If you are in the area do yourself a favor and get acquainted with the Bagel Man!

-EOekE73wOK9waEb-s6f_g.text: My wife and I went to The Bagel Man for a quick breakfast after a few days at a nearby resort.  The excellent service, fair prices, and delicious bagel sandwiches were exactly what we needed.  We met The Bagel Man himself.  He strolled through the door with a smile, greeted everyone, put on an apron and headed to the back to make some more everything bagels (we just took the last one).    This is the kind of bagel shop I love to find.  Great for breakfast or lunch.  Their bagels and cream cheeses are all homemade, and you can taste the difference!

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;The Rich Man&#34; on a garlic bagel with macaroni salad.

N9Ti8sPHlpMwpEW7kQ6DaA.text: My New Yorker hubby feels like he's back on Long Island! This place is legit!! Lox on Everything bagel is amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States

6tX1xaadRZ5DYNiU1_nTwQ.text: Arizona bagels almost always leave my heart yearning for New York City, but this bagel shop took us there and beyond! The bagels are fresh and delicious- a warm fluffy inside and a perfect toasty outside. The generous amounts of smear was homemade and flavorful. Most importantly was the man selling us bagels. He was SO sweet and friendly and put extra love into our order. It was like he took his shop in NYC and transplanted it off of Elliot. He was the bagel man!   This will be a regular stop on our trips to Phoenix for sure. Can't say enough good things!

2fRs38BCaGvJ9ChV-e6iNQ.text: Great bagels! So fresh and chewy.... mmmm.....

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States

rhWw51X7Slp_4_W2mEKgQQ.text: The best bagels in Phoenix! The staff seem like great people too. We will definitely be back!

JAOG3uiy6EZQrvYma0RGlg.text: I love the food and the prices it's very fair and the best begel shop in the valley... But ever since the owner hired a bunch of young kids i haven't wanted to go back... The kids have messed up my order 3 out of four times and they all have attitudes when you go in. I want the owner to come back and run it again.

LYfDvV76lkMJg9uyK9joaw.text: Bagel Man's rudeness exceeds his lack of business sense.   When trying to buy 6 pumpernickel, 6 whole wheat, and some egg bagels, Bagel Man snapped "My bagels are expensive and you will be taking them away from my other customers."  What's that all about?   Isn't Bagel Man in the business to make and sell bagels?  When presenting a coupon to buy a dozen and get 3 free (which we've used many times) we were told that the coupon was counterfeit and he did not want to honor it, but did so with a growl of anger.  Another problem is the inconsistency of the bagels.  Sometimes they are dry and when cut, have air holes.   Sometimes they are uneven with rather large holes and misshapen.  Sometimes they have a crusty outside like they have been egg washed.  I've actually cut one and the whole outside crust fell off, leaving very little bagel left. The place is dirty and tables and floor are speckled with crumbs.    Bagel Man should be baking enough bagels to satisfy all his customers, not scold them for ordering them.  We have given up on Bagel Man.

55gqvY2QjTgdyuLvA0argQ.text: This is the best place to get a bagel in ahwatukee! The bagels are made fresh continuously throughout the day. Everytime I go i get a salt bagel. It is the only place around to get it. It is fast and cheap! Bagel and cream cheese is like $3! 100% recommend!

d-4jYrC2yfawYaIB45MpKQ.text: Im not a big fan of bagels since I'm used to the stored bought kind like Sarah Lee and Costco brand.  I think in general bagels are thick and doughy.   Starbucks, Einstein bagels are the same in my opinion.  However I found bagel man on yelp as I was looking for a breakfast joint.  I'll have to admit The bagels are the best in town as they are made fresh everyday.  I had the lox onion bagel with cream cheese scallions and my husband had the works on a garlic bagel.   That's was the beginning of my bagel addiction.  I come atleast twice a week and get the breakfast bagel that comes with bacon, egg and cheese.  They have a variety of bagels to choose from and I've had a few and they all taste great.  Go get yours today!

CoPFIXUqtH-FhPAFW9efkg.text: Best bagels around.. no comparison. The owner runs a great business and the food is great! Love the breakfast bagels and my kids do too. Highly recommend!

c1X3B1w8Bb8xOcEqtRjaJg.text: Great bagel shop. Love the sandwiches and breakfast. Everything is made to order and delicious. Can get crowded but that's because it's successful.

pVBy-SSxdyH1vGuIdW23bg.text: Hands down, best bagel in Arizona. This bagel shop dishes up original NY style bagels. Inexpensive, unassuming and always great service. keep it up guys!

Pc9aeR7CyWA80RCwgLf-6A.text: A must go if  you like the small cafe style shop. Bagels are fresh in house along with the cream cheese being hand whipped. Don't forget the price,  very affordable. Highly recommended!!!!!!!!!!

G-WDPP2KbW-9_lqOBrH7KA.text: Best New York style bagels....hands down! So soft and flavorful. Can't go wrong with this place.

YOrxm0EY_cuWryfdtSAfpw.text: I heard about this place from a co-worker. It's close to my office, so I checked it out. I am a New Yorker, born and raised, and I love my bagels. This place is hands down THE BEST bagel west of the Mississippi. If you love authentic NY style bagels, search no further. Puts Chompie's to shame. Delicious bagels, friendly staff, great prices, and fast service. Please check this place out!!

qLb3dJ7voB3iZEZLgyIICA.text: Best bagels I've ever had. Before this place I thought I knew what bagels were about, but I was so wrong. I can't reccomend this place enough. Be sure to get their early though, they have quite a fan base

Jp1rnJCj4HsrFGtKhgv8Hg.text: Hands down the best bagel in Arizona.  Hands down the best bagel sandwiches in Arizona.  So fresh they make you angry at all of the time you wasted eating at Einstein's.  So reasonably priced they make you wonder why you don't come here everyday.    Crackly crust, tender dough, toppings on both sides of the bagel.  Perfection.

abbXbswEiYLRGXaVNNtm2A.text: Best bagels in Arizona.  Not like those round bread things you get at other places like Einstein bros and such.  Everything with bacon, egg and cheese or blueberry with ham, egg and cheese are delicious!  Go.  You will love this place!

lbEk9uiASKoqP7t6s9vlXw.text: This. Place. Was. FILTHY.  Oh my gosh.  It looked like the aftermath of a food fight - bagel chunks and crumbs all over the floor.  I won't get started on the bathroom, it was so disgusting.    The owner, the Bagel Man himself, was too busy chatting with another employee to greet me or wait on me.  A nice lady from the kitchen had to come out and help.  Apparently though, nobody but the owner is allowed to handle the money so he finally broke off his conversation and rang up the sale.  I didn't like the way he treated the nice lady and I was troubled by the way she seemed overly deferential to him and almost frightened.    Bagels are okay but nothing special.  Would NOT go back!  If the customer are is that dirty, what can the kitchen be like???

b6tD6K_Kn51h4e7l9jEnRw.text: Was told about this spot from a coworker and it did not disappoint.  Had the lox breakfast sandwich and also ordered a turkey sandwich for later - both were on a sesame bagel.   Great prices and very tasty. Will be returning soon!

zdM6bbE8Gp4DXzHCAcqfyw.text: The best bagels in AZ. My favorite is the Loks bagel minus the onions on a toasted everything bagel. Cal and his cree have this down perfectly.

xpj2hcKQU__eeQLCr6V4Uw.text: Simply the best.  Nothing else needs to be said.  You will not be disappointed. One visit and you will be hooked.

LVFXhMzMso8JKCs5pP5RmQ.text: These are probably the best bagels I have ever had. 10/10 would recommend! There are tons of amazing bagel and cream cheese options, along with breakfast sandwiches. These bagels are so fresh that the owners told me not to order them toasted. I listened to him and I will definitely go back! Great service, very quick and nicest employees. Wonderful place!

ACdHZw9KYOCMU0SJA3h6RQ.text: Do you miss NYC and the neighborhood Bagel shop...Well it moved to Phoenix.  Bagels are great with a crust/shell and soft insides, not just browned bread. Excellent base for Spreads and Sandwiches  Want to support a local business, this seems to be a family run business.  Sandwiches are great  as are the cream cheese spreads, smooth and tasty.  But I think the best part is the owner, welcoming and friendly and he remembers you after you have only been there ONCE.  I think he is from Jersey so it must be Jersey hospitality,,,Great to be welcomed into his business every time you step through the door.  No need to tell you so support local business, go get the best NYC bagel in Phoenix.  Just  happens to be in Awatukee.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Everything Bagel &amp; LOX spread

hhV2C1rXVmAy-gjxjl641A.text: I picked up a bakers dozen for the coworkers today, we are all in agreement, the best bagels around! These have the perfect chewy crust and soft fluffy center. Very nice selections of spreads as well. I highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. ROAD BAGEL!

Dmx0er0QHoRgTl5Jl3vALw.text: I decided to check this place out because the reviews on Yelp were really good, and The Bagel Man did not disappoint. I'm not kidding when I say these are the best bagels I've ever had. It sounds silly, but they're seriously so good! You can tell they are made fresh. The service is so nice and genuine. This is the best hole-in-the-wall breakfast place.

ca2_6EGqVG2AdcnJKdlo0w.text: These people are from new jersey, like me, and are the only authentic bagel place in the valley. They never overload their bagels with cream cheese and their price for lox and cream cheese is the lowest in town! Even after being frozen these bagels still maintain a crunchy outside and soft inside. They never taste dense or heavy, these are 1 of a kind.  It's a cozy small family operated place go and will not be disappointed!  Just listen to all the compliments you'll hear during EVERY visit.  You'll see why the Bagel Man is the man, OPEN EVERY DAY OF THE YEAR.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Best price AND quality in town!

9QUp3jsivmTJ6g7zJ-cUWQ.text: Found on Yelp, easy to get to. Fun friendly atmosphere, great greeting. Lots of choices, fresh bagels.  Ordered the lox and cream cheese on garlic bagel.   Hubby had scrambled egg, bacon on garlic bagel.  Bagels were good size, and they did not skimp on ingredients, including the lox, cream cheese, and capers. Most garlic bagels can't taste the garlic. This was spot on. When in Phoenix this will be our look forward to, must stop place.  Very fast service.

SKOjqhte-NiB3ATe3r2SIg.text: Just had "The Rich and Famous" on an everything bagel. The everything bagel = life. That is all.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States

784acv7sU0ipj4DDZ-qGww.text: Makes a Jersey Girl so happy and proud to eat somewhere that understands how bagels should be made. The Bagel Man gets 5 stars without any hesitation. Great food for a great price. Can't be beat!

CZ6xqTWmHL4II7WHieqjEg.text: The bagel was really good.I order a everything bagel with jalepeno cream cheese.  I went around 1pm and the bagel still tasted fresh. I asked for it lightly toasted, she toasted it perfectly. My only issue was too much cream cheese but thats no big deal would 10/10 recommend.

OlCn27Rl-KyIkE3uJl7Q_g.text: 5-stars for Bagels...but if you are looking for specialty coffee blends, other assorted baked goods, or a coffee shop hangout stop with free wifi, LOOK ELSEWHERE. My rating compares these bagels to those that I have tried out of a bag at a grocery store, to chains that claim bagels should be smart, and to the only other family owned shop in the east valley that claims they know bagels for 'back east'. Bagel man bagels are exeptionally larger and pretty much consistent in their round,donut-shape, something that constantly bothers me about the competitor. Because these have a consistant round puffy shape, they might not be as dense and crusty on the outside when stored and reheated in the toaster, which is what I like to do. Bottom line, i like the huge, round puffy shape. I also love their walnut rasin cream cheese but for me this is definitely an eat the same day bagel, which is fine with me. This is a very basic, tiny, family owned shop that specializes in very good bagels and a few freshly made cream cheese selections. It has a counter with basic coffee and a fountain drink machine, that's all!!! Come here and rate it for the bagels only.

XN075QGmEX5O4n9BkWPoGA.text: The only bagels in Arizona that meet my high Brooklyn standards. These bagels are flaky, crusty, everything that a real bagel, not a round piece of bread with a hole inside, should be. He's even stuck to real bagel types, as you won't find any prissy blueberry or cinnamon sugar bagels like you'd find at Einstein Bros. The owner, Kal, is a Jersey native, so he's as qualified as they come for bagel making. He cares a lot about his product and his customers, and knows almost everyone who walks in the door by name. Every time I visit, he remembers that I drive from Phoenix, want a baker's dozen, and need extra freezer bags. Also he has egg bagels. Yay egg bagels!  Last time I went, he even agreed to start making egg everything bagels for me (egg bagels with the everything bagel's topping set). So stop on in and get one!

Pfrc5IMWjHxKJr_Q07XrvQ.text: Great bagels and so nice! Get 'em to go because dining room is warm. The veggie cream cheese is delicious! The whole wheat bagel was yummy and my kids adored the plain with cream cheese!

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jacob enjoyed The Bagel Man! He is the pickiest eater the world has ever known.

vzaRxREvu3pfcBnO5Jj5LA.text: I don't know what changed here but the service issues have been 'highly improved'. Keep it up bagel man!

R9d0io8a6rYjwGNBMKY6Zg.text: I had a plain bagel w/ plain cream cheese and it was delicious! Staff was kind and helpful and the prices were very affordable!

wQoXMh3JzJnAKhyZzB-C4Q.text: First time here last Saturday, got the egg, ham and cheese on a jalapeno bagel with cream cheese. It's a really good value and the bagel was one of the best I've had. I'll definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Scrambled eggs, cheese &amp; ham on jalapeño bagel with plain cream cheese. Delicious!

_tBiNUXsk5hIe6Mqpc7iWg.text: Say no to fast food on a road trip... this place was amazing and right off the 10. The lox was fresh. The olive cream cheese spread on point. It is very fresh so can be drippy but worth the mess. Definitely will be back.

fSNlmmEhppozhhnsTmGBKQ.text: The best bagel by far you'll find around here, nothing else even compares. They've fixed the issue of writing down large orders and it's really made a difference in the quality. Love the bagel man and will return

c8VbjYQe48kBokYRF-UysQ.text: Bagel Man is so good I was inspired to write an advertising jingle about the place.  Seriously.  The first thing you have to order is the egg and cheese . . . but with bacon, sausage AND roast ham.  Do it.  Check out the pic I posted . . . LOOK at that cross-section  Next, get wild and crazy.  Get the Lox . . . special ordered with bacon.  Yes.  Trust me.  Unkosher that bad boy.  Garlic toasted bagel, house made scallion cream cheese, Lox AND bacon.  The silky smoked salmon with crispy bacon . . . fantastic.  Everything is held together with excellent bagels that frankly put Chompie's to shame.  Seriously.  And the house made cream cheeses . . . smooth and creamy and decadent.  Yes, decadent.  And they certainly do not skimp on the bacon.  If you live and/or work in northern Ahwatukee, you need to hit this place up

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Special ordered Lox AND bacon, on a toasted garlic bagel with scallion cream cheese.  Do it
Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg and Cheese with Bacon AND Ham AND Sausage on a Sesame Bagel.  Look at that cross-section!  Do it

EhTmWCXB9nwRSRo_2D0WxA.text: Outstanding True NY style bagels and friendly staff. Found this place on Yelp and read nothing but great reviews and took entire family here for breakfast while on vacation. The bagels are so soft yet have a perfect little crisp/crunch to them. I got a bacon, egg, cheese bagel and it was to die for. Give The Bagel Man a try....you won't be disappointed.

07sqhb1hFxcL1gyzMlRmuw.text: I love the bagel man! Such a nice group of workers. Super fast and still friendly. Bagels are amazing!!!

UdsqlFcrVu3J2c5ksR2V1w.text: Been traveling for 6 hours. We were hungry for breakfast, but didn't want fast food. IHOP also didn't have a great rating so luckily we found this place.  Had a great breakfast bagel sandwich. It was and very satisfying.  The line was out the door, but it was worth it.

Yk8dGxiHvgDWvD6KtHT4eQ.text: 4.5* rounded up because the round dough with holes in the center trying to pass for bagels in PHX & Las Vegas are so severely lacking in any semblance to what they are supposed to be, that when I find a place like this, after kissing the ground like the Pope, I round up. The Man knows how to make bagels, people. And bialys! Bialys, I tell you: I wanted to cry when I saw them.   Anywho, my SILs have lived in the 'Tuk forever,  when we moved here they told us see the Man about some NY style bagels. The first time we went it was at opening, and our bagels were still hot! The salt and pumpernickel are my favorites; Scott is an everything or egg man: "Goo goo g' joob" (that's the Beatles, millennials) When my Mom was here, she asked for bagels every day: Brooklyn born and bred stamp of approval!  They do run out of bagels early, you will encounter a line occasionally, but they move quick. 5* as good as it gets in PHX fo sho!   * closed Mondays * ** they have deli sammies ** ** breakfast menu *** **** nice lox and yummy homemade cream cheese varieties ****

L2iDEaboqrcqk7j4Jz29zg.text: The bagels are so fresh!! They are very large and soft. The staff moves quickly and the scallion cream cheese is amazing.

YX9IYadbvghtEpxDi6MZVw.text: These are the best bagels around by far!  If you like bagles like I do, you have got to try The Bagel Man.  Everything is great!
