Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Always a line, but it moves quick!

9n4QD17i_2yTJoyy4gBtZQ.text: The bagels were delicious. It was warm and toasty in there as well. Plus, the eggs were real - which was awesome.  However, they use American cheese on the egg and cheese sandwiches and it really ruined it for me.  Would go back again, and ask for no cheese!

V0HfIOgkDocFNMULulDVdA.text: Absolutely the Best bagels around. Have to get there early before all your favorites are gone.

XSf7Yc_dbE7z0LqwsWmuPA.text: The turkey bagel for $10 was horrible! The turkey tasted so old I could not eat it! Stick to the bagel with cream cheese only!!

mdS-JLkGwjfOQGnYLuf82w.text: I think the thing for those who don't know good bagels is that they see bagels as bread that you spread butter or cream cheese on and it may have some sort of toppings . For someone who really knows the real thing, it is so different than that. Maybe it's nostalgia for the delectable deliciousness of a semi hard exterior with a fluffy interior. Or the subtle semi salty after taste. The smear should also be of high quality. It's not Philadelphia cream cheese. A good bagel place will make their own.  The Bagel man is definitely that. This is by far the best bagel place west of the Mississippi. It honestly competes and is on par with what New York has to offer. The owner is a kind man who knows what he is doing and remembers his customers even after long absences.

dA_apQvQ9SM4hNsLEIYQRA.text: All of the non 5 star reviews on here are funny. THIS PLACE IS AWESOME. I grew up right outside NYC and this place is the real deal. Great bagels! Who cares if it has a whole in the middle or not... lmao. Personally no whole means more bagel. I'll take no whole. If you don't like this place, don't go. It'll help make the line a little shorter when I want to go. Love this place!!!

xB1r3sLW_DGpzrnwgsXIag.text: I'm an everything bagel kinda guys and heck if you're into it go for the lox with the Worx.    This is the best bagel in Phoenix.  -New Yorker

SSlrRALaW82divcagd61Zg.text: This place is a hidden gem for people who do not live in the area... I'm a huge bagel fan but the bagel sandwiches take it to a whole new level! I got the everything bagel, jalapeno cream cheese, bacon, and egg sandwich and was absolutely thrilled!   The family owned feel and service here is outstanding... everyone was so nice and helpful and  made the sandwich perfectly! We are excited to continue coming to the bagelman and inviting our friends to try this hidden gem!

J2JasSZiZYWUk7odnZuEQg.text: If you're in the area, stop by The Bagel Man for a bagel for breakfast ... you won't be disappointed! We finally found the opportune time to go in & I got something a little different - a cheese bagel with scallion cream cheese & my date got the Egg & Lox bagel with the works. The bagels were really big and fluffy; I'm hoping they're hot and fresh the entire day, but as we had gone in pretty early in the day, they definitely were. There was a bit too much cream cheese on the bagel but it was easily spread off.  I'm a huge fan of bagels as it is, so it's plain & simple - we'll be back!

UszkirXfsXJGyDcG_pll2A.text: Just moved to Tempe for college and holy crap these bagels are amazing. I got the blueberry with the raisin walnut cream cheese and it was amazing. The owner is extremely nice and explained he doesn't make the egg bagel anymore because he couldn't get it perfect so he didn't want to upset customers. Amazing to see a business owner care more about the customers' satisfaction than money.

r7djuCxYiz8_8Eri4_kMdA.text: i love this place so much!!!!! the bagels r yummy in my tummy! #bestbagelsever  ps- if u don't eat here ur an actual idiot

yR8WKWoTsm81aQrHW5lcrQ.text: Wow, these bagels are thick and delicious, perfect texture. I got an everything bagel with veggie cream cheese- yum! Like the owner said, this may be our first time, but it won't be our last time here! We'll be back for sure! This is the most authentic bagel place I've ever been to, like you can tell that these people really know and love bagels.

lE304-GhbbdGefuA_Tnoeg.text: Easily the best bagels in all of AZ!!! I go here ALL the time! They're SO nice and make the best bagels ever! Just as good as NYC bagels

Yb_axZpWtsGcCN1OjAMp1w.text: Best bagel shop I've ever been to, kills anywhere on Maui and half the price! Fresh huge bagels and a New York flair of soft cream cheese and really fresh ingredients. Owner is a great guy, too. He gave me samples for the road, even.

RkE6I5XQk0dOcZtA3KKqXg.text: The ratings are True. Go get one and enjoy the best everything bagel you'll ever have.

v1ksAKmkiptDdB7vtZxN3w.text: Great bagels, great coffee, great coffee cake.  A perfect breakfast!  Friendly staff and happy customers.

JmWBn-CV-EPPpDgWOH1IMA.text: This place is delicious! It has authentic New York style bagels and cream cheese. I especially enjoy their onion bagel toasted with veggie cream cheese. Their iced coffee is also top notch. I will be back and will recommend to all my friends and family! Keep it up Bagel Man!! You make my mornings so happy!

NzH9Y_K81ztK2izBd3LSvg.text: Best bagels in AZ. Hands down.  Owner is there every time. Big smile, great service, friendly staff. The owner remembers repeat customers, their fav orders and keeps the busy, busy line moving quickly. Always packed but never a long wait. Would still be worth it if it was!

46Ukz_GhZQG33s4gywigzg.text: Headed out on a business trip and didn't have enough time to make breakfast so I looked up some local shops that made breakfast foods.  Line for this place was long which is typically a good indicator that it's good. Line moves extreme quick to my surprise and I ordered the sausage egg and cheese on a raisin bagel.  Not only was it ready in less than 5 minutes but it also was still warm 25 minutes after getting to my destination where I could sit down and eat it.  The only reason I gave this 4 stars and not 5 is because they don't allow you to place phone orders.   Other than that I recommend you give this place a try as their food is on point!

VwiFuwxBf6wNorNGqdhWCw.text: The energy in this place reminded me of why I love small businesses. The owner new regulars by name, caught up with familiar faces that have moved away from the area but stopped by for some bagel goodness.  And the most important aspect was the quality of the food. You can feel the love and expertise that's put into the bagels here. Even though I got the Reuben (excellent choice), I couldn't help but sampling my wife's and Son's bagels. The crispy outside, soft interior, and flavorful cream cheese smear made it a winner!

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wn3Tq5zaFkmYGO690lzRew.text: After waiting in line for 15 minutes I ordered a dozen bagels. While bagging up my order the man took bagels of my bag for the person in front of me. He asked me what other bagels did I want, I told him, but he didn't add them. When I got home, I had 9 bagels and paid 12.00 for a dozen. The closed right after we bought our order so no correction .   Taste - These taste good. If you like soft slightly sweet pizza crust, this is what it taste like. Slightly crusty on the outside and spongy soft on the inside with cornmeal on the bottom. Not worth the price I paid for them though.

PJu3Wv0Wg0yFCTx10JxIuQ.text: Great bagels.  I had the roast beef on a salt bagel.  Great!  It was 1pm and I had the last salt bagel.  You might need to get their earlier if you are set on a specific type.    He has a great reputation and the bagels are sold quickly by the dozen.  It is a small shop, bagels made onsite. I would call ahead if you need a large order.

9p7240-5uVTXosdIUm4HvA.text: Okay, this place has basically the best bagels I've ever had. They are fresh, delicious, and the perfect size to satisfy the hunger beast without overdoing it.   We walked in and were greeted by some awesome staff! They were all way nice and helpful with recommendations. As we looked over the menu a few people stopped in that seemed to be regulars, and they knew their names, orders, and asked them about personal things they had done that they obviously had heard about last time. Nice work! That's a touch of customer service many restaurants will never get to.  The bacon breakfast bagel on the salt bagel was delicious! And the everything with the cinnamon walnut spread was amazing. I'm really sad I'm only in town for a day or two or this would be my new weekly go to.

Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States

lKoZGzqHMjlsW9_N8RQONA.text: The bagels here are extremely fresh and soft. The cream cheese is always flavorful and the texture is perfect. Beware- they will sell out. Many times, I have come here past 11 and most of the bagels have been sold. If you want the full selection, come early or on a week day! It's definitely worth the trip.

9KdfeGlPpZ9LN6SIYMk0fw.text: I love this place.  So many selections without the crowd at other outstanding bagel places. This place in Ahwatukee can be hard to find just by driving tucked away with other great restaurants.  Would highly recommended to anyone who LOVES everything bagels.

nxlvAzYklmXvDyDohTrReg.text: It was a great fresh bagels that I every taste they have different cream cheeses.  my husband had a sandwich of ham and cheese he love it they make bagel fresh everyday

pVcDKDtxPC135wLZSv7E6w.text: This place is a hole in the wall with authentic New York style bagels.  They are delicious.  The reason I am rating it with one star is because the owner talks to his employees like they are dirt.  It's straight up abusive and that's what keeps me from going there often.  Who wants to see, hear, witness that when trying to get their bagel? It's just awful and he needs to realize that the employee are the heart of that business and treat them well.

eAOO4cRJ48gBsL3talnyEw.text: Stopped here on the way to the airport and WOW! Such amazing customer service, delicious food! Homemade bagel and smears, no microwaves just the grill. Very impressed! Highly recommended!

OkOIA2zYc1pmTBpstcUGuQ.text: Do you know "The Bagel Man"? That serves off Elliot Road?! Best bagel hands down in PhX

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The works . Lox bagel

3GH_xqFWkdOrgr0bPZuplA.text: Hands down the best bagels and cream cheese I've EVER had. Customer service is always on point too. Owner is always there too.

RiL5FJJRaQkhSKF-ZNSlbA.text: The service was great & the food was even better!! We got a bacon, egg and cheese on an everything bagel & the Show Off bagel. Highly recommend! It was also fast so we were in and out in 5 minutes!! Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Ig77ItO0tZSyBmky5hGsCQ.text: I had heard good things about this place. I'm home sick today, so I ordered with postmates delivery service. I ordered 2 cinnamon raisin bagels w/ smears and 2 savory bagel sandwiches. On postmates it gave an option to choose bread or bagel with the sandwiches, but not a type of bagel. The driver called me and told me they made the sandwiches on cinnamon raisin bagels. I asked him to see if they would remake them, as this was not what I ordered and it makes no sense to make an egg salad sandwich on a cinnamon raisin bagel. They refused to remake them and charged me for them. This isn't what I ordered. Now I have to spend even more money to order food somewhere else. The food I was able to eat was so/ so at the best. As a local business owner myself this is frustrating to me that they wouldn't ensure the companies they work with have appropriate options on their app, wouldn't use common sense and wouldn't spend a couple dollars to make it right.

M7k3T6UPdo7a2le6uAtBrg.text: Two stars because of the customer service when I was over charged. I ordered a half dozen with a small cream cheese and my order was over $15. When I reiterated my order to the girl because I thought that was a little high she confirmed what I ordered. When I got my order they handed me two medium sized cream cheese containers and when I told her again I only wanted a small she said well I already charged you sorry. I'm SORRY but if someone gets what they didn't ask for it's very easy to issue the refund and give them what they ordered or at least make a little effort to make it right.....

qXeVx1f7yVGblOUpVhGPEw.text: This was my first time eating here, I have to say it won't be my last! The bagels were fresh, the breakfast sandwich was delicious and the staff was super friendly! I will be back for sure and will recommend this place to all of my friends and family.

3kFvwhuCVTLcjK7MLqTCUw.text: If you're coming to The Bagel Man, I would recommend you leaving your house/work ten minutes early because of the line. There is plenty of parking within the area and tables outside for seating. Once you're done ordering, you get your food out within a jiffy HOT and good. YUM! In my opinion, lines that goes beyond the entry of any restaurant is a good sign based on the quality of the food and the loyalty of returning customers. The Bagel Man fits the quality of the food and returning customers.

4_hB3t8n3-mLzV0J5WezOg.text: The bagels are good but they cannot get a breakfast sandwich order right.  They have messed my order up 3 times on takeout orders only.  I get charged for the extras I want but don't always get them.  It's not hard to give a customer what you charge them for.  If you get a takeout sandwich, check it before you leave.

dVQ4rueEb6yTvfC-TrWHUw.text: I stop here almost every morning.  The customer service is phenomenal and the bagels are always fresh. The cream cheese and bagel selection is consistent and fresh. I love and I'm obsessed with this place.

JssXeLJvBQ1EC541qs7gJQ.text: The lightest tastiest bagel! We had an everything bagel with sliced lox and cream cheese and an cheese bagel with egg and sausage; both delicious.

YKzxbKYeWhjiMtJ8kKkCjg.text: I have always had great bagels from Bagel Man, but today was something else. Today Bagel Man ran out of bagels (which rarely happens there, but hey, they only have the ability to make so much before an oven just can't keep up). I happened to get one of the last everything bagels and had it with tomato, onion, capers, cream cheese and lox. It was the most amazing bagel I have ever had, EVER! Cal is always so nice and recognizes his regulars. This place is such a gem. If you're in the area and it's not Monday (the one day they close) you must go!

zDhXSwJ40gf502sez4qmVg.text: This place is seriously the best in AZ! I had the everthing bagel with lox cream cheese and it was fantastic. I have never had a lox spread but it might be better than a regular lox (less of a struggle to eat). The owner was very friendly and seemed to know a lot of the other customers by name which isn't surprising because after one visit you will definitely become a regular!

YWnoSn1HrVp39COIdrbmBg.text: So excited they're open on mondays now too! 7 days!!! Amazing bagels. The everything's are incredible, but the last two saturdays I've been in they've been out of everythings, which is so disappointing. Great bacon, egg and cheese sandwiches, awesome cream cheeses, etc.

QhAZ3dH_D7C8dFrFh440Hw.text: Okay so easily the best bagels in the valley! Seriously the bagels are top notch! Five star worthy!  However I have to rate it a bit lower because of the service. It seems like anytime I go there and the actual Bagel Man(the owner) isn't there the service is absolute crap...  This morning we went and the Bagel Man wasn't there.  We ordered five bagels toasted with cream cheese. Pretty easy right? Well we ended up with only four, and on two of them there wasn't even enough cream cheese to spread around. I am sure they would have corrected it, but we were traveling for the day. We didn't discover it until later down the road.  My moral of the story: check your stuff before you go, and don't count it being right the Bagel Man himself isn't there.   Again I can't express how good the bagels are. They are simply the best!

pKlPz1OLxdVg7CuByEjD7g.text: I forgot to mention this but I have not had bagels this good in the west coast, ever! Literally feel like I'm in Stanton Island when I'm sinking teeth in these bagels and these guys definitely are very fast and they know how to run a great operation.

_KlODs0a-kW01GB-4aZdxQ.text: Do you want the best bagel in The Valley? Well I found it for you and now you can reap the benefits. After living in Phoenix for almost two decades I have officially found a round piece of dough with a hole in the middle that deserves to be called a BAGEL. For many years I could only get my bagel fix when traveling back to New York to visit friends or family. But now finally I have found a shop in Phoenix that has not only the proper taste but also the proper texture/consistency of a New York bagel. Don't bother with other imposters claiming to have "New York style bagels."  This is the only real deal in the Phoenix metro area.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salt bagel

NWZgwm9-6Q-ADyUaGNLYoQ.text: This place is amazing. AMAZING!! Maybe I am just a bit green and have never experienced a True bagel before (I am a native Phoenician) but Bagel Man seriously has the best bagels I have ever tasted in my entire life.   I stop by here once a week or so before work and usually get an egg and cheese sandwich on an everything bagel, or a cheese bagel toasted with veggie cream cheese. The prices are very, very reasonable. I think they charge me less for coffee than Circle K, and the coffee is much better. I have never been by when the coffee is cold or stale.  The bagels are not the only reason this place earns 5 stars though.. The staff at this place are absolutely delightful. They are all so nice and friendly and work very hard to get you your order as quickly as possible. The owner is always so happy, and it is really neat to see how someones business can really succeed with love, dedication and hard work.   The only thing I want to caution Yelpers about is if you plan on hitting this place before work, maybe call in your order. Sometimes it can get a bit chaotic here, and you wouldn't want to be late to work because you were waiting for your bagel!

1xNPdgn1U3CRWvg5QjdORg.text: Unassuming small mom and pop type place with nothing fancy about it. There are minimal amounts of seating inside and outside. You get your own coffee and sit down. Line was to the door but was fast. I had a bialy and butter. I asked for it well done. I wont ding them because apparently "well done" is a term that never made it to the future as time progressed from the late 80's into the 90s and onto today. However, they did manage to execute a really amazing bottom crust. The bread substance of the bialy was thicker than it should for a bialy and definitely had too much body (dense). The coffee was typical non-gourmet coffee...not the best. Due to the low cost and the most amazing crust I have had in a decade, I bumped a 3 to a 4.

5vCfq83_PFA6DhLkQ3JBgA.text: So, I hobbled my broken-footed rear-end into this place after getting a couple of amazing deliveries through door-dash. The place is TINY and it was getting pretty hot in there but, with the exception of the heat, I felt like I was time machined back to when I worked at JFK airport and it was my turn to pick up our regular order of bagels from the tiny shop just downstairs from our office.  You could almost say this guy is like a "Bagel Nazi" in the most complementary way but I think he's more like a "Bagel Whisperer."  He creates work-of-art bagels and has to train the uneducated customers.  In front of me, a guy with the whole-arm tattoos and a forward-facing Coyotes cap read off his orders (no orders are "taken" they are just spoken and relayed to the back kitchen).  He read, "One everything bagel with the bread dug out."  The owner first just looked at him like he was speaking a foreign language, and then said, "Why would you wanna do that?"  The Coyote fan said, "It's for my mother in law."  The bagel man had a serious look of disdain on his face and said very little after that.  The next guy had a little kid with him and said, "One toasted plain bagel with cream cheese..." and the Owner interrupted, "These bagels are very hot, you don't need to toast them."  The guy was about to speak again and he said, "TRUST me."  I had to speak up, "Trust him," I said.    These bagels brought me back to those days in Queens when the bagels were so fresh that the idea of toasting them was,sacrilege.   While I was waiting a good 20 minutes in line, all but three types of bagels were sold out and two pans came out to replace two types.  I'm sure this seems like a bad thing to some people but when I see bagels being brought out and being sold out constantly, I know that whatever I end up with is going to be insanely good.  Go  here!  And try read-up on and respect,  "Bageletiquette."

l_QLvXIE---Abd5yJfbxiQ.text: great bagels...crunchie on the outside (without toasting), soft on the inside.  Friendly staff and owner.

NOdcEuSdmUj7RBV0CiWOIQ.text: Been here before to get bagels for a customer. They are as close as you can get of the New York style ones, which I had once. They are really busy in the morning but always have a good number of fresh bagels. The owner of the place is usually helping customers.

QzI5VeQNB_feGgg4ErgsiA.text: The Bagel Man deserves all the rave reviews!  I was up early this morning wondering who was open at 5:30 a.m., and was also looking for a place I've never been and this joint fit the bill.  I had a honey wheat bagel toasted with the honey almond spread and it was delicious!  Warm and chewy and just what my belly needed that early in the morning.  The employees were fast and friendly too.  I've attached photos of their menu as of today.  This would be a perfect stop before a hike or bike ride on South Mountain.  And a great stop for lunch when you're done.  I can't wait to grab the unsuspecting Mr. M and go back.  The only reason I would ever go back to Einstein Bros. was if I was craving a cinn/sugar bagel.

Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu as of 1/24/13

nTzZPa1hYy2tPm3mu3HvyA.text: Great quality bagels and lunch meat! Love that they put oregano on the lunch bagels and are always so kind to give me extra. Delicious place to eat!!

BmmK2NzsdKKCvs2i2_9LIA.text: We love this place!  The bagels are so soft, even after they are toasted.  We usually get the egg, bacon and cheese on onion or jalapeno and they are delicious.  The service is always prompt and the guy that is always at the counter (I'm assuming he is the owner) knows tons of people that come in by name and he is always friendly.  I've been to other bagel places at 10am on a Saturday, and they are all out of the good bagels for the day.  That never happens at The Bagel Man.  They have a good selection throughout the day and replace flavors as they run out.

AYNGrsqxX0rar6-qVZykNg.text: I've stopped cooking breakfast on the weekends because of this place. The saugage, egg, and cheese; the new york reuben; the scallion schmear; the lox, everything's been fantastic so far. There's been a sizable line every time I've been in, but they keep things moving. Friendly service; fantastic food. If you're in the area, treat yourself.

Yjmx_y0z0ozb0rvWkfrymA.text: We live in Gilbert and made the 25 minute trek to The Bagel Man and it was worth it, you won't be disappoint the best bagels in the valley and the homemade cream cheese is awesome!

qizn9jPPp6PTSXVlaPMImw.text: The best bagels we ever had.  Also, the only went gave us a crumb cake that was so delicious!  Must try if you are in town.

ZiCCEkB7UHBIJk1DFKBWKQ.text: Best bagel I've had in a long time. Better than any I've found in California. May be the best bagel I've had more than 100 miles from the Atlantic Ocean. Thanks bagel man. Oh, and I hope your tukee stops hurting ;-).

DICl1cTkV9-2gXBPX0_Puw.text: Six months ago I moved back to Phoenix from living in NYC for a few years, and these bagels bring me back.  They are consistently baked perfectly and have that wonderful balance of chew and crisp and air and softness. Only thing I miss is the non-dairy based cream cheese options... Would love it if they offered at least one non-dairy variety.  So I usually just buy mine to go and smear at home.

g4ntIO7DTAUdifv5XEt26Q.text: This is the most basic of the basic bagel shops.  While at a work function, a coworker & I got up crazy early one morning to go on a long walk before our breakfast meeting.  That long walk turned into an insanely long walk and I feel like we walked to the next state - long story short we were hungry and wandered into some sort of industrial park with not a coffee shop to be found.  We kept walking and found a small strip mall with the only open business at the time... The Bagel Man.  We popped in for two coffees and bagels.  The Bagels were good, but I'm from the American North East - we have high standards for our bagels...so there is good and then there is GOOD.  This was good.  The coffee was basic, the service was friendly and really quick.  It is a tiny little place with very limited seating so if you don't get in early, you are likely to have a tough time finding some place to sit.  Out door seating is available - but do you really want to do that in the Arizona sun?

MllRP1-ZncWIwqKXQQdE7g.text: Bagel heaven! The most fluffy, moist bagels ever. True NY style, which are boiled before baking. These suckers are huge, fresh and there are a variety of flavor options to choose from with sandwiches, bagels and fresh cream cheese. The shop isn't anything to look at, but they make up for it with the quality of their food and the kindness of their staff. The honey walnut spread is great as are the cheese and everything bagels (not with that spread...unless special flavor combos float your boat. :-) Go at an off hour in the morning to avoid crowds and sell-outs and don't plan on eating there, as seating is sparse and cramped right against the ordering area. Must try this place!

HSw9lrumG7Eu6wXeof8IOg.text: The Bagel Man has certainly earned that title and easily at that. The attention to detail of his craft is second to none in the entire state of Arizona. Hands-down the best bagel sandwich I have ever had in AZ.  I ordered the bacon, sausage, egg and cheese sandwich on a pumpernickel rye bagel. Yes, pumpernickel rye. Not the average bagel, this one was expertly crafted and baked to perfection. The sausage was flavorful and of great quality. The bacon is thick and crispy with incredible flavor that's apparent in every bite, not that soggy "bacon" that's served at other places. This bacon was hearty. It's easy to tell that they use real cheese and they have high quality meats. The cheese was thick and melted into everything that was in the bagel. The eggs were just right, not too greasy, not too salty. Everything in the sand which was just perfect. As I said, best bagel sandwich in AZ. The coffee is piping hot, just the way I like it. Not extra bold... smooth flavor but still certainly delivers that "kick" that is needed in the morning! Definitely coming back to try the Lox on an Onion Bialy bagel and after that I must explore their lunch menu. Well deserved Five Stars for the best bagel sandwich in AZ!

o75Dmd-bnkZRwEvR0YjFOA.text: Tried this place before reading any reviews, and to my pleasant surprise, it was wonderful! Wonderful bagels, wonderful people!

rteE_LeFbESz3V3xjkKOXg.text: Great prices, fantastic bagels and a very friendly staff. Even at 6 AM on a Sunday morning.  If you want the bagel equivalent of watching your kid graduate from college, go visit the Bagel Man. Your only disappointment will come when you realize that you just ate 13 bagels in one sitting and now you have no leftover bagels.   But seriously. I ate 13 bagels in one sitting.

wg1dhZvdj4sYlzfs8CNgBA.text: Hi to my fellow foodies...  This just might be my shortest review yet!  Good bagel.. Good cream cheese... Awesome lox sandwich....   Loved that they opened at 5am so I could pick up bagels for work but I went there this morning after missing my bagel for a month or two and they were CLOSED!  It seems they DO NOT OPEN UNTIL 6am...   Although I enjoy their bagels I don't enjoy them enough to go completely out of my way...  This was my breakfast go to place.... So sad they open later now....  So long Bagelman.....  Bon appetite'

bJS1J3hfrNo5br12g6k6zQ.text: I Iove going to the bagel man!!! The bagels are always on point! I go at least once or twice a week for breakfast. However, lately the customer service has been crappy. Ever since the African American man (the bagel man) left, this new man offers the worst customer service. When I asked when the bagel man was coming back, he replied "IM THE BAGEL MAN THIS IS MY SHOP IM THE BAGEL MAN!!" I love the food but the lack of customer service is something I can't overlook. Sorry bagel man! Call me when the real bagel man returns!

7qn5BmDITtElhHyiHW3Qhw.text: Love this place! Great east coast style bagels and I love their lox.   I would give Bagel Man 5 stars but the guy at the cashier always has a bad attitude. He tends to sigh loudly, roll his eyes and corrects me when ordering. The whole ordering experience is terrible because of him, I feel as though I am a burden to him especially when I have multiple orders for my coworkers and I but at least the owner, the cooks, and the food are always fantastic!

E30kLNlMWzl1M9ZHP5y6Yg.text: This place has the best bagels in AZ hands down. Real handmade bagels from back east not rolls passed off as bagels line other chains. Owner is a great guy and learned his trade from some of the best in the business. Great place for bagels and sandwiches.

MftlRhssUY4ctwt9KAMJgg.text: The Bagel Man is the best! We use him for work lunches as well as breakfast meetings. Support your local eateries and you will be in for a treat. He makes them fresh every morning and they are as delicious as they come. You will love his homemade cream cheeses too. Great prices!

hBa1OVcXK-sNuor_A6CCFQ.text: Fantastic, delicious and fresh bagels!  Fast pleasant service!  Very big portions on the lox bagel with 'the works'.  Will definitely return.

YxUaFp9tO0jCUUos5bKbGg.text: Quaint. Clean. And straight to the point. The staff, including owner are very friendly. Food, while limited in options, is perfect. Will return soon! I had the egg salad on the everything bagel, toasted. It was an amazing experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Bagel Man - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg salad on an everything bagel. Perfection!

PdWoety739wobrMVlS09Pw.text: I love this place! I live just down the street to I'm typically here every weekend. I love their breakfast sandwiches. My boyfriend & I have breakfast here or take it to go. The boys are always nice & very fast in making your food. I absolutely do recommend.

LSPi5zosM3op-HVZ-AP6lA.text: SOOO good! Go here all the time, get the salt bagel with lox spread everytime! Super friendly owner as well :)

MKrxeKMyGPO_o9DB12Tb8w.text: Awesome place.  Just like the shops in NY and NJ.  Same quality Bagels.  They are boiled here, not just baked bread like the other places.  If you have not tried it you must.

3FKM14kZVyHsXQQxLkAYmQ.text: Seriously the best bagels I've ever had. My husband and I love this place. We took the kids and fed all 4 of us (with drinks) for $20.00. My favorite is the bacon, egg, and cheese on a cinnamon raisin bagel. The coffee is great too. We've moved now but we'll still make the drive because this place is amazing.

ogwXVfBq8CFEsSPka2Qn_g.text: As a New Jersey bagel snob, this 5star review does not come lightly.  Not only are the bagels seriously delicious, warm with just the right balance of fluffy and doughy, the staff are like family. Every time I come in (hungover or poppin fresh) I'm always greeted with a smile and the guys behind the counter do everything to make my order perfect. AND THEY HAVE PORK ROLL! Anyone from New Jersey knows that this is a serious win. TEN STARS. ALL the stars!!!

1kDitR8CrhqRa3o0WrddeA.text: Best bagels I've ever had!  The owner is very genuine and sweet and the staff is so great too!!  This place is my favorite place to go for a quick breakfast.  I love the bagel man!

hHYz-j24n9_0g9eVclCKAA.text: Super awesome bagel sandwich. I had the bacon, egg, and cheese on a everything bagel, and it was amazing!
